rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "dbghelp.dll"

rules.name: DLL Load By System Process From Suspicious Locations
rules.description: Detects when a system process (i.e. located in system32, syswow64, etc.) loads a DLL from a suspicious location or a location with permissive permissions such as "C:\Users\Public"

rules.name: Potential Libvlc.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "libvlc.dll", a DLL that is legitimately used by "VLC.exe"

rules.name: Potential RoboForm.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "roboform.dll", a DLL used by RoboForm Password Manager

rules.name: CredUI.DLL Loaded By Uncommon Process
rules.description: Detects loading of "credui.dll" and related DLLs by an uncommon process. Attackers might leverage this DLL for potential use of "CredUIPromptForCredentials" or "CredUnPackAuthenticationBufferW".

rules.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.

rules.name: Suspicious Renamed Comsvcs DLL Loaded By Rundll32
rules.description: Detects rundll32 loading a renamed comsvcs.dll to dump process memory

rules.name: UAC Bypass With Fake DLL
rules.description: Attempts to load dismcore.dll after dropping it

rules.name: Potential Vivaldi_elf.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "vivaldi_elf.dll"

rules.name: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage - Image
rules.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.

rules.name: Potential Antivirus Software DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of antivirus software suchas McAfee, Symantec...etc

rules.name: Remote DLL Load Via Rundll32.EXE
rules.description: Detects a remote DLL load event via "rundll32.exe".

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via ClassicExplorer32.dll
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using ClassicExplorer32.dll from the Classic Shell software

rules.name: Potential Edputil.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "edputil.dll"

rules.name: VMMap Unsigned Dbghelp.DLL Potential Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of an unsigned dbghelp.dll by the Sysinternals VMMap.

rules.name: Potential System DLL Sideloading From Non System Locations
rules.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs usually located in system locations (System32, SysWOW64, etc.).

rules.name: Potential Azure Browser SSO Abuse
rules.description:
Detects abusing Azure Browser SSO by requesting OAuth 2.0 refresh tokens for an Azure-AD-authenticated Windows user (i.e. the machine is joined to Azure AD and a user logs in with their Azure AD account) wanting to perform SSO authentication in the browser.
An attacker can use this to authenticate to Azure AD in a browser as that user.

rules.name: VMGuestLib DLL Sideload
rules.description: Detects DLL sideloading of VMGuestLib.dll by the WmiApSrv service.

rules.name: Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy Vssapi.dll Load
rules.description: Detects the image load of VSS DLL by uncommon executables

rules.name: Potential Iviewers.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "iviewers.dll" (OLE/COM Object Interface Viewer)

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Iscsicpl - ImageLoad
rules.description: Detects the "iscsicpl.exe" UAC bypass technique that leverages a DLL Search Order hijacking technique to load a custom DLL's from temp or a any user controlled location in the users %PATH%

rules.name: Potential Rcdll.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of rcdll.dll

rules.name: Windows Spooler Service Suspicious Binary Load
rules.description: Detect DLL Load from Spooler Service backup folder

rules.name: Potential Python DLL SideLoading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of Python DLL files.

rules.name: DotNet CLR DLL Loaded By Scripting Applications
rules.description: Detects .NET CLR DLLs being loaded by scripting applications such as wscript or cscript. This could be an indication of potential suspicious execution.

rules.name: DLL Loaded From Suspicious Location Via Cmspt.EXE
rules.description: Detects cmstp loading "dll" or "ocx" files from suspicious locations

rules.name: Potential CCleanerDU.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "CCleanerDU.dll"

rules.name: WMI Persistence - Command Line Event Consumer
rules.description: Detects WMI command line event consumers

rules.name: Microsoft Office DLL Sideload
rules.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of Microsoft Office from non standard location

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of KeyScramblerIE.DLL Via KeyScrambler.EXE
rules.description:
Detects potential DLL side loading of "KeyScramblerIE.dll" by "KeyScrambler.exe".
Various threat actors and malware have been found side loading a masqueraded "KeyScramblerIE.dll" through "KeyScrambler.exe".

rules.name: Potential Goopdate.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "goopdate.dll", a DLL used by googleupdate.exe

rules.name: Load Of RstrtMgr.DLL By An Uncommon Process
rules.description:
Detects the load of RstrtMgr DLL (Restart Manager) by an uncommon process.
This library has been used during ransomware campaigns to kill processes that would prevent file encryption by locking them (e.g. Conti ransomware, Cactus ransomware). It has also recently been seen used by the BiBi wiper for Windows.
It could also be used for anti-analysis purposes by shut downing specific processes.

rules.name: WMIC Loading Scripting Libraries
rules.description: Detects threat actors proxy executing code and bypassing application controls by leveraging wmic and the `/FORMAT` argument switch to download and execute an XSL file (i.e js, vbs, etc).

rules.name: PowerShell Core DLL Loaded Via Office Application
rules.description: Detects PowerShell core DLL being loaded by an Office Product

rules.name: Potential EACore.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "EACore.dll"

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of MpSvc.DLL
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "MpSvc.dll".

rules.name: Potential WWlib.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "wwlib.dll"

rules.name: Potential appverifUI.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "appverifUI.dll"

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via JsSchHlp
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using JUSTSYSTEMS Japanese word processor

rules.name: Potential Waveedit.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "waveedit.dll", which is part of the Nero WaveEditor audio editing software.

rules.name: Unsigned Image Loaded Into LSASS Process
rules.description: Loading unsigned image (DLL, EXE) into LSASS process

rules.name: Abusable DLL Potential Sideloading From Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of DLLs that are known to be abused from suspicious locations

rules.name: Diagnostic Library Sdiageng.DLL Loaded By Msdt.EXE
rules.description: Detects both of CVE-2022-30190 (Follina) and DogWalk vulnerabilities exploiting msdt.exe binary to load the "sdiageng.dll" library

rules.name: Suspicious Volume Shadow Copy VSS_PS.dll Load
rules.description: Detects the image load of vss_ps.dll by uncommon executables

rules.name: CLR DLL Loaded Via Office Applications
rules.description: Detects CLR DLL being loaded by an Office Product

rules.name: Python Image Load By Non-Python Process
rules.description: Detects the image load of "Python Core" by a non-Python process. This might be indicative of a Python script bundled with Py2Exe.

rules.name: Clfs.SYS Loaded By Process Located In a Potential Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects Clfs.sys being loaded by a process running from a potentially suspicious location. Clfs.sys is loaded as part of many CVEs exploits that targets Common Log File.

rules.name: Potential AVKkid.DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "AVKkid.dll"

rules.name: Third Party Software DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects DLL sideloading of DLLs that are part of third party software (zoom, discord....etc)

rules.name: DLL Sideloading Of ShellChromeAPI.DLL
rules.description:
Detects processes loading the non-existent DLL "ShellChromeAPI". One known example is the "DeviceEnroller" binary in combination with the "PhoneDeepLink" flag tries to load this DLL.
Adversaries can drop their own renamed DLL and execute it via DeviceEnroller.exe using this parameter

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Of DBGCORE.DLL
rules.description: Detects DLL sideloading of "dbgcore.dll"

rules.name: Potential Chrome Frame Helper DLL Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of "chrome_frame_helper.dll"

rules.name: VMMap Signed Dbghelp.DLL Potential Sideloading
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading of a signed dbghelp.dll by the Sysinternals VMMap.

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Raw Disk Access By Uncommon Tools
rules.description: Detects raw disk access using uncommon tools or tools that are located in suspicious locations (heavy filtering is required), which could indicate possible defense evasion attempts

rules.name: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols
rules.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.

rules.name: COM Hijack via Sdclt
rules.description: Detects changes to 'HKCU\Software\Classes\Folder\shell\open\command\DelegateExecute'

rules.name: Potential AutoLogger Sessions Tampering
rules.description: Detects tampering with autologger trace sessions which is a technique used by attackers to disable logging

rules.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom DB Path Registry Configuration
rules.description: Detects setting of a new registry database value related to BgInfo configuration. Attackers can for example set this value to save the results of the commands executed by BgInfo in order to exfiltrate information.

rules.name: Potential PSFactoryBuffer COM Hijacking
rules.description: Detects changes to the PSFactory COM InProcServer32 registry. This technique was used by RomCom to create persistence storing a malicious DLL.

rules.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom VBScript Registry Configuration
rules.description: Detects setting of a new registry value related to BgInfo configuration, which can be abused to execute custom VBScript via "BgInfo.exe"

rules.name: Potential Ransomware Activity Using LegalNotice Message
rules.description: Detect changes to the "LegalNoticeCaption" or "LegalNoticeText" registry values where the message set contains keywords often used in ransomware ransom messages

rules.name: Hide Schedule Task Via Index Value Tamper
rules.description:
Detects when the "index" value of a scheduled task is modified from the registry
Which effectively hides it from any tooling such as "schtasks /query" (Read the referenced link for more information about the effects of this technique)

rules.name: Bypass UAC Using DelegateExecute
rules.description: Bypasses User Account Control using a fileless method

rules.name: Scripted Diagnostics Turn Off Check Enabled - Registry
rules.description: Detects enabling TurnOffCheck which can be used to bypass defense of MSDT Follina vulnerability

rules.name: Suspicious Keyboard Layout Load
rules.description: Detects the keyboard preload installation with a suspicious keyboard layout, e.g. Chinese, Iranian or Vietnamese layout load in user session on systems maintained by US staff only

rules.name: Add DisallowRun Execution to Registry
rules.description: Detect set DisallowRun to 1 to prevent user running specific computer program

rules.name: Potential Persistence Using DebugPath
rules.description: Detects potential persistence using Appx DebugPath

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Shim Database In Uncommon Location
rules.description: Detects the installation of a new shim database where the file is located in a non-default location

rules.name: Driver Added To Disallowed Images In HVCI - Registry
rules.description: Detects changes to the "HVCIDisallowedImages" registry value to potentially add a driver to the list, in order to prevent it from loading.

rules.name: Change User Account Associated with the FAX Service
rules.description: Detect change of the user account associated with the FAX service to avoid the escalation problem.

rules.name: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled - Registry
rules.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros

rules.name: Suspicious Environment Variable Has Been Registered
rules.description: Detects the creation of user-specific or system-wide environment variables via the registry. Which contains suspicious commands and strings

rules.name: Session Manager Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel - Registry
rules.description:
Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.

rules.name: Wdigest Enable UseLogonCredential
rules.description: Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of UseLogonCredential from HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to enable clear-text credentials

rules.name: Windows Defender Service Disabled - Registry
rules.description: Detects when an attacker or tool disables the  Windows Defender service (WinDefend) via the registry

rules.name: ETW Logging Disabled For rpcrt4.dll
rules.description: Detects changes to the "ExtErrorInformation" key in order to disable ETW logging for rpcrt4.dll

rules.name: Bypass UAC Using Event Viewer
rules.description: Bypasses User Account Control using Event Viewer and a relevant Windows Registry modification

rules.name: Suspicious Path In Keyboard Layout IME File Registry Value
rules.description:
Detects usage of Windows Input Method Editor (IME) keyboard layout feature, which allows an attacker to load a DLL into the process after sending the WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message.
Before doing this, the client needs to register the DLL in a special registry key that is assumed to implement this keyboard layout. This registry key should store a value named "Ime File" with a DLL path.
IMEs are essential for languages that have more characters than can be represented on a standard keyboard, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.

rules.name: Activate Suppression of Windows Security Center Notifications
rules.description: Detect set Notification_Suppress to 1 to disable the Windows security center notification

rules.name: Enable Local Manifest Installation With Winget
rules.description: Detects changes to the AppInstaller (winget) policy. Specifically the activation of the local manifest installation, which allows a user to install new packages via custom manifests.

rules.name: Antivirus Filter Driver Disallowed On Dev Drive - Registry
rules.description: Detects activity that indicates a user disabling the ability for Antivirus mini filter to inspect a "Dev Drive".

rules.name: Potential Attachment Manager Settings Associations Tamper
rules.description: Detects tampering with attachment manager settings policies associations to lower the default file type risks (See reference for more information)

rules.name: Registry Hide Function from User
rules.description: Detects registry modifications that hide internal tools or functions from the user (malware like Agent Tesla, Hermetic Wiper uses this technique)

rules.name: COM Object Hijacking Via Modification Of Default System CLSID Default Value
rules.description: Detects potential COM object hijacking via modification of default system CLSID.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via AppCompat RegisterAppRestart Layer
rules.description:
Detects the setting of the REGISTERAPPRESTART compatibility layer on an application.
This compatibility layer allows an application to register for restart using the "RegisterApplicationRestart" API.
This can be potentially abused as a persistence mechanism.

rules.name: Disable Administrative Share Creation at Startup
rules.description: Administrative shares are hidden network shares created by Microsoft Windows NT operating systems that grant system administrators remote access to every disk volume on a network-connected system

rules.name: Registry Disable System Restore
rules.description: Detects the modification of the registry to disable a system restore on the computer

rules.name: Hypervisor Enforced Code Integrity Disabled
rules.description: Detects changes to the HypervisorEnforcedCodeIntegrity registry key and the "Enabled" value being set to 0 in order to disable the Hypervisor Enforced Code Integrity feature. This allows an attacker to load unsigned and untrusted code to be run in the kernel

rules.name: New BgInfo.EXE Custom WMI Query Registry Configuration
rules.description: Detects setting of a new registry value related to BgInfo configuration, which can be abused to execute custom WMI query via "BgInfo.exe"

rules.name: Internet Explorer Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Today Page
rules.description:
Detects potential persistence activity via outlook today page.
An attacker can set a custom page to execute arbitrary code and link to it via the registry values "URL" and "UserDefinedUrl".

rules.name: CurrentControlSet Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Netsh Helper DLL - Registry
rules.description: Detects changes to the Netsh registry key to add a new DLL value. This change might be an indication of a potential persistence attempt by adding a malicious Netsh helper

rules.name: MaxMpxCt Registry Value Changed
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "MaxMpxCt" registry value.
MaxMpxCt specifies the maximum outstanding network requests for the server per client, which is used when negotiating a Server Message Block (SMB) connection with a client. Note if the value is set beyond 125 older Windows 9x clients will fail to negotiate.
Ransomware threat actors and operators (specifically BlackCat) were seen increasing this value in order to handle a higher volume of traffic.

rules.name: ETW Logging Disabled In .NET Processes - Sysmon Registry
rules.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

rules.name: UAC Bypass via Event Viewer
rules.description: Detects UAC bypass method using Windows event viewer

rules.name: Macro Enabled In A Potentially Suspicious Document
rules.description: Detects registry changes to Office trust records where the path is located in a potentially suspicious location

rules.name: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution - REG
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".

rules.name: COM Hijacking via TreatAs
rules.description: Detect modification of TreatAs key to enable "rundll32.exe -sta" command

rules.name: Uncommon Microsoft Office Trusted Location Added
rules.description: Detects changes to registry keys related to "Trusted Location" of Microsoft Office where the path is set to something uncommon. Attackers might add additional trusted locations to avoid macro security restrictions.

rules.name: Wow6432Node CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Usage of Renamed Sysinternals Tools - RegistrySet
rules.description: Detects non-sysinternals tools setting the "accepteula" key which normally is set on sysinternals tool execution

rules.name: New Netsh Helper DLL Registered From A Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects changes to the Netsh registry key to add a new DLL value that is located on a suspicious location. This change might be an indication of a potential persistence attempt by adding a malicious Netsh helper

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via MyComputer Registry Keys
rules.description: Detects modification to the "Default" value of the "MyComputer" key and subkeys to point to a custom binary that will be launched whenever the associated action is executed (see reference section for example)

rules.name: UAC Disabled
rules.description: Detects when an attacker tries to disable User Account Control (UAC) by setting the registry value "EnableLUA" to 0.

rules.name: CurrentVersion NT Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: WinSock2 Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled - Registry
rules.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation. Windows Recall can be enabled by setting the value of "DisableAIDataAnalysis" to "0".
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering
rules.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Excel Add-in - Registry
rules.description: Detect potential persistence via the creation of an excel add-in (XLL) file to make it run automatically when Excel is started.

rules.name: Suspicious Service Installed
rules.description:
Detects installation of NalDrv or PROCEXP152 services via registry-keys to non-system32 folders.
Both services are used in the tool Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs), which uses KDU (https://github.com/hfiref0x/KDU)

rules.name: Disabled Windows Defender Eventlog
rules.description: Detects the disabling of the Windows Defender eventlog as seen in relation to Lockbit 3.0 infections

rules.name: Execution DLL of Choice Using WAB.EXE
rules.description: This rule detects that the path to the DLL written in the registry is different from the default one. Launched WAB.exe tries to load the DLL from Registry.

rules.name: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed to Zero
rules.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections', etc.

rules.name: Potential SentinelOne Shell Context Menu Scan Command Tampering
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious changes to the SentinelOne context menu scan command by a process other than SentinelOne.

rules.name: Periodic Backup For System Registry Hives Enabled
rules.description:
Detects the enabling of the "EnablePeriodicBackup" registry value. Once enabled, The OS will backup System registry hives on restarts to the "C:\Windows\System32\config\RegBack" folder. Windows creates a "RegIdleBackup" task to manage subsequent backups.
Registry backup was a default behavior on Windows and was disabled as of "Windows 10, version 1803".

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Custom Protocol Handler
rules.description: Detects potential persistence activity via the registering of a new custom protocole handlers. While legitimate applications register protocole handlers often times during installation. And attacker can abuse this by setting a custom handler to be used as a persistence mechanism.

rules.name: Default RDP Port Changed to Non Standard Port
rules.description:
Detects changes to the default RDP port.
Remote desktop is a common feature in operating systems. It allows a user to log into a remote system using an interactive session with a graphical user interface.
Microsoft refers to its implementation of the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) as Remote Desktop Services (RDS).

rules.name: RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Shim Database Modification
rules.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims.
The Microsoft Windows Application Compatibility Infrastructure/Framework (Application Shim) was created to allow for backward compatibility of software as the operating system codebase changes over time

rules.name: Disable Windows Defender Functionalities Via Registry Keys
rules.description: Detects when attackers or tools disable Windows Defender functionalities via the Windows registry

rules.name: Potential WerFault ReflectDebugger Registry Value Abuse
rules.description: Detects potential WerFault "ReflectDebugger" registry value abuse for persistence.

rules.name: Outlook Security Settings Updated - Registry
rules.description: Detects changes to the registry values related to outlook security settings

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Visual Studio Tools for Office
rules.description: Detects persistence via Visual Studio Tools for Office (VSTO) add-ins in Office applications.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Desktop Background Change Via Registry
rules.description:
Detects registry value settings that would replace the user's desktop background.
This is a common technique used by malware to change the desktop background to a ransom note or other image.

rules.name: UAC Notification Disabled
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to disable User Account Control (UAC) notification by tampering with the "UACDisableNotify" value.
UAC is a critical security feature in Windows that prevents unauthorized changes to the operating system. It prompts the user for permission or an administrator password before allowing actions that could affect the system's operation or change settings that affect other users.
When "UACDisableNotify" is set to 1, UAC prompts are suppressed.

rules.name: Winlogon Notify Key Logon Persistence
rules.description:
Adversaries may abuse features of Winlogon to execute DLLs and/or executables when a user logs in.
Winlogon.exe is a Windows component responsible for actions at logon/logoff as well as the secure attention sequence (SAS) triggered by Ctrl-Alt-Delete.

rules.name: Sysmon Driver Altitude Change
rules.description:
Detects changes in Sysmon driver altitude value.
If the Sysmon driver is configured to load at an altitude of another registered service, it will fail to load at boot.

rules.name: Change Winevt Channel Access Permission Via Registry
rules.description: Detects tampering with the "ChannelAccess" registry key in order to change access to Windows event channel.

rules.name: ServiceDll Hijack
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "ServiceDLL" value related to a service in the registry.
This is often used as a method of persistence.

rules.name: Classes Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Wow6432Node Windows NT CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Trust Access Disable For VBApplications
rules.description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "AccessVBOM" to a value of "1" which disables trust access for VBA on the victim machine and lets attackers execute malicious macros without any Microsoft Office warnings.

rules.name: PowerShell Script Execution Policy Enabled
rules.description: Detects the enabling of the PowerShell script execution policy. Once enabled, this policy allows scripts to be executed.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious ODBC Driver Registered
rules.description: Detects the registration of a new ODBC driver where the driver is located in a potentially suspicious location

rules.name: Office Macros Warning Disabled
rules.description: Detects registry changes to Microsoft Office "VBAWarning" to a value of "1" which enables the execution of all macros, whether signed or unsigned.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via GlobalFlags
rules.description: Detects registry persistence technique using the GlobalFlags and SilentProcessExit keys

rules.name: Disable Windows Event Logging Via Registry
rules.description: Detects tampering with the "Enabled" registry key in order to disable Windows logging of a Windows event channel

rules.name: Registry Persistence via Explorer Run Key
rules.description: Detects a possible persistence mechanism using RUN key for Windows Explorer and pointing to a suspicious folder

rules.name: Persistence Via Disk Cleanup Handler - Autorun
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies values of the Disk Cleanup Handler in the registry to achieve persistence via autorun.
The disk cleanup manager is part of the operating system.
It displays the dialog box [] The user has the option of enabling or disabling individual handlers by selecting or clearing their check box in the disk cleanup manager's UI.
Although Windows comes with a number of disk cleanup handlers, they aren't designed to handle files produced by other applications.
Instead, the disk cleanup manager is designed to be flexible and extensible by enabling any developer to implement and register their own disk cleanup handler.
Any developer can extend the available disk cleanup services by implementing and registering a disk cleanup handler.

rules.name: Suspicious Application Allowed Through Exploit Guard
rules.description: Detects applications being added to the "allowed applications" list of exploit guard in order to bypass controlled folder settings

rules.name: New Application in AppCompat
rules.description: A General detection for a new application in AppCompat. This indicates an application executing for the first time on an endpoint.

rules.name: ScreenSaver Registry Key Set
rules.description: Detects registry key established after masqueraded .scr file execution using Rundll32 through desk.cpl

rules.name: Enabling COR Profiler Environment Variables
rules.description: Detects .NET Framework CLR and .NET Core CLR "cor_enable_profiling" and "cor_profiler" variables being set and configured.

rules.name: New TimeProviders Registered With Uncommon DLL Name
rules.description:
Detects processes setting a new DLL in DllName in under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\W32Time\TimeProvider.
Adversaries may abuse time providers to execute DLLs when the system boots.
The Windows Time service (W32Time) enables time synchronization across and within domains.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via TypedPaths
rules.description: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry from a non standard application. Which might indicate persistence attempt

rules.name: Modification of IE Registry Settings
rules.description: Detects modification of the registry settings used for Internet Explorer and other Windows components that use these settings. An attacker can abuse this registry key to add a domain to the trusted sites Zone or insert javascript for persistence

rules.name: Disable Windows Firewall by Registry
rules.description: Detect set EnableFirewall to 0 to disable the Windows firewall

rules.name: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry 2 VPN Extension
rules.description: Running Chrome VPN Extensions via the Registry install 2 vpn extension

rules.name: ETW Logging Disabled For SCM
rules.description: Detects changes to the "TracingDisabled" key in order to disable ETW logging for services.exe (SCM)

rules.name: Common Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Windows Event Log Access Tampering Via Registry
rules.description: Detects changes to the Windows EventLog channel permission values. It focuses on changes to the Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) string, as modifications to these values can restrict access to specific users or groups, potentially aiding in defense evasion by controlling who can view or modify a event log channel. Upon execution, the user shouldn't be able to access the event log channel via the event viewer or via utilities such as "Get-EventLog" or "wevtutil".

rules.name: Registry Modification to Hidden File Extension
rules.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

rules.name: Enable LM Hash Storage
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes.
By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.

rules.name: Add Debugger Entry To Hangs Key For Persistence
rules.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "Debugger" value to the "Hangs" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked when an application crashes

rules.name: Potential EventLog File Location Tampering
rules.description: Detects tampering with EventLog service "file" key. In order to change the default location of an Evtx file. This technique is used to tamper with log collection and alerting

rules.name: Lolbas OneDriveStandaloneUpdater.exe Proxy Download
rules.description:
Detects setting a custom URL for OneDriveStandaloneUpdater.exe to download a file from the Internet without executing any
anomalous executables with suspicious arguments. The downloaded file will be in C:\Users\redacted\AppData\Local\Microsoft\OneDrive\StandaloneUpdaterreSignInSettingsConfig.json

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via AutodialDLL
rules.description: Detects change the the "AutodialDLL" key which could be used as a persistence method to load custom DLL via the "ws2_32" library

rules.name: Disable Windows Security Center Notifications
rules.description: Detect set UseActionCenterExperience to 0 to disable the Windows security center notification

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - REG
rules.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Command Executed Via Run Dialog Box - Registry
rules.description:
Detects execution of commands via the run dialog box on Windows by checking values of the "RunMRU" registry key.
This technique was seen being abused by threat actors to deceive users into pasting and executing malicious commands, often disguised as CAPTCHA verification steps.

rules.name: Directory Service Restore Mode(DSRM) Registry Value Tampering
rules.description:
Detects changes to "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" registry value.
During a Domain Controller (DC) promotion, administrators create a Directory Services Restore Mode (DSRM) local administrator account with a password that rarely changes. The DSRM account is an Administrator account that logs in with the DSRM mode when the server is booting up to restore AD backups or recover the server from a failure.
Attackers could abuse DSRM account to maintain their persistence and access to the organization's Active Directory.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "0", the administrator account can only be used if the DC starts in DSRM.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "1", the administrator account can only be used if the local AD DS service is stopped.
If the "DsrmAdminLogonBehavior" value is set to "2", the administrator account can always be used.

rules.name: RDP Sensitive Settings Changed
rules.description:
Detects tampering of RDP Terminal Service/Server sensitive settings.
Such as allowing unauthorized users access to a system via the 'fAllowUnsolicited' or enabling RDP via 'fDenyTSConnections'...etc

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via DLLPathOverride
rules.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "DLLPathOverride" value to the "Natural Language" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked by "SearchIndexer.exe" process

rules.name: Blue Mockingbird - Registry
rules.description: Attempts to detect system changes made by Blue Mockingbird

rules.name: Potential CobaltStrike Service Installations - Registry
rules.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Scrobj.dll COM Hijacking
rules.description: Detect use of scrobj.dll as this DLL looks for the ScriptletURL key to get the location of the script to execute

rules.name: NET NGenAssemblyUsageLog Registry Key Tamper
rules.description:
Detects changes to the NGenAssemblyUsageLog registry key.
.NET Usage Log output location can be controlled by setting the NGenAssemblyUsageLog CLR configuration knob in the Registry or by configuring an environment variable (as described in the next section).
By simplify specifying an arbitrary value (e.g. fake output location or junk data) for the expected value, a Usage Log file for the .NET execution context will not be created.

rules.name: PowerShell as a Service in Registry
rules.description: Detects that a powershell code is written to the registry as a service.

rules.name: Disable PUA Protection on Windows Defender
rules.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender PUA protection

rules.name: VBScript Payload Stored in Registry
rules.description: Detects VBScript content stored into registry keys as seen being used by UNC2452 group

rules.name: Internet Explorer DisableFirstRunCustomize Enabled
rules.description: Detects changes to the Internet Explorer "DisableFirstRunCustomize" value, which prevents Internet Explorer from running the first run wizard the first time a user starts the browser after installing Internet Explorer or Windows.

rules.name: Disable Privacy Settings Experience in Registry
rules.description: Detects registry modifications that disable Privacy Settings Experience

rules.name: DNS-over-HTTPS Enabled by Registry
rules.description:
Detects when a user enables DNS-over-HTTPS.
This can be used to hide internet activity or be used to hide the process of exfiltrating data.
With this enabled organization will lose visibility into data such as query type, response and originating IP that are used to determine bad actors.

rules.name: Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation Disabled
rules.description: Detects changes to the "DisableHypervisorEnforcedPagingTranslation" registry value. Where the it is set to "1" in order to disable the Hypervisor Enforced Paging Translation feature.

rules.name: PowerShell Logging Disabled Via Registry Key Tampering
rules.description: Detects changes to the registry for the currently logged-in user. In order to disable PowerShell module logging, script block logging or transcription and script execution logging

rules.name: Old TLS1.0/TLS1.1 Protocol Version Enabled
rules.description: Detects applications or users re-enabling old TLS versions by setting the "Enabled" value to "1" for the "Protocols" registry key.

rules.name: Modify User Shell Folders Startup Value
rules.description: Detect modification of the startup key to a path where a payload could be stored to be launched during startup

rules.name: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key
rules.description: Detects modifications to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

rules.name: Outlook Macro Execution Without Warning Setting Enabled
rules.description: Detects the modification of Outlook security setting to allow unprompted execution of macros.

rules.name: Winget Admin Settings Modification
rules.description: Detects changes to the AppInstaller (winget) admin settings. Such as enabling local manifest installations or disabling installer hash checks

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook Home Page
rules.description:
Detects potential persistence activity via outlook home page.
An attacker can set a home page to achieve code execution and persistence by editing the WebView registry keys.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via App Paths Default Property
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "Default" property for keys located in the \Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\App Paths\ registry. Which might be used as a method of persistence
The entries found under App Paths are used primarily for the following purposes.
First, to map an application's executable file name to that file's fully qualified path.
Second, to prepend information to the PATH environment variable on a per-application, per-process basis.

rules.name: Uncommon Extension In Keyboard Layout IME File Registry Value
rules.description:
Detects usage of Windows Input Method Editor (IME) keyboard layout feature, which allows an attacker to load a DLL into the process after sending the WM_INPUTLANGCHANGEREQUEST message.
Before doing this, the client needs to register the DLL in a special registry key that is assumed to implement this keyboard layout. This registry key should store a value named "Ime File" with a DLL path.
IMEs are essential for languages that have more characters than can be represented on a standard keyboard, such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean.

rules.name: Microsoft Office Protected View Disabled
rules.description: Detects changes to Microsoft Office protected view registry keys with which the attacker disables this feature.

rules.name: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder

rules.name: Disable Internal Tools or Feature in Registry
rules.description: Detects registry modifications that change features of internal Windows tools (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)

rules.name: Tamper With Sophos AV Registry Keys
rules.description: Detects tamper attempts to sophos av functionality via registry key modification

rules.name: Add Port Monitor Persistence in Registry
rules.description:
Adversaries may use port monitors to run an attacker supplied DLL during system boot for persistence or privilege escalation.
A port monitor can be set through the AddMonitor API call to set a DLL to be loaded at startup.

rules.name: Change the Fax Dll
rules.description: Detect possible persistence using Fax DLL load when service restart

rules.name: Lsass Full Dump Request Via DumpType Registry Settings
rules.description: Detects the setting of the "DumpType" registry value to "2" which stands for a "Full Dump". Technique such as LSASS Shtinkering requires this value to be "2" in order to dump LSASS.

rules.name: CrashControl CrashDump Disabled
rules.description: Detects disabling the CrashDump per registry (as used by HermeticWiper)

rules.name: CurrentVersion Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Suspicious Powershell In Registry Run Keys
rules.description: Detects potential PowerShell commands or code within registry run keys

rules.name: Allow RDP Remote Assistance Feature
rules.description: Detect enable rdp feature to allow specific user to rdp connect on the targeted machine

rules.name: Disable Exploit Guard Network Protection on Windows Defender
rules.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Exploit Guard Network Protection

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via CHM Helper DLL
rules.description: Detects when an attacker modifies the registry key "HtmlHelp Author" to achieve persistence

rules.name: UAC Secure Desktop Prompt Disabled
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to change User Account Control (UAC) elevation request destination via the "PromptOnSecureDesktop" value.
The "PromptOnSecureDesktop" setting specifically determines whether UAC prompts are displayed on the secure desktop. The secure desktop is a separate desktop environment that's isolated from other processes running on the system. It's designed to prevent malicious software from intercepting or tampering with UAC prompts.
When "PromptOnSecureDesktop" is set to 0, UAC prompts are displayed on the user's current desktop instead of the secure desktop. This reduces the level of security because it potentially exposes the prompts to manipulation by malicious software.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Registry
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via LSA Extensions
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies the "REG_MULTI_SZ" value named "Extensions" to include a custom DLL to achieve persistence via lsass.
The "Extensions" list contains filenames of DLLs being automatically loaded by lsass.exe. Each DLL has its InitializeLsaExtension() method called after loading.

rules.name: Suspicious Printer Driver Empty Manufacturer
rules.description: Detects a suspicious printer driver installation with an empty Manufacturer value

rules.name: Disable Tamper Protection on Windows Defender
rules.description: Detects disabling Windows Defender Tamper Protection

rules.name: Persistence Via Hhctrl.ocx
rules.description: Detects when an attacker modifies the registry value of the "hhctrl" to point to a custom binary

rules.name: Scheduled TaskCache Change by Uncommon Program
rules.description: Monitor the creation of a new key under 'TaskCache' when a new scheduled task is registered by a process that is not svchost.exe, which is suspicious

rules.name: Service Binary in Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detect the creation of a service with a service binary located in a suspicious directory

rules.name: Bypass UAC Using SilentCleanup Task
rules.description:
Detects the setting of the environement variable "windir" to a non default value.
Attackers often abuse this variable in order to trigger a UAC bypass via the "SilentCleanup" task.
The SilentCleanup task located in %windir%\system32\cleanmgr.exe is an auto-elevated task that can be abused to elevate any file with administrator privileges without prompting UAC.

rules.name: Potential Attachment Manager Settings Attachments Tamper
rules.description: Detects tampering with attachment manager settings policies attachments (See reference for more information)

rules.name: Potential PendingFileRenameOperations Tampering
rules.description: Detect changes to the "PendingFileRenameOperations" registry key from uncommon or suspicious images locations to stage currently used files for rename or deletion after reboot.

rules.name: Register New IFiltre For Persistence
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker registers a new IFilter for an extension. Microsoft Windows Search uses filters to extract the content of items for inclusion in a full-text index.
You can extend Windows Search to index new or proprietary file types by writing filters to extract the content, and property handlers to extract the properties of files.

rules.name: New Root or CA or AuthRoot Certificate to Store
rules.description: Detects the addition of new root, CA or AuthRoot certificates to the Windows registry

rules.name: Disable Microsoft Defender Firewall via Registry
rules.description: Adversaries may disable or modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

rules.name: New ODBC Driver Registered
rules.description: Detects the registration of a new ODBC driver.

rules.name: Add Debugger Entry To AeDebug For Persistence
rules.description: Detects when an attacker adds a new "Debugger" value to the "AeDebug" key in order to achieve persistence which will get invoked when an application crashes

rules.name: Custom File Open Handler Executes PowerShell
rules.description: Detects the abuse of custom file open handler, executing powershell

rules.name: Disable Macro Runtime Scan Scope
rules.description: Detects tampering with the MacroRuntimeScanScope registry key to disable runtime scanning of enabled macros

rules.name: DHCP Callout DLL Installation
rules.description: Detects the installation of a Callout DLL via CalloutDlls and CalloutEnabled parameter in Registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DHCP server (restart required)

rules.name: Office Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Potential AMSI COM Server Hijacking
rules.description: Detects changes to the AMSI come server registry key in order disable AMSI scanning functionalities. When AMSI attempts to starts its COM component, it will query its registered CLSID and return a non-existent COM server. This causes a load failure and prevents any scanning methods from being accessed, ultimately rendering AMSI useless

rules.name: Registry Explorer Policy Modification
rules.description: Detects registry modifications that disable internal tools or functions in explorer (malware like Agent Tesla uses this technique)

rules.name: Winlogon AllowMultipleTSSessions Enable
rules.description:
Detects when the 'AllowMultipleTSSessions' value is enabled.
Which allows for multiple Remote Desktop connection sessions to be opened at once.
This is often used by attacker as a way to connect to an RDP session without disconnecting the other users

rules.name: Suspicious Shim Database Patching Activity
rules.description: Detects installation of new shim databases that try to patch sections of known processes for potential process injection or persistence.

rules.name: Wow6432Node Classes Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Event Viewer Events.asp
rules.description: Detects potential registry persistence technique using the Event Viewer "Events.asp" technique

rules.name: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Registry
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)

rules.name: System Scripts Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.

rules.name: Blackbyte Ransomware Registry
rules.description: BlackByte set three different registry values to escalate privileges and begin setting the stage for lateral movement and encryption

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Outlook LoadMacroProviderOnBoot Setting
rules.description: Detects the modification of Outlook setting "LoadMacroProviderOnBoot" which if enabled allows the automatic loading of any configured VBA project/module

rules.name: Enable Microsoft Dynamic Data Exchange
rules.description: Enable Dynamic Data Exchange protocol (DDE) in all supported editions of Microsoft Word or Excel.

rules.name: ClickOnce Trust Prompt Tampering
rules.description: Detects changes to the ClickOnce trust prompt registry key in order to enable an installation from different locations such as the Internet.

rules.name: Displaying Hidden Files Feature Disabled
rules.description:
Detects modifications to the "Hidden" and "ShowSuperHidden" explorer registry values in order to disable showing of hidden files and system files.
This technique is abused by several malware families to hide their files from normal users.

rules.name: Persistence Via New SIP Provider
rules.description: Detects when an attacker register a new SIP provider for persistence and defense evasion

rules.name: Registry Persistence via Service in Safe Mode
rules.description: Detects the modification of the registry to allow a driver or service to persist in Safe Mode.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Mpnotify
rules.description: Detects when an attacker register a new SIP provider for persistence and defense evasion

rules.name: IE Change Domain Zone
rules.description: Hides the file extension through modification of the registry

rules.name: UAC Bypass via Sdclt
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using registry key manipulation of sdclt.exe (e.g. UACMe 53)

rules.name: Windows Defender Exclusions Added - Registry
rules.description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions

rules.name: Potential Registry Persistence Attempt Via Windows Telemetry
rules.description:
Detects potential persistence behavior using the windows telemetry registry key.
Windows telemetry makes use of the binary CompatTelRunner.exe to run a variety of commands and perform the actual telemetry collections.
This binary was created to be easily extensible, and to that end, it relies on the registry to instruct on which commands to run.
The problem is, it will run any arbitrary command without restriction of location or type.

rules.name: Potential Registry Persistence Attempt Via DbgManagedDebugger
rules.description: Detects the addition of the "Debugger" value to the "DbgManagedDebugger" key in order to achieve persistence. Which will get invoked when an application crashes

rules.name: Potential Signing Bypass Via Windows Developer Features - Registry
rules.description: Detects when the enablement of developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.

rules.name: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed
rules.description: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

rules.name: New File Association Using Exefile
rules.description: Detects the abuse of the exefile handler in new file association. Used for bypass of security products.

rules.name: PUA - Sysinternal Tool Execution - Registry
rules.description: Detects the execution of a Sysinternals Tool via the creation of the "accepteula" registry key

rules.name: Potential NetWire RAT Activity - Registry
rules.description: Detects registry keys related to NetWire RAT

rules.name: Potential COM Object Hijacking Via TreatAs Subkey - Registry
rules.description: Detects COM object hijacking via TreatAs subkey

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via New AMSI Providers - Registry
rules.description: Detects when an attacker registers a new AMSI provider in order to achieve persistence

rules.name: PUA - Sysinternals Tools Execution - Registry
rules.description: Detects the execution of some potentially unwanted tools such as PsExec, Procdump, etc. (part of the Sysinternals suite) via the creation of the "accepteula" registry key.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - Registry
rules.description: Detects creation of "UserInitMprLogonScript" registry value which can be used as a persistence method by malicious actors

rules.name: Suspicious Execution Of Renamed Sysinternals Tools - Registry
rules.description: Detects the creation of the "accepteula" key related to the Sysinternals tools being created from executables with the wrong name (e.g. a renamed Sysinternals tool)

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Disk Cleanup Handler - Registry
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker modifies values of the Disk Cleanup Handler in the registry to achieve persistence.
The disk cleanup manager is part of the operating system. It displays the dialog box []
The user has the option of enabling or disabling individual handlers by selecting or clearing their check box in the disk cleanup manager's UI.
Although Windows comes with a number of disk cleanup handlers, they aren't designed to handle files produced by other applications.
Instead, the disk cleanup manager is designed to be flexible and extensible by enabling any developer to implement and register their own disk cleanup handler.
Any developer can extend the available disk cleanup services by implementing and registering a disk cleanup handler.

rules.name: Removal Of SD Value to Hide Schedule Task - Registry
rules.description: Remove SD (Security Descriptor) value in \Schedule\TaskCache\Tree registry hive to hide schedule task. This technique is used by Tarrask malware

rules.name: Folder Removed From Exploit Guard ProtectedFolders List - Registry
rules.description: Detects the removal of folders from the "ProtectedFolders" list of of exploit guard. This could indicate an attacker trying to launch an encryption process or trying to manipulate data inside of the protected folder

rules.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled - DisableAIDataAnalysis Value Deleted
rules.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation. Windows Recall can be enabled by deleting the existing "DisableAIDataAnalysis" registry value.
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.

rules.name: Removal Of Index Value to Hide Schedule Task - Registry
rules.description: Detects when the "index" value of a scheduled task is removed or deleted from the registry. Which effectively hides it from any tooling such as "schtasks /query"

rules.name: Terminal Server Client Connection History Cleared - Registry
rules.description: Detects the deletion of registry keys containing the MSTSC connection history

rules.name: Removal Of AMSI Provider Registry Keys
rules.description: Detects the deletion of AMSI provider registry key entries in HKLM\Software\Microsoft\AMSI. This technique could be used by an attacker in order to disable AMSI inspection.

rules.name: Removal of Potential COM Hijacking Registry Keys
rules.description:
Detects any deletion of entries in ".*\shell\open\command" registry keys.
These registry keys might have been used for COM hijacking activities by a threat actor or an attacker and the deletion could indicate steps to remove its tracks.

rules.name: New DLL Added to AppCertDlls Registry Key
rules.description:
Dynamic-link libraries (DLLs) that are specified in the AppCertDLLs value in the Registry key can be abused to obtain persistence and privilege escalation
by causing a malicious DLL to be loaded and run in the context of separate processes on the computer.

rules.name: New DLL Added to AppInit_DLLs Registry Key
rules.description: DLLs that are specified in the AppInit_DLLs value in the Registry key HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Windows are loaded by user32.dll into every process that loads user32.dll

rules.name: Narrator's Feedback-Hub Persistence
rules.description: Detects abusing Windows 10 Narrator's Feedback-Hub

rules.name: WINEKEY Registry Modification
rules.description: Detects potential malicious modification of run keys by winekey or team9 backdoor

rules.name: Office Application Startup - Office Test
rules.description: Detects the addition of office test registry that allows a user to specify an arbitrary DLL that will be executed every time an Office application is started

rules.name: PrinterNightmare Mimikatz Driver Name
rules.description: Detects static QMS 810 and mimikatz driver name used by Mimikatz as exploited in CVE-2021-1675 and CVE-2021-34527

rules.name: UAC Bypass Via Wsreset
rules.description: Unfixed method for UAC bypass from Windows 10. WSReset.exe file associated with the Windows Store. It will run a binary file contained in a low-privilege registry.

rules.name: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Usage - Registry
rules.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

rules.name: DLL Load via LSASS
rules.description: Detects a method to load DLL via LSASS process using an undocumented Registry key

rules.name: Suspicious Run Key from Download
rules.description: Detects the suspicious RUN keys created by software located in Download or temporary Outlook/Internet Explorer directories

rules.name: Disable Security Events Logging Adding Reg Key MiniNt
rules.description: Detects the addition of a key 'MiniNt' to the registry. Upon a reboot, Windows Event Log service will stopped write events.

rules.name: Potential Qakbot Registry Activity
rules.description: Detects a registry key used by IceID in a campaign that distributes malicious OneNote files

rules.name: Suspicious Camera and Microphone Access
rules.description: Detects Processes accessing the camera and microphone from suspicious folder

rules.name: Security Support Provider (SSP) Added to LSA Configuration
rules.description: Detects the addition of a SSP to the registry. Upon a reboot or API call, SSP DLLs gain access to encrypted and plaintext passwords stored in Windows.

rules.name: CMSTP Execution Registry Event
rules.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

rules.name: Windows Registry Trust Record Modification
rules.description: Alerts on trust record modification within the registry, indicating usage of macros

rules.name: New PortProxy Registry Entry Added
rules.description: Detects the modification of the PortProxy registry key which is used for port forwarding.

rules.name: Wdigest CredGuard Registry Modification
rules.description:
Detects potential malicious modification of the property value of IsCredGuardEnabled from
HKLM:\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Control\SecurityProviders\WDigest to disable Cred Guard on a system.
This is usually used with UseLogonCredential to manipulate the caching credentials.

rules.name: Atbroker Registry Change
rules.description: Detects creation/modification of Assistive Technology applications and persistence with usage of 'at'

rules.name: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack - Registry
rules.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack

rules.name: Creation of a Local Hidden User Account by Registry
rules.description: Sysmon registry detection of a local hidden user account.

rules.name: Run Once Task Configuration in Registry
rules.description: Rule to detect the configuration of Run Once registry key. Configured payload can be run by runonce.exe /AlternateShellStartup

rules.name: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Registry Manipulation
rules.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook

rules.name: Esentutl Volume Shadow Copy Service Keys
rules.description: Detects the volume shadow copy service initialization and processing via esentutl. Registry keys such as HKLM\\System\\CurrentControlSet\\Services\\VSS\\Diag\\VolSnap\\Volume are captured.

rules.name: Windows Credential Editor Registry
rules.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

rules.name: Pandemic Registry Key
rules.description: Detects Pandemic Windows Implant

rules.name: Path To Screensaver Binary Modified
rules.description: Detects value modification of registry key containing path to binary used as screensaver.

rules.name: Enable Remote Connection Between Anonymous Computer - AllowAnonymousCallback
rules.description: Detects enabling of the "AllowAnonymousCallback" registry value, which allows a remote connection between computers that do not have a trust relationship.

rules.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation - Registry
rules.description: Detects the installation of the Azure Hybrid Connection Manager service to allow remote code execution from Azure function.

rules.name: Registry Entries For Azorult Malware
rules.description: Detects the presence of a registry key created during Azorult execution

rules.name: Registry Persistence Mechanisms in Recycle Bin
rules.description: Detects persistence registry keys for Recycle Bin

rules.name: Shell Open Registry Keys Manipulation
rules.description: Detects the shell open key manipulation (exefile and ms-settings) used for persistence and the pattern of UAC Bypass using fodhelper.exe, computerdefaults.exe, slui.exe via registry keys (e.g. UACMe 33 or 62)

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS SilentProcessExit Technique
rules.description: Detects changes to the Registry in which a monitor program gets registered to dump the memory of the lsass.exe process

rules.name: Remote Thread Created In Shell Application
rules.description:
Detects remote thread creation in command shell applications, such as "Cmd.EXE" and "PowerShell.EXE".
It is a common technique used by malware, such as IcedID, to inject malicious code and execute it within legitimate processes.

rules.name: Remote Thread Created In KeePass.EXE
rules.description: Detects remote thread creation in "KeePass.exe" which could indicates potential password dumping activity

rules.name: Remote Thread Creation In Mstsc.Exe From Suspicious Location
rules.description:
Detects remote thread creation in the "mstsc.exe" process by a process located in a potentially suspicious location.
This technique is often used by attackers in order to hook some APIs used by DLLs loaded by "mstsc.exe" during RDP authentications in order to steal credentials.

rules.name: HackTool - Potential CobaltStrike Process Injection
rules.description: Detects a potential remote threat creation with certain characteristics which are typical for Cobalt Strike beacons

rules.name: Remote Thread Creation Ttdinject.exe Proxy
rules.description: Detects a remote thread creation of Ttdinject.exe used as proxy

rules.name: HackTool - CACTUSTORCH Remote Thread Creation
rules.description: Detects remote thread creation from CACTUSTORCH as described in references.

rules.name: Remote Thread Creation Via PowerShell In Uncommon Target
rules.description: Detects the creation of a remote thread from a Powershell process in an uncommon target process

rules.name: Password Dumper Remote Thread in LSASS
rules.description:
Detects password dumper activity by monitoring remote thread creation EventID 8 in combination with the lsass.exe process as TargetImage.
The process in field Process is the malicious program. A single execution can lead to hundreds of events.

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Via PowerShell Remote Thread
rules.description: Detects remote thread creation by PowerShell processes into "lsass.exe"

rules.name: Remote Thread Creation In Uncommon Target Image
rules.description: Detects uncommon target processes for remote thread creation

rules.name: Remote Thread Creation By Uncommon Source Image
rules.description: Detects uncommon processes creating remote threads.

rules.name: Rare Remote Thread Creation By Uncommon Source Image
rules.description: Detects uncommon processes creating remote threads.

rules.name: QuickAssist Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of Microsoft Quick Assist tool "QuickAssist.exe". This utility can be used by attackers to gain remote access.

rules.name: Powershell Token Obfuscation - Process Creation
rules.description: Detects TOKEN OBFUSCATION technique from Invoke-Obfuscation

rules.name: Potential Windows Defender Tampering Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects potential tampering with Windows Defender settings such as adding exclusion using wmic

rules.name: Suspicious Greedy Compression Using Rar.EXE
rules.description: Detects RAR usage that creates an archive from a suspicious folder, either a system folder or one of the folders often used by attackers for staging purposes

rules.name: HackTool - Wmiexec Default Powershell Command
rules.description: Detects the execution of PowerShell with a specific flag sequence that is used by the Wmiexec script

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using ChangePK and SLUI
rules.description: Detects an UAC bypass that uses changepk.exe and slui.exe (UACMe 61)

rules.name: Potential PsExec Remote Execution
rules.description: Detects potential psexec command that initiate execution on a remote systems via common commandline flags used by the utility

rules.name: Sysmon Discovery Via Default Driver Altitude Using Findstr.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "findstr" with the argument "385201". Which could indicate potential discovery of an installed Sysinternals Sysmon service using the default driver altitude (even if the name is changed).

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Using Msdt.EXE
rules.description: Detects processes leveraging the "ms-msdt" handler or the "msdt.exe" binary to execute arbitrary commands as seen in the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability

rules.name: Ping Hex IP
rules.description: Detects a ping command that uses a hex encoded IP address

rules.name: Process Creation Using Sysnative Folder
rules.description: Detects process creation events that use the Sysnative folder (common for CobaltStrike spawns)

rules.name: Explorer Process Tree Break
rules.description:
Detects a command line process that uses explorer.exe to launch arbitrary commands or binaries,
which is similar to cmd.exe /c, only it breaks the process tree and makes its parent a new instance of explorer spawning from "svchost"

rules.name: Shell32 DLL Execution in Suspicious Directory
rules.description: Detects shell32.dll executing a DLL in a suspicious directory

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Created as System
rules.description: Detection of child processes spawned with SYSTEM privileges by parents with LOCAL SERVICE or NETWORK SERVICE accounts

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript

rules.name: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With WINZIP
rules.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities

rules.name: Use of TTDInject.exe
rules.description: Detects the executiob of TTDInject.exe, which is used by Windows 10 v1809 and newer to debug time travel (underlying call of tttracer.exe)

rules.name: PowerShell Download Pattern
rules.description: Detects a Powershell process that contains download commands in its command line string

rules.name: Conhost Spawned By Uncommon Parent Process
rules.description: Detects when the Console Window Host (conhost.exe) process is spawned by an uncommon parent process, which could be indicative of potential code injection activity.

rules.name: Msxsl.EXE Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the MSXSL utility. This can be used to execute Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files. These files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files.
Adversaries can abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
rules.description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

rules.name: HackTool - Pypykatz Credentials Dumping Activity
rules.description: Detects the usage of "pypykatz" to obtain stored credentials. Adversaries may attempt to extract credential material from the Security Account Manager (SAM) database through Windows registry where the SAM database is stored

rules.name: Devtoolslauncher.exe Executes Specified Binary
rules.description: The Devtoolslauncher.exe executes other binary

rules.name: Veeam Backup Database Suspicious Query
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious SQL queries using SQLCmd targeting the Veeam backup databases in order to steal information.

rules.name: Suspicious Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "INSTALLDRIVER" action where the driver doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. This is often used as a defense evasion method.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using IEInstal - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using IEInstal.exe (UACMe 64)

rules.name: Potential Provisioning Registry Key Abuse For Binary Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of the provisioning registry key for indirect command execution through "Provlaunch.exe".

rules.name: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Arbitrary Binary Execution
rules.description: Detects child processes of Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe that can be used to execute any other binary

rules.name: Potential RDP Session Hijacking Activity
rules.description: Detects potential RDP Session Hijacking activity on Windows systems

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Of SQL Server
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the SQLServer process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

rules.name: Stop Windows Service Via PowerShell Stop-Service
rules.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the PowerShell Cmdlet "Stop-Service"

rules.name: PowerShell Download and Execution Cradles
rules.description: Detects PowerShell download and execution cradles.

rules.name: Code Execution via Pcwutl.dll
rules.description: Detects launch of executable by calling the LaunchApplication function from pcwutl.dll library.

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Service Tampering
rules.description: Detects the usage of binaries such as 'net', 'sc' or 'powershell' in order to stop, pause, disable or delete critical or important Windows services such as AV, Backup, etc. As seen being used in some ransomware scripts

rules.name: Add Windows Capability Via PowerShell Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects usage of the "Add-WindowsCapability" cmdlet to add Windows capabilities. Notable capabilities could be "OpenSSH" and others.

rules.name: Php Inline Command Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of php using the "-r" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live php code.

rules.name: HackTool - Koadic Execution
rules.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

rules.name: Windows Internet Hosted WebDav Share Mount Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects when an internet hosted webdav share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 1
rules.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

rules.name: Mstsc.EXE Execution From Uncommon Parent
rules.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

rules.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin To A Suspicious Target Folder
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to a suspicious target folder

rules.name: ImagingDevices Unusual Parent/Child Processes
rules.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the ImagingDevices.exe (Windows Contacts) process as seen being used with Bumblebee activity

rules.name: Potential Application Whitelisting Bypass via Dnx.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of Dnx.EXE. The Dnx utility allows for the execution of C# code.
Attackers might abuse this in order to bypass application whitelisting.

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Mofcomp Execution
rules.description:
Detects execution of the "mofcomp" utility as a child of a suspicious shell or script running utility or by having a suspicious path in the commandline.
The "mofcomp" utility parses a file containing MOF statements and adds the classes and class instances defined in the file to the WMI repository.
Attackers abuse this utility to install malicious MOF scripts

rules.name: Potential Cookies Session Hijacking
rules.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "-c" flag in order to save cookie data.

rules.name: Import LDAP Data Interchange Format File Via Ldifde.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "Ldifde.exe" with the import flag "-i". The can be abused to include HTTP-based arguments which will allow the arbitrary download of files from a remote server.

rules.name: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
rules.description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

rules.name: Potential Configuration And Service Reconnaissance Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to query reconnaissance information from the registry. Adversaries may interact with the Windows registry to gather information about credentials, the system, configuration, and installed software.

rules.name: Csc.EXE Execution Form Potentially Suspicious Parent
rules.description: Detects a potentially suspicious parent of "csc.exe", which could be a sign of payload delivery.

rules.name: HackTool - SharPersist Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool SharPersist - used to deploy various different kinds of persistence mechanisms

rules.name: Non Interactive PowerShell Process Spawned
rules.description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

rules.name: Potential Memory Dumping Activity Via LiveKD
rules.description: Detects execution of LiveKD based on PE metadata or image name

rules.name: Potential DLL File Download Via PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest
rules.description: Detects potential DLL files being downloaded using the PowerShell Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via Wget.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads from file sharing domains using wget.exe

rules.name: File Download Using Notepad++ GUP Utility
rules.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) from a process other than Notepad++ to download files.

rules.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded WMI Classes
rules.description: Detects calls to base64 encoded WMI class such as "Win32_ShadowCopy", "Win32_ScheduledJob", etc.

rules.name: Using SettingSyncHost.exe as LOLBin
rules.description: Detects using SettingSyncHost.exe to run hijacked binary

rules.name: Taskmgr as LOCAL_SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects the creation of taskmgr.exe process in context of LOCAL_SYSTEM

rules.name: Allow Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to allow access to a service from a suspicious trustee. This can be used to override access restrictions set by previous ACLs.
