rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Parent Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious or uncommon parent processes of PowerShell

rules.name: Uncommon Link.EXE Parent Process
rules.description:
Detects an uncommon parent process of "LINK.EXE".
Link.EXE in Microsoft incremental linker. Its a utility usually bundled with Visual Studio installation.
Multiple utilities often found in the same folder (editbin.exe, dumpbin.exe, lib.exe, etc) have a hardcode call to the "LINK.EXE" binary without checking its validity.
This would allow an attacker to sideload any binary with the name "link.exe" if one of the aforementioned tools get executed from a different location.
By filtering the known locations of such utilities we can spot uncommon parent process of LINK.EXE that might be suspicious or malicious.

rules.name: Xwizard.EXE Execution From Non-Default Location
rules.description:
Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory.
When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution From Unusual Location
rules.description: Detects execution of client32.exe (NetSupport RAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

rules.name: Cab File Extraction Via Wusa.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Paths
rules.description: Detects the execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility to extract ".cab" files using the "/extract" argument from potentially suspicious paths.

rules.name: Remote CHM File Download/Execution Via HH.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of "hh.exe" to execute/download remotely hosted ".chm" files.

rules.name: Uncommon AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with uncommon Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.

rules.name: HackTool - SysmonEOP Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the PoC that can be used to exploit Sysmon CVE-2022-41120

rules.name: ETW Trace Evasion Activity
rules.description: Detects command line activity that tries to clear or disable any ETW trace log which could be a sign of logging evasion.

rules.name: Import PowerShell Modules From Suspicious Directories - ProcCreation
rules.description: Detects powershell scripts that import modules from suspicious directories

rules.name: Sensitive File Recovery From Backup Via Wbadmin.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the dump of highly sensitive files such as "NTDS.DIT" and "SECURITY" hive.
Attackers can leverage the "wbadmin" utility in order to dump sensitive files that might contain credential or sensitive information.

rules.name: Java Running with Remote Debugging
rules.description: Detects a JAVA process running with remote debugging allowing more than just localhost to connect

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Event Viewer RecentViews
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Event Viewer RecentViews

rules.name: Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file which might contain a malicious action.

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary Code Execution Via Node.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution node.exe which is shipped with multiple software such as VMware, Adobe...etc. In order to execute arbitrary code. For example to establish reverse shell as seen in Log4j attacks...etc

rules.name: Potential MsiExec Masquerading
rules.description: Detects the execution of msiexec.exe from an uncommon directory

rules.name: CobaltStrike Load by Rundll32
rules.description: Rundll32 can be use by Cobalt Strike with StartW function to load DLLs from the command line.

rules.name: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Commands
rules.description: Detects use of Cobalt Strike commands accidentally entered in the CMD shell

rules.name: Suspicious Service DACL Modification Via Set-Service Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications via the "Set-Service" cmdlet using the "SecurityDescriptorSddl" flag (Only available with PowerShell 7) that can be used to hide services or make them unstopable

rules.name: LSASS Process Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE
rules.description: Detects findstring commands that include the keyword lsass, which indicates recon actviity for the LSASS process PID

rules.name: Run Once Task Execution as Configured in Registry
rules.description: This rule detects the execution of Run Once task as configured in the registry

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process of KeyScrambler.exe
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of KeyScrambler.exe

rules.name: Msiexec Quiet Installation
rules.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

rules.name: WhoAmI as Parameter
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process command line that uses whoami as first parameter (as e.g. used by EfsPotato)

rules.name: Service StartupType Change Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detect the use of "sc.exe" to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "demand"

rules.name: Indirect Command Execution From Script File Via Bash.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher without any flags to execute the content of a bash script directly.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

rules.name: Whoami.EXE Execution From Privileged Process
rules.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" by privileged accounts that are often abused by threat actors

rules.name: Suspicious Serv-U Process Pattern
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process pattern which could be a sign of an exploited Serv-U service

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of AddinUtil.EXE
rules.description: Detects uncommon child processes of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via a custom Addins.Store payload.

rules.name: Verclsid.exe Runs COM Object
rules.description: Detects when verclsid.exe is used to run COM object via GUID

rules.name: Remote PowerShell Session Host Process (WinRM)
rules.description: Detects remote PowerShell sections by monitoring for wsmprovhost (WinRM host process) as a parent or child process (sign of an active PowerShell remote session).

rules.name: PUA - NSudo Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of NSudo tool for command execution

rules.name: HackTool - SafetyKatz Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool SafetyKatz via PE information and default Image name

rules.name: PUA - System Informer Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of System Informer, a task manager tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level operations

rules.name: Renamed ProcDump Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed ProcDump executable.
This often done by attackers or malware in order to evade defensive mechanisms.

rules.name: Potential RDP Tunneling Via SSH
rules.description: Execution of ssh.exe to perform data exfiltration and tunneling through RDP

rules.name: Potential Meterpreter/CobaltStrike Activity
rules.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service starting

rules.name: Whoami.EXE Execution Anomaly
rules.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with suspicious parent processes.

rules.name: Active Directory Structure Export Via Csvde.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "csvde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.

rules.name: Suspicious Userinit Child Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious child process of userinit

rules.name: Tasks Folder Evasion
rules.description:
The Tasks folder in system32 and syswow64 are globally writable paths.
Adversaries can take advantage of this and load or influence any script hosts or ANY .NET Application
in Tasks to load and execute a custom assembly into cscript, wscript, regsvr32, mshta, eventvwr

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts

rules.name: Sensitive File Dump Via Wbadmin.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the dump of highly sensitive files such as "NTDS.DIT" and "SECURITY" hive.
Attackers can leverage the "wbadmin" utility in order to dump sensitive files that might contain credential or sensitive information.

rules.name: Insecure Transfer Via Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "--insecure" flag.

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 3
rules.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

rules.name: Potential Dosfuscation Activity
rules.description: Detects possible payload obfuscation via the commandline

rules.name: Suspicious LNK Command-Line Padding with Whitespace Characters
rules.description:
Detects exploitation of LNK file command-line length discrepancy, where attackers hide malicious commands beyond the 260-character UI limit while the actual command-line argument field supports 4096 characters using whitespace padding (e.g., 0x20, 0x09-0x0D).
Adversaries insert non-printable whitespace characters (e.g., Line Feed \x0A, Carriage Return \x0D) to pad the visible section of the LNK file, pushing malicious commands past the UI-visible boundary.
The hidden payload, executed at runtime but invisible in Windows Explorer properties, enables stealthy execution and evasioncommonly used for social engineering attacks.
This rule flags suspicious use of such padding observed in real-world attacks.

rules.name: Suspicious Csi.exe Usage
rules.description: Csi.exe is a signed binary from Microsoft that comes with Visual Studio and provides C# interactive capabilities. It can be used to run C# code from a file passed as a parameter in command line. Early version of this utility provided with Microsoft Roslyn Community Technology Preview was named 'rcsi.exe'

rules.name: Taskkill Symantec Endpoint Protection
rules.description:
Detects one of the possible scenarios for disabling Symantec Endpoint Protection.
Symantec Endpoint Protection antivirus software services incorrectly implement the protected service mechanism.
As a result, the NT AUTHORITY/SYSTEM user can execute the taskkill /im command several times ccSvcHst.exe /f, thereby killing the process belonging to the service, and thus shutting down the service.

rules.name: Suspicious Cabinet File Execution Via Msdt.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of msdt.exe using the "cab" flag which could indicates suspicious diagcab files with embedded answer files leveraging CVE-2022-30190

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts

rules.name: Exchange PowerShell Snap-Ins Usage
rules.description: Detects adding and using Exchange PowerShell snap-ins to export mailbox data. As seen used by HAFNIUM and APT27

rules.name: HackTool - Potential Impacket Lateral Movement Activity
rules.description: Detects wmiexec/dcomexec/atexec/smbexec from Impacket framework

rules.name: Potential RDP Tunneling Via Plink
rules.description: Execution of plink to perform data exfiltration and tunneling

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 2
rules.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

rules.name: Suspicious Key Manager Access
rules.description: Detects the invocation of the Stored User Names and Passwords dialogue (Key Manager)

rules.name: Suspicious Download From File-Sharing Website Via Bitsadmin
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file from a suspicious domain

rules.name: RDP Connection Allowed Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of the netsh command to open and allow connections to port 3389 (RDP). As seen used by Sarwent Malware

rules.name: Execution Of Non-Existing File
rules.description: Checks whether the image specified in a process creation event is not a full, absolute path (caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process)

rules.name: Uncommon System Information Discovery Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the use of the WMI command-line (WMIC) utility to identify and display various system information,
including OS, CPU, GPU, and disk drive names; memory capacity; display resolution; and baseboard, BIOS,
and GPU driver products/versions.
Some of these commands were used by Aurora Stealer in late 2022/early 2023.

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via Squirrel.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" to download arbitrary files. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)

rules.name: Certificate Exported Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of the certutil with the "exportPFX" flag which allows the utility to export certificates.

rules.name: HackTool - Windows Credential Editor (WCE) Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Windows Credential Editor (WCE)

rules.name: New Service Creation Using Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new service using the "sc.exe" utility.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of VsCode
rules.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a VsCode "code.exe" process. This could indicate an attempt of persistence via VsCode tasks or terminal profiles.

rules.name: Suspicious Where Execution
rules.description:
Adversaries may enumerate browser bookmarks to learn more about compromised hosts.
Browser bookmarks may reveal personal information about users (ex: banking sites, interests, social media, etc.) as well as details about
internal network resources such as servers, tools/dashboards, or other related infrastructure.

rules.name: PUA - AdFind Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects AdFind execution with common flags seen used during attacks

rules.name: PowerShell Web Access Feature Enabled Via DISM
rules.description: Detects the use of DISM to enable the PowerShell Web Access feature, which could be used for remote access and potential abuse

rules.name: RemoteFXvGPUDisablement Abuse Via AtomicTestHarnesses
rules.description: Detects calls to the AtomicTestHarnesses "Invoke-ATHRemoteFXvGPUDisablementCommand" which is designed to abuse the "RemoteFXvGPUDisablement.exe" binary to run custom PowerShell code via module load-order hijacking.

rules.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded FromBase64String Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "FromBase64String" cmdlet in a process command line

rules.name: HackTool - RemoteKrbRelay Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of RemoteKrbRelay, a Kerberos relaying tool via CommandLine flags and PE metadata.

rules.name: Suspicious Autorun Registry Modified via WMI
rules.description: Detects suspicious activity where the WMIC process is used to create an autorun registry entry via reg.exe, which is often indicative of persistence mechanisms employed by malware.

rules.name: PUA - Advanced IP Scanner Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Advanced IP Scanner. Seems to be a popular tool for ransomware groups.

rules.name: Use NTFS Short Name in Command Line
rules.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

rules.name: Suspicious X509Enrollment - Process Creation
rules.description: Detect use of X509Enrollment

rules.name: Harvesting Of Wifi Credentials Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detect the harvesting of wifi credentials using netsh.exe

rules.name: Whoami.EXE Execution With Output Option
rules.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" with the "/FO" flag to choose CSV as output format or with redirection options to export the results to a file for later use.

rules.name: Suspicious Program Location Whitelisted In Firewall Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects Netsh command execution that whitelists a program located in a suspicious location in the Windows Firewall

rules.name: Change Default File Association To Executable Via Assoc
rules.description:
Detects when a program changes the default file association of any extension to an executable.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

rules.name: Malicious Windows Script Components File Execution by TAEF Detection
rules.description:
Windows Test Authoring and Execution Framework (TAEF) framework allows you to run automation by executing tests files written on different languages (C, C#, Microsoft COM Scripting interfaces
Adversaries may execute malicious code (such as WSC file with VBScript, dll and so on) directly by running te.exe

rules.name: Boot Configuration Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE
rules.description: Detects the use of the bcdedit command to tamper with the boot configuration data. This technique is often times used by malware or attackers as a destructive way before launching ransomware.

rules.name: DriverQuery.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility. Which can be used to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

rules.name: Lolbin Unregmp2.exe Use As Proxy
rules.description: Detect usage of the "unregmp2.exe" binary as a proxy to launch a custom version of "wmpnscfg.exe"

rules.name: Security Tools Keyword Lookup Via Findstr.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of "findstr" to search for common names of security tools. Attackers often pipe the results of recon commands such as "tasklist" or "whoami" to "findstr" in order to filter out the results.
This detection focuses on the keywords that the attacker might use as a filter.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using MSConfig Token Modification - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a msconfig GUI hack (UACMe 55)

rules.name: Potential Tampering With Security Products Via WMIC
rules.description: Detects uninstallation or termination of security products using the WMIC utility

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs With Uncommon Extension
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities with an uncommon extension.

rules.name: WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
rules.description:
Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like "C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie".
This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on a WebDav server).

rules.name: File Deletion Via Del
rules.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "del"/"erase" commands in order to delete files.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Abusing Winsat Path Parsing - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using a path parsing issue in winsat.exe (UACMe 52)

rules.name: Potential Discovery Activity Via Dnscmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects an attempt to leverage dnscmd.exe to enumerate the DNS zones of a domain. DNS zones used to host the DNS records for a particular domain.

rules.name: Sdiagnhost Calling Suspicious Child Process
rules.description: Detects sdiagnhost.exe calling a suspicious child process (e.g. used in exploits for Follina / CVE-2022-30190)

rules.name: HackTool - winPEAS Execution
rules.description: WinPEAS is a script that search for possible paths to escalate privileges on Windows hosts. The checks are explained on book.hacktricks.xyz

rules.name: Hacktool Execution - PE Metadata
rules.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via PE metadata (company, product, etc.) even if the files have been renamed

rules.name: JScript Compiler Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the "jsc.exe" (JScript Compiler).
Attacker might abuse this in order to compile JScript files on the fly and bypassing application whitelisting.

rules.name: SQL Client Tools PowerShell Session Detection
rules.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqltoolsps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the Microsoft SQL Server Management studio.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

rules.name: HackTool - SharpLdapWhoami Execution
rules.description: Detects SharpLdapWhoami, a whoami alternative that queries the LDAP service on a domain controller

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSPUB.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "MSPUB" (Microsoft Publisher) to download arbitrary files

rules.name: PUA - SoftPerfect Netscan Execution
rules.description:
Detects usage of SoftPerfect's "netscan.exe". An application for scanning networks.
It is actively used in-the-wild by threat actors to inspect and understand the network architecture of a victim.

rules.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec PowerShell Obfuscation
rules.description: The CrachMapExec pentesting framework implements a PowerShell obfuscation with some static strings detected by this rule.

rules.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of "certutil" with the "addstore" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

rules.name: Renamed Jusched.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "jusched.exe" as seen used by the cobalt group

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of Hostname
rules.description: Use of hostname to get information

rules.name: Audit Policy Tampering Via Auditpol
rules.description:
Threat actors can use auditpol binary to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

rules.name: Abuse of Service Permissions to Hide Services Via Set-Service
rules.description: Detects usage of the "Set-Service" powershell cmdlet to configure a new SecurityDescriptor that allows a service to be hidden from other utilities such as "sc.exe", "Get-Service"...etc. (Works only in powershell 7)

rules.name: Disabled Volume Snapshots
rules.description: Detects commands that temporarily turn off Volume Snapshots

rules.name: Suspicious Reg Add BitLocker
rules.description: Detects suspicious addition to BitLocker related registry keys via the reg.exe utility

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Spawned By Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects an uncommon child process of "odbcconf.exe" binary which normally shouldn't have any child processes.

rules.name: Disabled IE Security Features
rules.description: Detects command lines that indicate unwanted modifications to registry keys that disable important Internet Explorer security features

rules.name: HackTool - Certify Execution
rules.description: Detects Certify a tool for Active Directory certificate abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.

rules.name: Suspicious Manipulation Of Default Accounts Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious manipulations of default accounts such as 'administrator' and 'guest'. For example 'enable' or 'disable' accounts or change the password...etc

rules.name: Filter Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE
rules.description: Detect filter driver unloading activity via fltmc.exe

rules.name: Powershell Executed From Headless ConHost Process
rules.description:
Detects the use of powershell commands from headless ConHost window.
The "--headless" flag hides the windows from the user upon execution.

rules.name: Gzip Archive Decode Via PowerShell
rules.description: Detects attempts of decoding encoded Gzip archives via PowerShell.

rules.name: Suspicious WindowsTerminal Child Processes
rules.description: Detects suspicious children spawned via the Windows Terminal application which could be a sign of persistence via WindowsTerminal (see references section)

rules.name: WMI Backdoor Exchange Transport Agent
rules.description: Detects a WMI backdoor in Exchange Transport Agents via WMI event filters

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Netsh Helper DLL
rules.description: Detects the execution of netsh with "add helper" flag in order to add a custom helper DLL. This technique can be abused to add a malicious helper DLL that can be used as a persistence proxy that gets called when netsh.exe is executed.

rules.name: Suspicious File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the extensions of the file is suspicious

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Silent Installation
rules.description: Detects AnyDesk Remote Desktop silent installation. Which can be used by attackers to gain remote access.

rules.name: Service DACL Abuse To Hide Services Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of the "sc.exe" utility adding a new service with special permission seen used by threat actors which makes the service hidden and unremovable.

rules.name: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Suspicious File Extension
rules.description: Detects the execution of REGSVR32.exe with DLL files masquerading as other files

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Installation Execution
rules.description: Detects ScreenConnect program starts that establish a remote access to a system.

rules.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation Involving Temp Folder
rules.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks that involves a temporary folder and runs only once

rules.name: Process Memory Dump via RdrLeakDiag.EXE
rules.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft Windows Resource Leak Diagnostic tool "rdrleakdiag.exe" to dump process memory

rules.name: Suspicious Parent Double Extension File Execution
rules.description: Detect execution of suspicious double extension files in ParentCommandLine

rules.name: Base64 MZ Header In CommandLine
rules.description: Detects encoded base64 MZ header in the commandline

rules.name: HackTool - ADCSPwn Execution
rules.description: Detects command line parameters used by ADCSPwn, a tool to escalate privileges in an active directory network by coercing authenticate from machine accounts and relaying to the certificate service

rules.name: Suspicious RDP Redirect Using TSCON
rules.description: Detects a suspicious RDP session redirect using tscon.exe

rules.name: HackTool - SharpMove Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of SharpMove, a .NET utility performing multiple tasks such as "Task Creation", "SCM" query, VBScript execution using WMI via its PE metadata and command line options.

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via PresentationHost.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "PresentationHost" which is a utility that runs ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files to download arbitrary files

rules.name: Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File
rules.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file

rules.name: Potential Binary Proxy Execution Via VSDiagnostics.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "VSDiagnostics.exe" with the "start" command in order to launch and proxy arbitrary binaries.

rules.name: PUA - Seatbelt Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the PUA/Recon tool Seatbelt via PE information of command line parameters

rules.name: VolumeShadowCopy Symlink Creation Via Mklink
rules.description: Shadow Copies storage symbolic link creation using operating systems utilities

rules.name: Potential WMI Lateral Movement WmiPrvSE Spawned PowerShell
rules.description: Detects Powershell as a child of the WmiPrvSE process. Which could be a sign of lateral movement via WMI.

rules.name: Visual Basic Command Line Compiler Usage
rules.description: Detects successful code compilation via Visual Basic Command Line Compiler that utilizes Windows Resource to Object Converter.

rules.name: Start of NT Virtual DOS Machine
rules.description: Ntvdm.exe allows the execution of 16-bit Windows applications on 32-bit Windows operating systems, as well as the execution of both 16-bit and 32-bit DOS applications

rules.name: Odbcconf.EXE Suspicious DLL Location
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" where the path of the DLL being registered is located in a potentially suspicious location.

rules.name: DLL Execution Via Register-cimprovider.exe
rules.description: Detects using register-cimprovider.exe to execute arbitrary dll file.

rules.name: Rundll32 Execution With Uncommon DLL Extension
rules.description: Detects the execution of rundll32 with a command line that doesn't contain a common extension

rules.name: PUA - Ngrok Execution
rules.description:
Detects the use of Ngrok, a utility used for port forwarding and tunneling, often used by threat actors to make local protected services publicly available.
Involved domains are bin.equinox.io for download and *.ngrok.io for connections.

rules.name: BitLockerTogo.EXE Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "BitLockerToGo.EXE".
BitLocker To Go is BitLocker Drive Encryption on removable data drives. This feature includes the encryption of, USB flash drives, SD cards, External hard disk drives, Other drives that are formatted by using the NTFS, FAT16, FAT32, or exFAT file system.
This is a rarely used application and usage of it at all is worth investigating.
Malware such as Lumma stealer has been seen using this process as a target for process hollowing.

rules.name: Sysinternals PsService Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsService which can be abused for service reconnaissance and tampering

rules.name: Malicious PowerShell Commandlets - ProcessCreation
rules.description: Detects Commandlet names from well-known PowerShell exploitation frameworks

rules.name: UAC Bypass via Windows Firewall Snap-In Hijack
rules.description: Detects attempts to bypass User Account Control (UAC) by hijacking the Microsoft Management Console (MMC) Windows Firewall snap-in

rules.name: Potential ReflectDebugger Content Execution Via WerFault.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "WerFault.exe" with the "-pr" commandline flag that is used to run files stored in the ReflectDebugger key which could be used to store the path to the malware in order to masquerade the execution flow

rules.name: Potential MSTSC Shadowing Activity
rules.description: Detects RDP session hijacking by using MSTSC shadowing

rules.name: HackTool - RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execution
rules.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook a automated breach emulations utility

rules.name: Process Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "process" flag, which adversary might use to list processes running on the compromised host or list installed software hotfixes and patches.

rules.name: Folder Compress To Potentially Suspicious Output Via Compress-Archive Cmdlet
rules.description:
Detects PowerShell scripts that make use of the "Compress-Archive" Cmdlet in order to compress folders and files where the output is stored in a potentially suspicious location that is used often by malware for exfiltration.
An adversary might compress data (e.g., sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

rules.name: Suspicious DumpMinitool Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious ways to use the "DumpMinitool.exe" binary

rules.name: Audit Policy Tampering Via NT Resource Kit Auditpol
rules.description:
Threat actors can use an older version of the auditpol binary available inside the NT resource kit to change audit policy configuration to impair detection capability.
This can be carried out by selectively disabling/removing certain audit policies as well as restoring a custom policy owned by the threat actor.

rules.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Service Installation
rules.description: Detects the installation of VsCode tunnel (code-tunnel) as a service.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP IP Pattern
rules.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download and install DLLs located remotely where the address is an IP address.

rules.name: Execution via stordiag.exe
rules.description: Detects the use of stordiag.exe to execute schtasks.exe systeminfo.exe and fltmc.exe

rules.name: Imports Registry Key From an ADS
rules.description: Detects the import of a alternate datastream to the registry with regedit.exe.

rules.name: ConvertTo-SecureString Cmdlet Usage Via CommandLine
rules.description: Detects usage of the "ConvertTo-SecureString" cmdlet via the commandline. Which is fairly uncommon and could indicate potential suspicious activity

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown
rules.description: Use of the commandline to shutdown or reboot windows

rules.name: PowerShell Get-Clipboard Cmdlet Via CLI
rules.description: Detects usage of the 'Get-Clipboard' cmdlet via CLI

rules.name: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of the "mshta" utility with an argument containing the "http" keyword, which could indicate that an attacker is executing a remotely hosted malicious hta file

rules.name: Uncommon Sigverif.EXE Child Process
rules.description: Detects uncommon child processes spawning from "sigverif.exe", which could indicate potential abuse of the latter as a living of the land binary in order to proxy execution.

rules.name: PowerShell DownloadFile
rules.description: Detects the execution of powershell, a WebClient object creation and the invocation of DownloadFile in a single command line

rules.name: File Decoded From Base64/Hex Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with either the "decode" or "decodehex" flags to decode base64 or hex encoded files. This can be abused by attackers to decode an encoded payload before execution

rules.name: Potential Obfuscated Ordinal Call Via Rundll32
rules.description: Detects execution of "rundll32" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls

rules.name: Windows Hotfix Updates Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of wmic with the "qfe" flag in order to obtain information about installed hotfix updates on the system. This is often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts

rules.name: HackTool - CoercedPotato Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of CoercedPotato, a tool for privilege escalation

rules.name: PUA - Nmap/Zenmap Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of namp/zenmap. Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts, including those that may be vulnerable to remote software exploitation

rules.name: Suspicious Response File Execution Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "-f" flag in order to load a response file with a non-".rsp" extension.

rules.name: Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension
rules.description: Detects a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start a instance with a custom extension

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Binary Rename
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

rules.name: Enumeration for 3rd Party Creds From CLI
rules.description: Detects processes that query known 3rd party registry keys that holds credentials via commandline

rules.name: Suspicious File Downloaded From Direct IP Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from direct IPs.

rules.name: Procdump Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of the SysInternals Procdump utility

rules.name: Share And Session Enumeration Using Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects attempts to enumerate file shares, printer shares and sessions using "net.exe" with the "view" flag.

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Activity Via Emoji Usage In CommandLine - 4
rules.description: Detects the usage of emojis in the command line, this could be a sign of potential defense evasion activity.

rules.name: Local Accounts Discovery
rules.description: Local accounts, System Owner/User discovery using operating systems utilities

rules.name: Suspicious WmiPrvSE Child Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious and uncommon child processes of WmiPrvSE

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell

rules.name: HackTool - Empire PowerShell Launch Parameters
rules.description: Detects suspicious powershell command line parameters used in Empire

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of Regasm/Regsvcs From Uncommon Location
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Regasm/Regsvcs utilities from a potentially suspicious location

rules.name: Email Exifiltration Via Powershell
rules.description: Detects email exfiltration via powershell cmdlets

rules.name: Suspicious Extrac32 Alternate Data Stream Execution
rules.description: Extract data from cab file and hide it in an alternate data stream

rules.name: Use Short Name Path in Image
rules.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image detection

rules.name: Potential Command Line Path Traversal Evasion Attempt
rules.description: Detects potential evasion or obfuscation attempts using bogus path traversal via the commandline

rules.name: Suspicious Advpack Call Via Rundll32.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "rundll32" calling "advpack.dll" with potential obfuscated ordinal calls in order to leverage the "RegisterOCX" function

rules.name: HackTool - SILENTTRINITY Stager Execution
rules.description: Detects SILENTTRINITY stager use via PE metadata

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution With Known Revoked Signing Certificate
rules.description:
Detects the execution of an AnyDesk binary with a version prior to 8.0.8.
Prior to version 8.0.8, the Anydesk application used a signing certificate that got compromised by threat actors.
Use this rule to detect instances of older versions of Anydesk using the compromised certificate
This is recommended in order to avoid attackers leveraging the certificate and signing their binaries to bypass detections.

rules.name: Root Certificate Installed From Susp Locations
rules.description: Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

rules.name: Exports Critical Registry Keys To a File
rules.description: Detects the export of a crital Registry key to a file.

rules.name: Rundll32 Execution Without Parameters
rules.description: Detects rundll32 execution without parameters as observed when running Metasploit windows/smb/psexec exploit module

rules.name: Curl Web Request With Potential Custom User-Agent
rules.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with a potential custom "User-Agent". Attackers can leverage this to download or exfiltrate data via "curl" to a domain that only accept specific "User-Agent" strings

rules.name: HackTool - F-Secure C3 Load by Rundll32
rules.description: F-Secure C3 produces DLLs with a default exported StartNodeRelay function.

rules.name: File Encryption/Decryption Via Gpg4win From Suspicious Locations
rules.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt/decrypt files located in potentially suspicious locations.

rules.name: Potential Register_App.Vbs LOLScript Abuse
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of the "register_app.vbs" script that is part of the Windows SDK. The script offers the capability to register new VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application. Attackers can use this to install malicious DLLs for persistence and execution.

rules.name: HackTool - KrbRelayUp Execution
rules.description: Detects KrbRelayUp used to perform a universal no-fix local privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced

rules.name: Hacktool Execution - Imphash
rules.description: Detects the execution of different Windows based hacktools via their import hash (imphash) even if the files have been renamed

rules.name: Unusual Child Process of dns.exe
rules.description: Detects an unexpected process spawning from dns.exe which may indicate activity related to remote code execution or other forms of exploitation as seen in CVE-2020-1350 (SigRed)

rules.name: LOLBAS Data Exfiltration by DataSvcUtil.exe
rules.description: Detects when a user performs data exfiltration by using DataSvcUtil.exe

rules.name: Potential File Download Via MS-AppInstaller Protocol Handler
rules.description:
Detects usage of the "ms-appinstaller" protocol handler via command line to potentially download arbitrary files via AppInstaller.EXE
The downloaded files are temporarly stored in ":\Users\%username%\AppData\Local\Packages\Microsoft.DesktopAppInstaller_8wekyb3d8bbwe\AC\INetCache\<RANDOM-8-CHAR-DIRECTORY>"

rules.name: New Virtual Smart Card Created Via TpmVscMgr.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "Tpmvscmgr.exe" to create a new virtual smart card.

rules.name: Curl Download And Execute Combination
rules.description: Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

rules.name: Application Removed Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects the removal or uninstallation of an application via "Wmic.EXE".

rules.name: Discovery of a System Time
rules.description: Identifies use of various commands to query a systems time. This technique may be used before executing a scheduled task or to discover the time zone of a target system.

rules.name: Cmd.EXE Missing Space Characters Execution Anomaly
rules.description:
Detects Windows command lines that miss a space before or after the /c flag when running a command using the cmd.exe.
This could be a sign of obfuscation of a fat finger problem (typo by the developer).

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Consent and Comctl32 - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using consent.exe and comctl32.dll (UACMe 22)

rules.name: Suspicious JavaScript Execution Via Mshta.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of javascript code using "mshta.exe".

rules.name: Finger.EXE Execution
rules.description:
Detects execution of the "finger.exe" utility.
Finger.EXE or "TCPIP Finger Command" is an old utility that is still present on modern Windows installation. It Displays information about users on a specified remote computer (typically a UNIX computer) that is running the finger service or daemon.
Due to the old nature of this utility and the rareness of machines having the finger service. Any execution of "finger.exe" can be considered "suspicious" and worth investigating.

rules.name: PowerShell Execution With Potential Decryption Capabilities
rules.description: Detects PowerShell commands that decrypt an ".LNK" "file to drop the next stage of the malware.

rules.name: Powershell Defender Disable Scan Feature
rules.description: Detects requests to disable Microsoft Defender features using PowerShell commands

rules.name: Suspicious Use of CSharp Interactive Console
rules.description: Detects the execution of CSharp interactive console by PowerShell

rules.name: Potential SMB Relay Attack Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects different hacktools used for relay attacks on Windows for privilege escalation

rules.name: Uninstall Sysinternals Sysmon
rules.description: Detects the removal of Sysmon, which could be a potential attempt at defense evasion

rules.name: File Download From IP URL Via Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects file downloads directly from IP address URL using curl.exe

rules.name: New DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "REGSVR" in order to register a new DLL (equivalent to running regsvr32). Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.

rules.name: Windows Binary Executed From WSL
rules.description:
Detects the execution of Windows binaries from within a WSL instance.
This could be used to masquerade parent-child relationships

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of BgInfo.EXE
rules.description: Detects uncommon child processes of "BgInfo.exe" which could be a sign of potential abuse of the binary to proxy execution via external VBScript

rules.name: Suspicious ZipExec Execution
rules.description: ZipExec is a Proof-of-Concept (POC) tool to wrap binary-based tools into a password-protected zip file.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Electron Application CommandLine
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious CommandLine of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a sign of abuse to proxy execution through a signed binary.

rules.name: Wusa.EXE Executed By Parent Process Located In Suspicious Location
rules.description:
Detects execution of the "wusa.exe" (Windows Update Standalone Installer) utility by a parent process that is located in a suspicious location.
Attackers could instantiate an instance of "wusa.exe" in order to bypass User Account Control (UAC). They can duplicate the access token from "wusa.exe" to gain elevated privileges.

rules.name: Potential Shim Database Persistence via Sdbinst.EXE
rules.description:
Detects installation of a new shim using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims

rules.name: Potential Privilege Escalation via Service Permissions Weakness
rules.description: Detect modification of services configuration (ImagePath, FailureCommand and ServiceDLL) in registry by processes with Medium integrity level

rules.name: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Using Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using the PowerShell Get-LocalGroupMember Cmdlet

rules.name: Suspicious SYSTEM User Process Creation
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process creation as SYSTEM user (suspicious program or command line parameter)

rules.name: Perl Inline Command Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of perl using the "-e"/"-E" flags. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live perl code.

rules.name: Schedule Task Creation From Env Variable Or Potentially Suspicious Path Via Schtasks.EXE
rules.description: Detects Schtask creations that point to a suspicious folder or an environment variable often used by malware

rules.name: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution
rules.description: Detects a suspicious call to Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet where the and output is located in a suspicious location

rules.name: File Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64. This can be abused by threat actors and attackers for data exfiltration

rules.name: Suspicious ShellExec_RunDLL Call Via Ordinal
rules.description:
Detects suspicious call to the "ShellExec_RunDLL" exported function of SHELL32.DLL through the ordinal number to launch other commands.
Adversary might only use the ordinal number in order to bypass existing detection that alert on usage of ShellExec_RunDLL on CommandLine.

rules.name: PUA - DIT Snapshot Viewer
rules.description: Detects the use of Ditsnap tool, an inspection tool for Active Directory database, ntds.dit.

rules.name: Indirect Inline Command Execution Via Bash.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of Microsoft bash launcher with the "-c" flag.
This can be used to potentially bypass defenses and execute Linux or Windows-based binaries directly via bash.

rules.name: Always Install Elevated Windows Installer
rules.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) trying to install MSI packages with SYSTEM privilege

rules.name: Copy From Or To Admin Share Or Sysvol Folder
rules.description: Detects a copy command or a copy utility execution to or from an Admin share or remote

rules.name: PrintBrm ZIP Creation of Extraction
rules.description: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN PrintBrm.exe, which can be used to create or extract ZIP files. PrintBrm.exe should not be run on a normal workstation.

rules.name: Suspicious Download Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files.

rules.name: InfDefaultInstall.exe .inf Execution
rules.description: Executes SCT script using scrobj.dll from a command in entered into a specially prepared INF file.

rules.name: DeviceCredentialDeployment Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of DeviceCredentialDeployment to hide a process from view

rules.name: OneNote.EXE Execution of Malicious Embedded Scripts
rules.description:
Detects the execution of malicious OneNote documents that contain embedded scripts.
When a user clicks on a OneNote attachment and then on the malicious link inside the ".one" file, it exports and executes the malicious embedded script from specific directories.

rules.name: Renamed MegaSync Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed MegaSync.exe as seen used by ransomware families like Nefilim, Sodinokibi, Pysa, and Conti.

rules.name: Potential SquiblyTwo Technique Execution
rules.description: Detects potential SquiblyTwo attack technique with possible renamed WMIC via Imphash and OriginalFileName fields

rules.name: PUA - Mouse Lock Execution
rules.description: In Kaspersky's 2020 Incident Response Analyst Report they listed legitimate tool "Mouse Lock" as being used for both credential access and collection in security incidents.

rules.name: Windows Share Mount Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects when a share is mounted using the "net.exe" utility

rules.name: Remote File Download Via Findstr.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "findstr" with specific flags and a remote share path. This specific set of CLI flags would allow "findstr" to download the content of the file located on the remote share as described in the LOLBAS entry.

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via LSASS Process Clone
rules.description: Detects a suspicious LSASS process process clone that could be a sign of credential dumping activity

rules.name: Nslookup PowerShell Download Cradle - ProcessCreation
rules.description: Detects suspicious powershell download cradle using nslookup. This cradle uses nslookup to extract payloads from DNS records

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Ping/Copy Command Combination
rules.description: Detects uncommon and potentially suspicious one-liner command containing both "ping" and "copy" at the same time, which is usually used by malware.

rules.name: Arbitrary Shell Command Execution Via Settingcontent-Ms
rules.description: The .SettingContent-ms file type was introduced in Windows 10 and allows a user to create "shortcuts" to various Windows 10 setting pages. These files are simply XML and contain paths to various Windows 10 settings binaries.

rules.name: ETW Logging Tamper In .NET Processes Via CommandLine
rules.description:
Detects changes to environment variables related to ETW logging via the CommandLine.
This could indicate potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

rules.name: DllUnregisterServer Function Call Via Msiexec.EXE
rules.description: Detects MsiExec loading a DLL and calling its DllUnregisterServer function

rules.name: All Backups Deleted Via Wbadmin.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the deletion of all backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.

rules.name: Registry Modification Via Regini.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of regini.exe which can be used to modify registry keys, the changes are imported from one or more text files.

rules.name: File With Suspicious Extension Downloaded Via Bitsadmin
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file with a suspicious extension

rules.name: Suspicious DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE
rules.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to load the target DLL file.

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Defender Folder Exclusion Added Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to add Defender folder exclusions. Qbot has been seen using this technique to add exclusions for folders within AppData and ProgramData.

rules.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via OfflineScannerShell.EXE Execution
rules.description:
Detects execution of Windows Defender "OfflineScannerShell.exe" from its non standard directory.
The "OfflineScannerShell.exe" binary is vulnerable to DLL side loading and will load any DLL named "mpclient.dll" from the current working directory.

rules.name: Computer System Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of wmic utility with the "computersystem" flag in order to obtain information about the machine such as the domain, username, model, etc.

rules.name: HackTool - Default PowerSploit/Empire Scheduled Task Creation
rules.description: Detects the creation of a schtask via PowerSploit or Empire Default Configuration.

rules.name: Tamper Windows Defender Remove-MpPreference
rules.description: Detects attempts to remove Windows Defender configurations using the 'MpPreference' cmdlet

rules.name: Self Extracting Package Creation Via Iexpress.EXE From Potentially Suspicious Location
rules.description:
Detects the use of iexpress.exe to create binaries via Self Extraction Directive (SED) files located in potentially suspicious locations.
This behavior has been observed in-the-wild by different threat actors.

rules.name: Suspicious Diantz Alternate Data Stream Execution
rules.description: Compress target file into a cab file stored in the Alternate Data Stream (ADS) of the target file.

rules.name: Potential Adplus.EXE Abuse
rules.description: Detects execution of "AdPlus.exe", a binary that is part of the Windows SDK that can be used as a LOLBIN in order to dump process memory and execute arbitrary commands.

rules.name: Obfuscated PowerShell OneLiner Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a specific OneLiner to download and execute powershell modules in memory.

rules.name: New User Created Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Identifies the creation of local users via the net.exe command.

rules.name: MMC20 Lateral Movement
rules.description: Detects MMC20.Application Lateral Movement; specifically looks for the spawning of the parent MMC.exe with a command line of "-Embedding" as a child of svchost.exe

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - NetSupport Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Add Insecure Download Source To Winget
rules.description:
Detects usage of winget to add a new insecure (http) download source.
Winget will not allow the addition of insecure sources, hence this could indicate potential suspicious activity (or typos)

rules.name: DumpStack.log Defender Evasion
rules.description: Detects the use of the filename DumpStack.log to evade Microsoft Defender

rules.name: Deleted Data Overwritten Via Cipher.EXE
rules.description:
Detects usage of the "cipher" built-in utility in order to overwrite deleted data from disk.
Adversaries may destroy data and files on specific systems or in large numbers on a network to interrupt availability to systems, services, and network resources.
Data destruction is likely to render stored data irrecoverable by forensic techniques through overwriting files or data on local and remote drives

rules.name: Suspicious Group And Account Reconnaissance Activity Using Net.EXE
rules.description:
Detects suspicious reconnaissance command line activity on Windows systems using Net.EXE
Check if the user that executed the commands is suspicious (e.g. service accounts, LOCAL_SYSTEM)

rules.name: Persistence Via TypedPaths - CommandLine
rules.description: Detects modification addition to the 'TypedPaths' key in the user or admin registry via the commandline. Which might indicate persistence attempt

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of DiskShadow.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "Diskshadow.exe". This could be an attempt to bypass parent/child relationship detection or application whitelisting rules.

rules.name: Shadow Copies Deletion Using Operating Systems Utilities
rules.description: Shadow Copies deletion using operating systems utilities

rules.name: Potential Binary Impersonating Sysinternals Tools
rules.description:
Detects binaries that use the same name as legitimate sysinternals tools to evade detection.
This rule looks for the execution of binaries that are named similarly to Sysinternals tools.
Adversary may rename their malicious tools as legitimate Sysinternals tools to evade detection.

rules.name: HackTool - XORDump Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious use of XORDump process memory dumping utility

rules.name: Renamed Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of renamed Remote Utilities (RURAT) via Product PE header field

rules.name: Suspicious Command Patterns In Scheduled Task Creation
rules.description: Detects scheduled task creation using "schtasks" that contain potentially suspicious or uncommon commands

rules.name: Script Interpreter Execution From Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects a suspicious script execution in temporary folders or folders accessible by environment variables

rules.name: Use Short Name Path in Command Line
rules.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

rules.name: File Download Via Windows Defender MpCmpRun.EXE
rules.description: Detects the use of Windows Defender MpCmdRun.EXE to download files

rules.name: Suspicious Program Names
rules.description: Detects suspicious patterns in program names or folders that are often found in malicious samples or hacktools

rules.name: Exports Registry Key To a File
rules.description: Detects the export of the target Registry key to a file.

rules.name: Potential Renamed Rundll32 Execution
rules.description: Detects when 'DllRegisterServer' is called in the commandline and the image is not rundll32. This could mean that the 'rundll32' utility has been renamed in order to avoid detection

rules.name: Execute From Alternate Data Streams
rules.description: Detects execution from an Alternate Data Stream (ADS). Adversaries may use NTFS file attributes to hide their malicious data in order to evade detection

rules.name: Assembly Loading Via CL_LoadAssembly.ps1
rules.description: Detects calls to "LoadAssemblyFromPath" or "LoadAssemblyFromNS" that are part of the "CL_LoadAssembly.ps1" script. This can be abused to load different assemblies and bypass App locker controls.

rules.name: HackTool - Impersonate Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the Impersonate tool. Which can be used to manipulate tokens on a Windows computers remotely (PsExec/WmiExec) or interactively

rules.name: New Generic Credentials Added Via Cmdkey.EXE
rules.description:
Detects usage of "cmdkey.exe" to add generic credentials.
As an example, this can be used before connecting to an RDP session via command line interface.

rules.name: Renamed Sysinternals Sdelete Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of a renamed SysInternals Sdelete, which is something an administrator shouldn't do (the renaming)

rules.name: Suspicious Execution Location Of Wermgr.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) execution location.

rules.name: Uncommon Extension Shim Database Installation Via Sdbinst.EXE
rules.description:
Detects installation of a potentially suspicious new shim with an uncommon extension using sdbinst.exe.
Adversaries may establish persistence and/or elevate privileges by executing malicious content triggered by application shims

rules.name: PUA - NirCmd Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity

rules.name: MsiExec Web Install
rules.description: Detects suspicious msiexec process starts with web addresses as parameter

rules.name: PktMon.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of PktMon, a tool that captures network packets.

rules.name: Potential Hidden Directory Creation Via NTFS INDEX_ALLOCATION Stream - CLI
rules.description: Detects command line containing reference to the "::$index_allocation" stream, which can be used as a technique to prevent access to folders or files from tooling such as "explorer.exe" or "powershell.exe"

rules.name: OpenWith.exe Executes Specified Binary
rules.description: The OpenWith.exe executes other binary

rules.name: Disable Important Scheduled Task
rules.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

rules.name: Kavremover Dropped Binary LOLBIN Usage
rules.description: Detects the execution of a signed binary dropped by Kaspersky Lab Products Remover (kavremover) which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary commands and binaries.

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using curl.exe

rules.name: Windows Kernel Debugger Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the Windows Kernel Debugger "kd.exe".

rules.name: Suspicious Processes Spawned by Java.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious processes spawned from a Java host process which could indicate a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j)

rules.name: Uncommon  Assistive Technology Applications Execution Via AtBroker.EXE
rules.description: Detects the start of a non built-in assistive technology applications via "Atbroker.EXE".

rules.name: Local Groups Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "wmic" with the "group" flag.
Adversaries may attempt to find local system groups and permission settings.
The knowledge of local system permission groups can help adversaries determine which groups exist and which users belong to a particular group.
Adversaries may use this information to determine which users have elevated permissions, such as the users found within the local administrators group.

rules.name: HackTool - SharpLDAPmonitor Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the SharpLDAPmonitor. Which can monitor the creation, deletion and changes to LDAP objects.

rules.name: PUA - AdvancedRun Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility

rules.name: Process Memory Dump Via Dotnet-Dump
rules.description: Detects the execution of "dotnet-dump" with the "collect" flag. The execution could indicate potential process dumping of critical processes such as LSASS.

rules.name: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
rules.description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder

rules.name: HackTool - SharpWSUS/WSUSpendu Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of SharpWSUS or WSUSpendu, utilities that allow for lateral movement through WSUS.
Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) is a critical component of Windows systems and is frequently configured in a way that allows an attacker to circumvent internal networking limitations.

rules.name: Uncommon Svchost Parent Process
rules.description: Detects an uncommon svchost parent process

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER

rules.name: Chopper Webshell Process Pattern
rules.description: Detects patterns found in process executions cause by China Chopper like tiny (ASPX) webshells

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Server Web Shell Execution
rules.description: Detects potential web shell execution from the ScreenConnect server process.

rules.name: Capture Credentials with Rpcping.exe
rules.description: Detects using Rpcping.exe to send a RPC test connection to the target server (-s) and force the NTLM hash to be sent in the process.

rules.name: ShimCache Flush
rules.description: Detects actions that clear the local ShimCache and remove forensic evidence

rules.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Reflective Assembly Load
rules.description: Detects base64 encoded .NET reflective loading of Assembly

rules.name: WmiPrvSE Spawned A Process
rules.description: Detects WmiPrvSE spawning a process

rules.name: HackTool - PurpleSharp Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the PurpleSharp adversary simulation tool

rules.name: Persistence Via Sticky Key Backdoor
rules.description:
By replacing the sticky keys executable with the local admins CMD executable, an attacker is able to access a privileged windows console session without authenticating to the system.
When the sticky keys are "activated" the privilleged shell is launched.

rules.name: PUA - DefenderCheck Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of DefenderCheck, a tool to evaluate the signatures used in Microsoft Defender. It can be used to figure out the strings / byte chains used in Microsoft Defender to detect a tool and thus used for AV evasion.

rules.name: Suspicious RASdial Activity
rules.description: Detects suspicious process related to rasdial.exe

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious ASP.NET Compilation Via AspNetCompiler
rules.description: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" with potentially suspicious paths for compilation.

rules.name: Suspicious Powercfg Execution To Change Lock Screen Timeout
rules.description: Detects suspicious execution of 'Powercfg.exe' to change lock screen timeout

rules.name: Potential Password Spraying Attempt Using Dsacls.EXE
rules.description: Detects possible password spraying attempts using Dsacls

rules.name: Driver/DLL Installation Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with "INSTALLDRIVER" which installs a new ODBC driver. Attackers abuse this to install and run malicious DLLs.

rules.name: 7Zip Compressing Dump Files
rules.description: Detects execution of 7z in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

rules.name: Indirect Command Execution By Program Compatibility Wizard
rules.description: Detect indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant pcwrun.exe

rules.name: Suspicious Msiexec Quiet Install From Remote Location
rules.description: Detects usage of Msiexec.exe to install packages hosted remotely quietly

rules.name: PUA - 3Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of 3proxy, a tiny free proxy server

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary File Download Via Cmdl32.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of Cmdl32 with the "/vpn" and "/lan" flags.
Attackers can abuse this utility in order to download arbitrary files via a configuration file.
Inspect the location and the content of the file passed as an argument in order to determine if it is suspicious.

rules.name: Portable Gpg.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of "gpg.exe" from uncommon location. Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

rules.name: HackTool - PowerTool Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the tool PowerTool which has the ability to kill a process, delete its process file, unload drivers, and delete the driver files

rules.name: Dllhost.EXE Execution Anomaly
rules.description: Detects a "dllhost" process spawning with no commandline arguments which is very rare to happen and could indicate process injection activity or malware mimicking similar system processes.

rules.name: Findstr Launching .lnk File
rules.description: Detects usage of findstr to identify and execute a lnk file as seen within the HHS redirect attack

rules.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code
rules.description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.exe.

rules.name: Suspicious Microsoft Office Child Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from one of the Microsoft Office suite products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio, etc.)

rules.name: File Download with Headless Browser
rules.description: Detects execution of chromium based browser in headless mode using the "dump-dom" command line to download files

rules.name: HackTool - Covenant PowerShell Launcher
rules.description: Detects suspicious command lines used in Covenant luanchers

rules.name: Suspect Svchost Activity
rules.description: It is extremely abnormal for svchost.exe to spawn without any CLI arguments and is normally observed when a malicious process spawns the process and injects code into the process memory space.

rules.name: PUA- IOX Tunneling Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of IOX - a tool for port forwarding and intranet proxy purposes

rules.name: Suspicious High IntegrityLevel Conhost Legacy Option
rules.description: ForceV1 asks for information directly from the kernel space. Conhost connects to the console application. High IntegrityLevel means the process is running with elevated privileges, such as an Administrator context.

rules.name: Audio Capture via PowerShell
rules.description: Detects audio capture via PowerShell Cmdlet.

rules.name: Cloudflared Tunnel Connections Cleanup
rules.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool with the tunnel "cleanup" flag in order to cleanup tunnel connections.

rules.name: PUA - Advanced Port Scanner Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Advanced Port Scanner.

rules.name: Rebuild Performance Counter Values Via Lodctr.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "lodctr.exe" to rebuild the performance counter registry values. This can be abused by attackers by providing a malicious config file to overwrite performance counter configuration to confuse and evade monitoring and security solutions.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts

rules.name: Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer
rules.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Remote Command Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a system command via the ScreenConnect RMM service.

rules.name: Renamed AutoIt Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of a renamed AutoIt2.exe or AutoIt3.exe.
AutoIt is a scripting language and automation tool for Windows systems. While primarily used for legitimate automation tasks, it can be misused in cyber attacks.
Attackers can leverage AutoIt to create and distribute malware, including keyloggers, spyware, and botnets. A renamed AutoIt executable is particularly suspicious.

rules.name: Potentially Over Permissive Permissions Granted Using Dsacls.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of Dsacls to grant over permissive permissions

rules.name: Use of Wfc.exe
rules.description: The Workflow Command-line Compiler can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.

rules.name: Remote Code Execute via Winrm.vbs
rules.description: Detects an attempt to execute code or create service on remote host via winrm.vbs.

rules.name: Whoami Utility Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of whoami, which is often used by attackers after exploitation / privilege escalation

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - RURAT Execution From Unusual Location
rules.description: Detects execution of Remote Utilities RAT (RURAT) from an unusual location (outside of 'C:\Program Files')

rules.name: Firewall Configuration Discovery Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

rules.name: Sysinternals PsSuspend Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious execution of Sysinternals PsSuspend, where the utility is used to suspend critical processes such as AV or EDR to bypass defenses

rules.name: Potential Data Stealing Via Chromium Headless Debugging
rules.description: Detects chromium based browsers starting in headless and debugging mode and pointing to a user profile. This could be a sign of data stealing or remote control

rules.name: SQLite Firefox Profile Data DB Access
rules.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Firefox and other Gecko-based browsers for potential data stealing.

rules.name: Hiding Files with Attrib.exe
rules.description: Detects usage of attrib.exe to hide files from users.

rules.name: New Remote Desktop Connection Initiated Via Mstsc.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the usage of "mstsc.exe" with the "/v" flag to initiate a connection to a remote server.
Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

rules.name: Suspicious UltraVNC Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious UltraVNC command line flag combination that indicate a auto reconnect upon execution, e.g. startup (as seen being used by Gamaredon threat group)

rules.name: Suspicious Scan Loop Network
rules.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system

rules.name: Execute MSDT Via Answer File
rules.description: Detects execution of "msdt.exe" using an answer file which is simulating the legitimate way of calling msdt via "pcwrun.exe" (For example from the compatibility tab)

rules.name: HackTool - Impacket Tools Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of different compiled Windows binaries of the impacket toolset (based on names or part of their names - could lead to false positives)

rules.name: Suspicious Plink Port Forwarding
rules.description: Detects suspicious Plink tunnel port forwarding to a local port

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary Command Execution Via FTP.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "ftp.exe" script with the "-s" or "/s" flag and any child processes ran by "ftp.exe".

rules.name: Forfiles Command Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "forfiles" with the "/c" flag.
While this is an expected behavior of the tool, it can be abused in order to proxy execution through it with any binary.
Can be used to bypass application whitelisting.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious JWT Token Search Via CLI
rules.description:
Detects possible search for JWT tokens via CLI by looking for the string "eyJ0eX" or "eyJhbG".
This string is used as an anchor to look for the start of the JWT token used by microsoft office and similar apps.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Disk Cleanup
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using scheduled tasks and variable expansion of cleanmgr.exe (UACMe 34)

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Desktop Background Change Using Reg.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "reg.exe" to alter registry keys that would replace the user's desktop background.
This is a common technique used by malware to change the desktop background to a ransom note or other image.

rules.name: Rundll32 Spawned Via Explorer.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "rundll32.exe" with a parent process of Explorer.exe. This has been observed by variants of Raspberry Robin, as first reported by Red Canary.

rules.name: RestrictedAdminMode Registry Value Tampering - ProcCreation
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "DisableRestrictedAdmin" registry value in order to disable or enable RestrictedAdmin mode.
RestrictedAdmin mode prevents the transmission of reusable credentials to the remote system to which you connect using Remote Desktop.
This prevents your credentials from being harvested during the initial connection process if the remote server has been compromise

rules.name: Query Usage To Exfil Data
rules.description: Detects usage of "query.exe" a system binary to exfil information such as "sessions" and "processes" for later use

rules.name: New Kernel Driver Via SC.EXE
rules.description: Detects creation of a new service (kernel driver) with the type "kernel"

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file download from file sharing domains using curl.exe

rules.name: PowerShell Script Change Permission Via Set-Acl
rules.description: Detects PowerShell execution to set the ACL of a file or a folder

rules.name: DSInternals Suspicious PowerShell Cmdlets
rules.description:
Detects execution and usage of the DSInternals PowerShell module. Which can be used to perform what might be considered as suspicious activity such as dumping DPAPI backup keys or manipulating NTDS.DIT files.
The DSInternals PowerShell Module exposes several internal features of Active Directory and Azure Active Directory. These include FIDO2 and NGC key auditing, offline ntds.dit file manipulation, password auditing, DC recovery from IFM backups and password hash calculation.

rules.name: File Decryption Using Gpg4win
rules.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to decrypt files
