rules.name: Potential Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS
rules.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine

rules.name: PUA - Chisel Tunneling Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of the Chisel tunneling tool via the commandline arguments

rules.name: Suspicious CodePage Switch Via CHCP
rules.description: Detects a code page switch in command line or batch scripts to a rare language

rules.name: Suspicious AddinUtil.EXE CommandLine Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) with suspicious Addinroot or Pipelineroot paths. An adversary may execute AddinUtil.exe with uncommon Addinroot/Pipelineroot paths that point to the adversaries Addins.Store payload.

rules.name: HackTool - Inveigh Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Inveigh a cross-platform .NET IPv4/IPv6 machine-in-the-middle tool

rules.name: Renamed PingCastle Binary Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "PingCastle" binary based on the PE metadata fields.

rules.name: Copy From VolumeShadowCopy Via Cmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of the builtin "copy" command that targets a shadow copy (sometimes used to copy registry hives that are in use)

rules.name: Mshtml.DLL RunHTMLApplication Suspicious Usage
rules.description: Detects execution of commands that leverage the "mshtml.dll" RunHTMLApplication export to run arbitrary code via different protocol handlers (vbscript, javascript, file, http...)

rules.name: Bypass UAC via CMSTP
rules.description: Detect commandline usage of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer (cmstp.exe) to install specially formatted local .INF files

rules.name: Remote XSL Execution Via Msxsl.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of the "msxsl" binary with an "http" keyword in the command line. This might indicate a potential remote execution of XSL files.

rules.name: Shell Process Spawned by Java.EXE
rules.description: Detects shell spawned from Java host process, which could be a sign of exploitation (e.g. log4j exploitation)

rules.name: Renamed BOINC Client Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed BOINC binary.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation
rules.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the following code block

rules.name: Suspicious Reconnaissance Activity Via GatherNetworkInfo.VBS
rules.description: Detects execution of the built-in script located in "C:\Windows\System32\gatherNetworkInfo.vbs". Which can be used to gather information about the target machine

rules.name: Control Panel Items
rules.description: Detects the malicious use of a control panel item

rules.name: HackTool - TruffleSnout Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of TruffleSnout.exe an iterative AD discovery toolkit for offensive operators, situational awareness and targeted low noise enumeration.

rules.name: Elevated System Shell Spawned From Uncommon Parent Location
rules.description: Detects when a shell program such as the Windows command prompt or PowerShell is launched with system privileges from a uncommon parent location.

rules.name: Potential Binary Proxy Execution Via Cdb.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "cdb.exe" to launch arbitrary processes or commands from a debugger script file

rules.name: Compressed File Extraction Via Tar.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of "tar.exe" in order to extract compressed file.
Adversaries may abuse various utilities in order to decompress data to avoid detection.

rules.name: DLL Sideloading by VMware Xfer Utility
rules.description: Detects execution of VMware Xfer utility (VMwareXferlogs.exe) from the non-default directory which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL

rules.name: CodePage Modification Via MODE.COM To Russian Language
rules.description:
Detects a CodePage modification using the "mode.com" utility to Russian language.
This behavior has been used by threat actors behind Dharma ransomware.

rules.name: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
rules.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

rules.name: Malicious Base64 Encoded PowerShell Keywords in Command Lines
rules.description: Detects base64 encoded strings used in hidden malicious PowerShell command lines

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Attempt Using New NetworkProvider - CLI
rules.description: Detects when an attacker tries to add a new network provider in order to dump clear text credentials, similar to how the NPPSpy tool does it

rules.name: Interactive AT Job
rules.description: Detects an interactive AT job, which may be used as a form of privilege escalation.

rules.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via CertMgr.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system.
Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

rules.name: Schtasks From Suspicious Folders
rules.description: Detects scheduled task creations that have suspicious action command and folder combinations

rules.name: HackTool - PCHunter Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious use of PCHunter, a tool like Process Hacker to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level stuff

rules.name: HackTool - LaZagne Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the LaZagne. A utility used to retrieve multiple types of passwords stored on a local computer.
LaZagne has been leveraged multiple times by threat actors in order to dump credentials.

rules.name: Suspicious AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument

rules.name: Potential LethalHTA Technique Execution
rules.description: Detects potential LethalHTA technique where the "mshta.exe" is spawned by an "svchost.exe" process

rules.name: Delete Important Scheduled Task
rules.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

rules.name: Cscript/Wscript Uncommon Script Extension Execution
rules.description: Detects Wscript/Cscript executing a file with an uncommon (i.e. non-script) extension

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell IEX Execution Patterns
rules.description: Detects suspicious ways to run Invoke-Execution using IEX alias

rules.name: Webshell Tool Reconnaissance Activity
rules.description: Detects processes spawned from web servers (PHP, Tomcat, IIS, etc.) that perform reconnaissance looking for the existence of popular scripting tools (perl, python, wget) on the system via the help commands

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Powershell Search Order Hijacking - Task
rules.description: Detects suspicious powershell execution via a schedule task where the command ends with an suspicious flags to hide the powershell instance instead of executeing scripts or commands. This could be a sign of persistence via PowerShell "Get-Variable" technique as seen being used in Colibri Loader

rules.name: Wab Execution From Non Default Location
rules.description: Detects execution of wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) from non default locations as seen with bumblebee activity

rules.name: Disable Windows Defender AV Security Monitoring
rules.description: Detects attackers attempting to disable Windows Defender using Powershell

rules.name: Regsvr32 Execution From Highly Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a highly suspicious locations

rules.name: Suspicious Mshta.EXE Execution Patterns
rules.description: Detects suspicious mshta process execution patterns

rules.name: Potential CobaltStrike Process Patterns
rules.description: Detects potential process patterns related to Cobalt Strike beacon activity

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of Systeminfo
rules.description: Detects usage of the "systeminfo" command to retrieve information

rules.name: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
rules.description: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process of AspNetCompiler
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "aspnet_compiler.exe".

rules.name: Suspicious Encoded PowerShell Command Line
rules.description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)

rules.name: Potential Regsvr32 Commandline Flag Anomaly
rules.description: Detects a potential command line flag anomaly related to "regsvr32" in which the "/i" flag is used without the "/n" which should be uncommon.

rules.name: User Added to Local Administrators Group
rules.description: Detects addition of users to the local administrator group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

rules.name: Potential Script Proxy Execution Via CL_Mutexverifiers.ps1
rules.description: Detects the use of the Microsoft signed script "CL_mutexverifiers" to proxy the execution of additional PowerShell script commands

rules.name: Abusing Print Executable
rules.description: Attackers can use print.exe for remote file copy

rules.name: AADInternals PowerShell Cmdlets Execution - ProccessCreation
rules.description: Detects ADDInternals Cmdlet execution. A tool for administering Azure AD and Office 365. Which can be abused by threat actors to attack Azure AD or Office 365.

rules.name: IE ZoneMap Setting Downgraded To MyComputer Zone For HTTP Protocols Via CLI
rules.description: Detects changes to Internet Explorer's (IE / Windows Internet properties) ZoneMap configuration of the "HTTP" and "HTTPS" protocols to point to the "My Computer" zone. This allows downloaded files from the Internet to be granted the same level of trust as files stored locally.

rules.name: User Added to Remote Desktop Users Group
rules.description: Detects addition of users to the local Remote Desktop Users group via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

rules.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation via Masqueraded XML File
rules.description: Detects the creation of a scheduled task using the "-XML" flag with a file without the '.xml' extension. This behavior could be indicative of potential defense evasion attempt during persistence

rules.name: Logged-On User Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE
rules.description: Detects password change for the logged-on user's via "ksetup.exe"

rules.name: Suspicious Registry Modification From ADS Via Regini.EXE
rules.description: Detects the import of an alternate data stream with regini.exe, regini.exe can be used to modify registry keys.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Cabinet File Expansion
rules.description: Detects the expansion or decompression of cabinet files from potentially suspicious or uncommon locations, e.g. seen in Iranian MeteorExpress related attacks

rules.name: CMSTP Execution Process Creation
rules.description: Detects various indicators of Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer execution

rules.name: Suspicious Copy From or To System Directory
rules.description:
Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a program from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk.
Often used to move LOLBINs such as 'certutil' or 'desktopimgdownldr' to a different location with a different name in order to bypass detections based on locations.

rules.name: Potential Browser Data Stealing
rules.description:
Adversaries may acquire credentials from web browsers by reading files specific to the target browser.
Web browsers commonly save credentials such as website usernames and passwords so that they do not need to be entered manually in the future.
Web browsers typically store the credentials in an encrypted format within a credential store.

rules.name: Suspicious Ping/Del Command Combination
rules.description: Detects a method often used by ransomware. Which combines the "ping" to wait a couple of seconds and then "del" to delete the file in question. Its used to hide the file responsible for the initial infection for example

rules.name: Base64 Encoded PowerShell Command Detected
rules.description: Detects usage of the "FromBase64String" function in the commandline which is used to decode a base64 encoded string

rules.name: Sensitive File Access Via Volume Shadow Copy Backup
rules.description: Detects a command that accesses the VolumeShadowCopy in order to extract sensitive files such as the Security or SAM registry hives or the AD database (ntds.dit)

rules.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Existing Service Tampering
rules.description: Detects the modification of an existing service in order to execute an arbitrary payload when the service is started or killed as a potential method for persistence.

rules.name: Windows Admin Share Mount Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects when an admin share is mounted using net.exe

rules.name: Suspicious IIS Module Registration
rules.description: Detects a suspicious IIS module registration as described in Microsoft threat report on IIS backdoors

rules.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin To An Uncommon Target Folder
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file to uncommon target folder

rules.name: PUA - Radmin Viewer Utility Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of Radmin which can be abused by an adversary to remotely control Windows machines

rules.name: Remote File Download Via Desktopimgdownldr Utility
rules.description: Detects the desktopimgdownldr utility being used to download a remote file. An adversary may use desktopimgdownldr to download arbitrary files as an alternative to certutil.

rules.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded Invoke Keyword
rules.description: Detects UTF-8 and UTF-16 Base64 encoded powershell 'Invoke-' calls

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of Regsvr32
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "regsvr32.exe".

rules.name: HackTool - Empire PowerShell UAC Bypass
rules.description: Detects some Empire PowerShell UAC bypass methods

rules.name: Suspicious Execution From Outlook Temporary Folder
rules.description: Detects a suspicious program execution in Outlook temp folder

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - MeshAgent Command Execution via MeshCentral
rules.description:
Detects the use of MeshAgent to execute commands on the target host, particularly when threat actors might abuse it to execute commands directly.
MeshAgent can execute commands on the target host by leveraging win-console to obscure their activities and win-dispatcher to run malicious code through IPC with child processes.

rules.name: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
rules.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

rules.name: Suspicious Query of MachineGUID
rules.description: Use of reg to get MachineGuid information

rules.name: Wab/Wabmig Unusual Parent Or Child Processes
rules.description: Detects unusual parent or children of the wab.exe (Windows Contacts) and Wabmig.exe (Microsoft Address Book Import Tool) processes as seen being used with bumblebee activity

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - Anydesk Execution From Suspicious Folder
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of Shutdown to Log Out
rules.description: Detects the rare use of the command line tool shutdown to logoff a user

rules.name: Use of VSIISExeLauncher.exe
rules.description: The "VSIISExeLauncher.exe" binary part of the Visual Studio/VS Code can be used to execute arbitrary binaries

rules.name: Suspicious TSCON Start as SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects a tscon.exe start as LOCAL SYSTEM

rules.name: ManageEngine Endpoint Central Dctask64.EXE Potential Abuse
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "dctask64.exe", a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.

rules.name: Group Membership Reconnaissance Via Whoami.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of whoami.exe with the /group command line flag to show group membership for the current user, account type, security identifiers (SID), and attributes.

rules.name: Suspicious Workstation Locking via Rundll32
rules.description: Detects a suspicious call to the user32.dll function that locks the user workstation

rules.name: Potential Excel.EXE DCOM Lateral Movement Via ActivateMicrosoftApp
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.

rules.name: HackTool - GMER Rootkit Detector and Remover Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution GMER tool based on image and hash fields.

rules.name: File Download From IP Based URL Via CertOC.EXE
rules.description: Detects when a user downloads a file from an IP based URL using CertOC.exe

rules.name: Powershell Inline Execution From A File
rules.description: Detects inline execution of PowerShell code from a file

rules.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution Patterns
rules.description: Detects various execution patterns of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Download and Execute Pattern
rules.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell download patterns that are often used in malicious scripts, stagers or downloaders (make sure that your backend applies the strings case-insensitive)

rules.name: CreateDump Process Dump
rules.description: Detects uses of the createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Veeam Dabatase
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Veeam service process. This could indicate potential RCE or SQL Injection.

rules.name: Suspicious Remote Child Process From Outlook
rules.description: Detects a suspicious child process spawning from Outlook where the image is located in a remote location (SMB/WebDav shares).

rules.name: XSL Script Execution Via WMIC.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of WMIC with the "format" flag to potentially load XSL files.
Adversaries abuse this functionality to execute arbitrary files while potentially bypassing application whitelisting defenses.
Extensible Stylesheet Language (XSL) files are commonly used to describe the processing and rendering of data within XML files.

rules.name: Suspicious Electron Application Child Processes
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of electron apps (teams, discord, slack, etc.). This could be a potential sign of ".asar" file tampering (See reference section for more information) or binary execution proxy through specific CLI arguments (see related rule)

rules.name: Bypass UAC via WSReset.exe
rules.description: Detects use of WSReset.exe to bypass User Account Control (UAC). Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

rules.name: Greedy File Deletion Using Del
rules.description: Detects execution of the "del" builtin command to remove files using greedy/wildcard expression. This is often used by malware to delete content of folders that perhaps contains the initial malware infection or to delete evidence.

rules.name: Suspicious Double Extension File Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious use of an .exe extension after a non-executable file extension like .pdf.exe, a set of spaces or underlines to cloak the executable file in spear phishing campaigns

rules.name: Enable LM Hash Storage - ProcCreation
rules.description:
Detects changes to the "NoLMHash" registry value in order to allow Windows to store LM Hashes.
By setting this registry value to "0" (DWORD), Windows will be allowed to store a LAN manager hash of your password in Active Directory and local SAM databases.

rules.name: Cloudflared Tunnel Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the "cloudflared" tool to connect back to a tunnel. This was seen used by threat actors to maintain persistence and remote access to compromised networks.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using PkgMgr and DISM
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using pkgmgr.exe and dism.exe (UACMe 23)

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Right-to-Left Override
rules.description:
Detects the presence of the "u202+E" character, which causes a terminal, browser, or operating system to render text in a right-to-left sequence.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques.

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Conhost.EXE
rules.description: Detects uncommon "conhost" child processes. This could be a sign of "conhost" usage as a LOLBIN or potential process injection activity.

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Mailbox Export to Share
rules.description: Detects usage of the powerShell New-MailboxExportRequest Cmdlet to exports a mailbox to a remote or local share, as used in ProxyShell exploitations

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Regsvr32 HTTP/FTP Pattern
rules.description: Detects regsvr32 execution to download/install/register new DLLs that are hosted on Web or FTP servers.

rules.name: Windows Defender Definition Files Removed
rules.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by removing Windows Defender Definition Files

rules.name: C# IL Code Compilation Via Ilasm.EXE
rules.description: Detects the use of "Ilasm.EXE" in order to compile C# intermediate (IL) code to EXE or DLL.

rules.name: Start Windows Service Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "net.exe" command to start a service using the "start" flag

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious DLL Registered Via Odbcconf.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "odbcconf" with the "REGSVR" action where the DLL in question doesn't contain a ".dll" extension. Which is often used as a method to evade defenses.

rules.name: Suspicious Schtasks Execution AppData Folder
rules.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that executes a file from C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local

rules.name: Regsvr32 Execution From Potential Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects execution of regsvr32 where the DLL is located in a potentially suspicious location.

rules.name: LOLBIN Execution From Abnormal Drive
rules.description: Detects LOLBINs executing from an abnormal or uncommon drive such as a mounted ISO.

rules.name: Set Suspicious Files as System Files Using Attrib.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of attrib with the "+s" option to set scripts or executables located in suspicious locations as system files to hide them from users and make them unable to be deleted with simple rights. The rule limits the search to specific extensions and directories to avoid FPs

rules.name: Diskshadow Script Mode - Uncommon Script Extension Execution
rules.description:
Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode to execute an script with a potentially uncommon extension.
Initial baselining of the allowed extension list is required.

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via IMEWDBLD.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "IMEWDBLD.exe" to download arbitrary files

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Domain Via PowerShell.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads from file sharing domains using PowerShell.exe

rules.name: Python Inline Command Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of python using the "-c" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live python code.

rules.name: Hidden Powershell in Link File Pattern
rules.description: Detects events that appear when a user click on a link file with a powershell command in it

rules.name: Diskshadow Script Mode - Execution From Potential Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects execution of "Diskshadow.exe" in script mode using the "/s" flag where the script is located in a potentially suspicious location.

rules.name: Potential NTLM Coercion Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects possible NTLM coercion via certutil using the 'syncwithWU' flag

rules.name: Potential Recon Activity Via Nltest.EXE
rules.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

rules.name: Potential SPN Enumeration Via Setspn.EXE
rules.description: Detects service principal name (SPN) enumeration used for Kerberoasting

rules.name: Computer Discovery And Export Via Get-ADComputer Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADComputer cmdlet to collect computer information and output it to a file

rules.name: HH.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of "hh.exe" to open ".chm" files.

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary File Download Using Office Application
rules.description: Detects potential arbitrary file download using a Microsoft Office application

rules.name: Suspicious New Service Creation
rules.description: Detects creation of a new service via "sc" command or the powershell "new-service" cmdlet with suspicious binary paths

rules.name: Suspicious Service Path Modification
rules.description: Detects service path modification via the "sc" binary to a suspicious command or path

rules.name: Use of FSharp Interpreters
rules.description:
Detects the execution of FSharp Interpreters "FsiAnyCpu.exe" and "FSi.exe"
Both can be used for AWL bypass and to execute F# code via scripts or inline.

rules.name: Firewall Rule Update Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of netsh with the "advfirewall" and the "set" option in order to set new values for properties of a existing rule

rules.name: Script Event Consumer Spawning Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious child process of Script Event Consumer (scrcons.exe).

rules.name: HTML Help HH.EXE Suspicious Child Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)

rules.name: PUA - CsExec Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of the lesser known remote execution tool named CsExec a PsExec alternative

rules.name: Suspicious File Characteristics Due to Missing Fields
rules.description: Detects Executables in the Downloads folder without FileVersion,Description,Product,Company likely created with py2exe

rules.name: Computer Password Change Via Ksetup.EXE
rules.description: Detects password change for the computer's domain account or host principal via "ksetup.exe"

rules.name: Uncommon FileSystem Load Attempt By Format.com
rules.description: Detects the execution of format.com with an uncommon filesystem selection that could indicate a defense evasion activity in which "format.com" is used to load malicious DLL files or other programs.

rules.name: Suspicious Download from Office Domain
rules.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files from Microsoft domains that are used to store attachments in Emails or OneNote documents

rules.name: Esentutl Gather Credentials
rules.description: Conti recommendation to its affiliates to use esentutl to access NTDS dumped file. Trickbot also uses this utilities to get MSEdge info via its module pwgrab.

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Encoded Command Patterns
rules.description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains

rules.name: Audio Capture via SoundRecorder
rules.description: Detect attacker collecting audio via SoundRecorder application.

rules.name: Obfuscated IP Via CLI
rules.description: Detects usage of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal, etc.) via command line

rules.name: Setup16.EXE Execution With Custom .Lst File
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "Setup16.EXE" and old installation utility with a custom ".lst" file.
These ".lst" file can contain references to external program that "Setup16.EXE" will execute.
Attackers and adversaries might leverage this as a living of the land utility.

rules.name: Regedit as Trusted Installer
rules.description: Detects a regedit started with TrustedInstaller privileges or by ProcessHacker.exe

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Manage Engine ServiceDesk
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the "Manage Engine ServiceDesk Plus" Java web service

rules.name: PUA - Suspicious ActiveDirectory Enumeration Via AdFind.EXE
rules.description: Detects active directory enumeration activity using known AdFind CLI flags

rules.name: New Process Created Via Taskmgr.EXE
rules.description: Detects the creation of a process via the Windows task manager. This might be an attempt to bypass UAC

rules.name: Gpscript Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the LOLBIN gpscript, which executes logon or startup scripts configured in Group Policy

rules.name: Replace.exe Usage
rules.description: Detects the use of Replace.exe which can be used to replace file with another file

rules.name: Sdclt Child Processes
rules.description: A General detection for sdclt spawning new processes. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.

rules.name: HackTool - Rubeus Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the hacktool Rubeus via PE information of command line parameters

rules.name: UAC Bypass via ICMLuaUtil
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using ICMLuaUtil Elevated COM interface

rules.name: AWL Bypass with Winrm.vbs and Malicious WsmPty.xsl/WsmTxt.xsl
rules.description: Detects execution of attacker-controlled WsmPty.xsl or WsmTxt.xsl via winrm.vbs and copied cscript.exe (can be renamed)

rules.name: Browser Execution In Headless Mode
rules.description: Detects execution of Chromium based browser in headless mode

rules.name: Suspicious Chromium Browser Instance Executed With Custom Extension
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning a Chromium based browser process with the 'load-extension' flag to start an instance with a custom extension

rules.name: Suspicious Debugger Registration Cmdline
rules.description: Detects the registration of a debugger for a program that is available in the logon screen (sticky key backdoor).

rules.name: Suspicious Redirection to Local Admin Share
rules.description: Detects a suspicious output redirection to the local admins share, this technique is often found in malicious scripts or hacktool stagers

rules.name: New Firewall Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows firewall via netsh

rules.name: Potential Data Exfiltration Activity Via CommandLine Tools
rules.description: Detects the use of various CLI utilities exfiltrating data via web requests

rules.name: Suspicious Execution of InstallUtil Without Log
rules.description: Uses the .NET InstallUtil.exe application in order to execute image without log

rules.name: Browser Started with Remote Debugging
rules.description: Detects browsers starting with the remote debugging flags. Which is a technique often used to perform browser injection attacks

rules.name: Weak or Abused Passwords In CLI
rules.description:
Detects weak passwords or often abused passwords (seen used by threat actors) via the CLI.
An example would be a threat actor creating a new user via the net command and providing the password inline

rules.name: Potential Persistence Attempt Via Run Keys Using Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious command line reg.exe tool adding key to RUN key in Registry

rules.name: Detection of PowerShell Execution via Sqlps.exe
rules.description:
This rule detects execution of a PowerShell code through the sqlps.exe utility, which is included in the standard set of utilities supplied with the MSSQL Server.
Script blocks are not logged in this case, so this utility helps to bypass protection mechanisms based on the analysis of these logs.

rules.name: Potential File Overwrite Via Sysinternals SDelete
rules.description: Detects the use of SDelete to erase a file not the free space

rules.name: Renamed BrowserCore.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects process creation with a renamed BrowserCore.exe (used to extract Azure tokens)

rules.name: System Disk And Volume Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description:
An adversary might use WMI to discover information about the system, such as the volume name, size,
free space, and other disk information. This can be done using the `wmic` command-line utility and has been
observed being used by threat actors such as Volt Typhoon.

rules.name: Privilege Escalation via Named Pipe Impersonation
rules.description: Detects a remote file copy attempt to a hidden network share. This may indicate lateral movement or data staging activity.

rules.name: Visual Studio NodejsTools PressAnyKey Renamed Execution
rules.description: Detects renamed execution of "Microsoft.NodejsTools.PressAnyKey.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute arbitrary binaries

rules.name: DLL Loaded via CertOC.EXE
rules.description: Detects when a user installs certificates by using CertOC.exe to loads the target DLL file.

rules.name: Sysprep on AppData Folder
rules.description: Detects suspicious sysprep process start with AppData folder as target (as used by Trojan Syndicasec in Thrip report by Symantec)

rules.name: HackTool - Quarks PwDump Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of the Quarks PwDump tool via commandline arguments

rules.name: Direct Autorun Keys Modification
rules.description: Detects direct modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry using reg.exe.

rules.name: Potential COM Objects Download Cradles Usage - Process Creation
rules.description: Detects usage of COM objects that can be abused to download files in PowerShell by CLSID

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via WCHAR
rules.description: Detects suspicious encoded character syntax often used for defense evasion

rules.name: Suspicious Extrac32 Execution
rules.description: Download or Copy file with Extrac32

rules.name: Suspicious File Execution From Internet Hosted WebDav Share
rules.description: Detects the execution of the "net use" command to mount a WebDAV server and then immediately execute some content in it. As seen being used in malicious LNK files

rules.name: Dumping of Sensitive Hives Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" in order to dump sensitive registry hives. This includes SAM, SYSTEM and SECURITY hives.

rules.name: Potential CommandLine Obfuscation Using Unicode Characters From Suspicious Image
rules.description:
Detects potential commandline obfuscation using unicode characters.
Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit.

rules.name: Renamed Cloudflared.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "cloudflared" binary.

rules.name: Terminal Service Process Spawn
rules.description: Detects a process spawned by the terminal service server process (this could be an indicator for an exploitation of CVE-2019-0708)

rules.name: Add Potential Suspicious New Download Source To Winget
rules.description: Detects usage of winget to add new potentially suspicious download sources

rules.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution
rules.description: Detects Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel

rules.name: Enumerate All Information With Whoami.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "whoami.exe" with the "/all" flag

rules.name: TrustedPath UAC Bypass Pattern
rules.description: Detects indicators of a UAC bypass method by mocking directories

rules.name: Service Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description:
An adversary might use WMI to check if a certain remote service is running on a remote device.
When the test completes, a service information will be displayed on the screen if it exists.
A common feedback message is that "No instance(s) Available" if the service queried is not running.
A common error message is "Node - (provided IP or default) ERROR Description =The RPC server is unavailable" if the provided remote host is unreachable

rules.name: Uninstall Crowdstrike Falcon Sensor
rules.description: Adversaries may disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their tools and activities by uninstalling Crowdstrike Falcon

rules.name: Cloudflared Quick Tunnel Execution
rules.description:
Detects creation of an ad-hoc Cloudflare Quick Tunnel, which can be used to tunnel local services such as HTTP, RDP, SSH and SMB.
The free TryCloudflare Quick Tunnel will generate a random subdomain on trycloudflare[.]com, following a call to api[.]trycloudflare[.]com.
The tool has been observed in use by threat groups including Akira ransomware.

rules.name: Renamed Office Binary Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed office binary

rules.name: Windows Backup Deleted Via Wbadmin.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the deletion of backups or system state backups via "wbadmin.exe".
This technique is used by numerous ransomware families and actors.
This may only be successful on server platforms that have Windows Backup enabled.

rules.name: Reg Add Suspicious Paths
rules.description: Detects when an adversary uses the reg.exe utility to add or modify new keys or subkeys

rules.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Name As GUID
rules.description: Detects creation of a scheduled task with a GUID like name

rules.name: Microsoft IIS Connection Strings Decryption
rules.description: Detects use of aspnet_regiis to decrypt Microsoft IIS connection strings. An attacker with Microsoft IIS web server access via a webshell or alike can decrypt and dump any hardcoded connection strings, such as the MSSQL service account password using aspnet_regiis command.

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocations - Specific - ProcessCreation
rules.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation command parameters

rules.name: HackTool - CreateMiniDump Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of CreateMiniDump hack tool used to dump the LSASS process memory for credential extraction on the attacker's machine

rules.name: Time Travel Debugging Utility Usage
rules.description: Detects usage of Time Travel Debugging Utility. Adversaries can execute malicious processes and dump processes, such as lsass.exe, via tttracer.exe.

rules.name: Imports Registry Key From a File
rules.description: Detects the import of the specified file to the registry with regedit.exe.

rules.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Invoking Inline VBScript
rules.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that invokes inline VBScript as seen being used by UNC2452

rules.name: Suspicious Spool Service Child Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious print spool service (spoolsv.exe) child processes.

rules.name: Deletion of Volume Shadow Copies via WMI with PowerShell
rules.description: Detects deletion of Windows Volume Shadow Copies with PowerShell code and Get-WMIObject. This technique is used by numerous ransomware families such as Sodinokibi/REvil

rules.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Type With High Privileges
rules.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification to be run with high privileges on a suspicious schedule type

rules.name: Disable Windows IIS HTTP Logging
rules.description: Disables HTTP logging on a Windows IIS web server as seen by Threat Group 3390 (Bronze Union)

rules.name: Fsutil Drive Enumeration
rules.description: Attackers may leverage fsutil to enumerated connected drives.

rules.name: Visual Studio Code Tunnel Shell Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a shell (powershell, bash, wsl...) via Visual Studio Code tunnel. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel and execute arbitrary commands on the system.

rules.name: User Discovery And Export Via Get-ADUser Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects usage of the Get-ADUser cmdlet to collect user information and output it to a file

rules.name: Service Started/Stopped Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of wmic to start or stop a service

rules.name: Suspicious Download From Direct IP Via Bitsadmin
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file using an URL that contains an IP

rules.name: Permission Check Via Accesschk.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "Accesschk" utility, an access and privilege audit tool developed by SysInternal and often being abused by attacker to verify process privileges

rules.name: Suspicious Calculator Usage
rules.description: Detects suspicious use of 'calc.exe' with command line parameters or in a suspicious directory, which is likely caused by some PoC or detection evasion.

rules.name: Potential Rundll32 Execution With DLL Stored In ADS
rules.description: Detects execution of rundll32 where the DLL being called is stored in an Alternate Data Stream (ADS).

rules.name: Directory Removal Via Rmdir
rules.description:
Detects execution of the builtin "rmdir" command in order to delete directories.
Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity.
Malware, tools, or other non-native files dropped or created on a system by an adversary may leave traces to indicate to what was done within a network and how.
Removal of these files can occur during an intrusion, or as part of a post-intrusion process to minimize the adversary's footprint.

rules.name: Renamed Plink Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the Plink binary

rules.name: File Download Via Bitsadmin
rules.description: Detects usage of bitsadmin downloading a file

rules.name: Potential WinAPI Calls Via CommandLine
rules.description: Detects the use of WinAPI Functions via the commandline. As seen used by threat actors via the tool winapiexec

rules.name: Windows Recall Feature Enabled Via Reg.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the enabling of the Windows Recall feature via registry manipulation.
Windows Recall can be enabled by deleting the existing "DisableAIDataAnalysis" value, or setting it to 0.
Adversaries may enable Windows Recall as part of post-exploitation discovery and collection activities.
This rule assumes that Recall is already explicitly disabled on the host, and subsequently enabled by the adversary.

rules.name: Use of UltraVNC Remote Access Software
rules.description: An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software,to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious WebDAV LNK Execution
rules.description: Detects possible execution via LNK file accessed on a WebDAV server.

rules.name: Renamed FTP.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "ftp.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields

rules.name: Suspicious Process Masquerading As SvcHost.EXE
rules.description:
Detects a suspicious process that is masquerading as the legitimate "svchost.exe" by naming its binary "svchost.exe" and executing from an uncommon location.
Adversaries often disguise their malicious binaries by naming them after legitimate system processes like "svchost.exe" to evade detection.

rules.name: Phishing Pattern ISO in Archive
rules.description: Detects cases in which an ISO files is opend within an archiver like 7Zip or Winrar, which is a sign of phishing as threat actors put small ISO files in archives as email attachments to bypass certain filters and protective measures (mark of web)

rules.name: Screen Capture Activity Via Psr.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of Windows Problem Steps Recorder (psr.exe), a utility used to record the user screen and clicks.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of ClickOnce Application
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of a ClickOnce deployment application

rules.name: Install New Package Via Winget Local Manifest
rules.description:
Detects usage of winget to install applications via manifest file. Adversaries can abuse winget to download payloads remotely and execute them.
The manifest option enables you to install an application by passing in a YAML file directly to the client.
Winget can be used to download and install exe, msi or msix files later.

rules.name: Dynamic .NET Compilation Via Csc.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "csc.exe" to compile .NET code. Attackers often leverage this to compile code on the fly and use it in other stages.

rules.name: Cloudflared Portable Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the "cloudflared" binary from a non standard location.

rules.name: Suspicious Outlook Child Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an Outlook process.

rules.name: Suspicious Certreq Command to Download
rules.description: Detects a suspicious certreq execution taken from the LOLBAS examples, which can be abused to download (small) files

rules.name: Suspicious WebDav Client Execution Via Rundll32.EXE
rules.description: Detects "svchost.exe" spawning "rundll32.exe" with command arguments like C:\windows\system32\davclnt.dll,DavSetCookie. This could be an indicator of exfiltration or use of WebDav to launch code (hosted on WebDav Server) or potentially a sign of exploitation of CVE-2023-23397

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER
rules.description: Detects potential credential dumping via Windows Error Reporting LSASS Shtinkering technique which uses the Windows Error Reporting to dump lsass

rules.name: Renamed AdFind Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of a renamed Adfind.exe. AdFind continues to be seen across majority of breaches. It is used to domain trust discovery to plan out subsequent steps in the attack chain.

rules.name: Automated Collection Command Prompt
rules.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

rules.name: Certificate Exported Via PowerShell
rules.description: Detects calls to cmdlets that are used to export certificates from the local certificate store. Threat actors were seen abusing this to steal private keys from compromised machines.

rules.name: Renamed Visual Studio Code Tunnel Execution
rules.description: Detects renamed Visual Studio Code tunnel execution. Attackers can abuse this functionality to establish a C2 channel

rules.name: File Encryption Using Gpg4win
rules.description: Detects usage of Gpg4win to encrypt files

rules.name: Detected Windows Software Discovery
rules.description: Adversaries may attempt to enumerate software for a variety of reasons, such as figuring out what security measures are present or if the compromised system has a version of software that is vulnerable.

rules.name: Insecure Proxy/DOH Transfer Via Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "insecure" flag over proxy or DOH.

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Activity Using SeCEdit
rules.description: Detects potential suspicious behaviour using secedit.exe. Such as exporting or modifying the security policy

rules.name: Service Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on services registry key. Often used by attacker to remove AV software services

rules.name: PUA - Wsudo Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of wsudo (Windows Sudo Utility). Which is a tool that let the user execute programs with different permissions (System, Trusted Installer, Administrator...etc)

rules.name: Potential Dropper Script Execution Via WScript/CScript
rules.description: Detects wscript/cscript executions of scripts located in user directories

rules.name: Suspicious Schtasks Schedule Types
rules.description: Detects scheduled task creations or modification on a suspicious schedule type

rules.name: HackTool - LocalPotato Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of the LocalPotato POC based on basic PE metadata information and default CLI examples

rules.name: Potential Homoglyph Attack Using Lookalike Characters
rules.description:
Detects the presence of unicode characters which are homoglyphs, or identical in appearance, to ASCII letter characters.
This is used as an obfuscation and masquerading techniques. Only "perfect" homoglyphs are included; these are characters that
are indistinguishable from ASCII characters and thus may make excellent candidates for homoglyph attack characters.

rules.name: Program Executed Using Proxy/Local Command Via SSH.EXE
rules.description: Detect usage of the "ssh.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs.

rules.name: Wlrmdr.EXE Uncommon Argument Or Child Process
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "Wlrmdr.exe" with the "-u" command line flag which allows anything passed to it to be an argument of the ShellExecute API, which would allow an attacker to execute arbitrary binaries.
This detection also focuses on any uncommon child processes spawned from "Wlrmdr.exe" as a supplement for those that posses "ParentImage" telemetry.

rules.name: Domain Trust Discovery Via Dsquery
rules.description: Detects execution of "dsquery.exe" for domain trust discovery

rules.name: Suspicious Modification Of Scheduled Tasks
rules.description:
Detects when an attacker tries to modify an already existing scheduled tasks to run from a suspicious location
Attackers can create a simple looking task in order to avoid detection on creation as it's often the most focused on
Instead they modify the task after creation to include their malicious payload

rules.name: User Added To Highly Privileged Group
rules.description: Detects addition of users to highly privileged groups via "Net" or "Add-LocalGroupMember".

rules.name: PUA - Nimgrab Execution
rules.description: Detects the usage of nimgrab, a tool bundled with the Nim programming framework and used for downloading files.

rules.name: Psexec Execution
rules.description: Detects user accept agreement execution in psexec commandline

rules.name: NtdllPipe Like Activity Execution
rules.description: Detects command that type the content of ntdll.dll to a different file or a pipe in order to evade AV / EDR detection. As seen being used in the POC NtdllPipe

rules.name: Notepad Password Files Discovery
rules.description: Detects the execution of Notepad to open a file that has the string "password" which may indicate unauthorized access to credentials or suspicious activity.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

rules.name: Malicious PE Execution by Microsoft Visual Studio Debugger
rules.description:
There is an option for a MS VS Just-In-Time Debugger "vsjitdebugger.exe" to launch specified executable and attach a debugger.
This option may be used adversaries to execute malicious code by signed verified binary.
The debugger is installed alongside with Microsoft Visual Studio package.

rules.name: Suspicious Shells Spawn by Java Utility Keytool
rules.description: Detects suspicious shell spawn from Java utility keytool process (e.g. adselfservice plus exploitation)

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Child Process Of WinRAR.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of WinRAR.exe.

rules.name: Wscript Shell Run In CommandLine
rules.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "Wscript", "Shell" and "Run" in the command, which could indicate a suspicious activity

rules.name: Potential AMSI Bypass Via .NET Reflection
rules.description: Detects Request to "amsiInitFailed" that can be used to disable AMSI Scanning

rules.name: Rundll32 Execution Without CommandLine Parameters
rules.description: Detects suspicious start of rundll32.exe without any parameters as found in CobaltStrike beacon activity

rules.name: HackTool - Hydra Password Bruteforce Execution
rules.description: Detects command line parameters used by Hydra password guessing hack tool

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Invocation From Script Engines
rules.description: Detects suspicious powershell invocations from interpreters or unusual programs

rules.name: Potential CommandLine Path Traversal Via Cmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects potential path traversal attempt via cmd.exe. Could indicate possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

rules.name: HackTool - EDRSilencer Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of EDRSilencer, a tool that leverages Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) to block Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents from reporting security events to the server based on PE metadata information.

rules.name: Suspicious Desktopimgdownldr Command
rules.description: Detects a suspicious Microsoft desktopimgdownldr execution with parameters used to download files from the Internet

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution From Parent Process In Public Folder
rules.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution of a parent process located in the "\Users\Public" folder executing a child process containing references to shell or scripting binaries and commandlines.

rules.name: Suspicious Msiexec Execute Arbitrary DLL
rules.description:
Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy execution of malicious payloads.
Msiexec.exe is the command-line utility for the Windows Installer and is thus commonly associated with executing installation packages (.msi)

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using NTFS Reparse Point - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using NTFS reparse point and wusa.exe DLL hijacking (UACMe 36)

rules.name: VMToolsd Suspicious Child Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious child process creations of VMware Tools process which may indicate persistence setup

rules.name: Service StartupType Change Via PowerShell Set-Service
rules.description: Detects the use of the PowerShell "Set-Service" cmdlet to change the startup type of a service to "disabled" or "manual"

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Logon Scripts - CommandLine
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new LogonScript to the registry value "UserInitMprLogonScript" for potential persistence

rules.name: Renamed NirCmd.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "NirCmd.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields.

rules.name: Potential Mpclient.DLL Sideloading Via Defender Binaries
rules.description: Detects potential sideloading of "mpclient.dll" by Windows Defender processes ("MpCmdRun" and "NisSrv") from their non-default directory.

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Policy Tampering - ProcCreation
rules.description: Detects changes to the PowerShell execution policy registry key in order to bypass signing requirements for script execution from the CommandLine

rules.name: Potential Amazon SSM Agent Hijacking
rules.description: Detects potential Amazon SSM agent hijack attempts as outlined in the Mitiga research report.

rules.name: Local File Read Using Curl.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "curl.exe" with the "file://" protocol handler in order to read local files.

rules.name: HackTool - SharpChisel Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of the Sharp Chisel via the commandline arguments

rules.name: Potential Network Sniffing Activity Using Network Tools
rules.description:
Detects potential network sniffing via use of network tools such as "tshark", "windump".
Network sniffing refers to using the network interface on a system to monitor or capture information sent over a wired or wireless connection.
An adversary may place a network interface into promiscuous mode to passively access data in transit over the network, or use span ports to capture a larger amount of data.

rules.name: Potential Powershell ReverseShell Connection
rules.description: Detects usage of the "TcpClient" class. Which can be abused to establish remote connections and reverse-shells. As seen used by the Nishang "Invoke-PowerShellTcpOneLine" reverse shell and other.

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Windows Feature Enabled - ProcCreation
rules.description:
Detects usage of the built-in PowerShell cmdlet "Enable-WindowsOptionalFeature" used as a Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool.
Similar to DISM.exe, this cmdlet is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

rules.name: Suspicious Curl.EXE Download
rules.description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file

rules.name: Recon Command Output Piped To Findstr.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of a potential recon command where the results are piped to "findstr". This is meant to trigger on inline calls of "cmd.exe" via the "/c" or "/k" for example.
Attackers often time use this technique to extract specific information they require in their reconnaissance phase.

rules.name: PowerShell Script Run in AppData
rules.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that invokes PowerShell with reference to an AppData folder

rules.name: Process Launched Without Image Name
rules.description: Detect the use of processes with no name (".exe"), which can be used to evade Image-based detections.

rules.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Process Patterns
rules.description: Detects suspicious process patterns found in logs when CrackMapExec is used

rules.name: Password Provided In Command Line Of Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects a when net.exe is called with a password in the command line

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Trace ETW Session Tamper Via Logman.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "logman" utility in order to disable or delete Windows trace sessions

rules.name: Renamed Mavinject.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed version of the "Mavinject" process. Which can be abused to perform process injection using the "/INJECTRUNNING" flag

rules.name: Suspicious File Downloaded From File-Sharing Website Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with certain flags that allow the utility to download files from file-sharing websites.

rules.name: Suspicious Binary In User Directory Spawned From Office Application
rules.description: Detects an executable in the users directory started from one of the Microsoft Office suite applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher, Visio)

rules.name: HackTool - PPID Spoofing SelectMyParent Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of parent process ID spoofing tools like Didier Stevens tool SelectMyParent

rules.name: HackTool - SharpImpersonation Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the SharpImpersonation tool. Which can be used to manipulate tokens on a Windows computers remotely (PsExec/WmiExec) or interactively

rules.name: Data Export From MSSQL Table Via BCP.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the BCP utility in order to export data from the database.
Attackers were seen saving their malware to a database column or table and then later extracting it via "bcp.exe" into a file.

rules.name: Esentutl Steals Browser Information
rules.description: One way Qbot steals sensitive information is by extracting browser data from Internet Explorer and Microsoft Edge by using the built-in utility esentutl.exe

rules.name: PUA - Fast Reverse Proxy (FRP) Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Fast Reverse Proxy. frp is a fast reverse proxy to help you expose a local server behind a NAT or firewall to the Internet.

rules.name: AgentExecutor PowerShell Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of the AgentExecutor.exe binary. Which can be abused as a LOLBIN to execute powershell scripts with the ExecutionPolicy "Bypass" or any binary named "powershell.exe" located in the path provided by 6th positional argument

rules.name: Deny Service Access Using Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious DACL modifications to deny access to a service that affects critical trustees. This can be used to hide services or make them unstoppable.

rules.name: Suspicious HH.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects a suspicious execution of a Microsoft HTML Help (HH.exe)

rules.name: RDP Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of netsh to configure a port forwarding of port 3389 (RDP) rule

rules.name: MpiExec Lolbin
rules.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by mpiexec.exe LOLBIN from HPC pack that can be used to execute any other binary

rules.name: Suspicious Usage Of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
rules.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe to perform different actions such as restoring snapshots...etc.

rules.name: HackTool - SOAPHound Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of SOAPHound, a .NET tool for collecting Active Directory data, using specific command-line arguments that may indicate an attempt to extract sensitive AD information.

rules.name: Findstr GPP Passwords
rules.description: Look for the encrypted cpassword value within Group Policy Preference files on the Domain Controller. This value can be decrypted with gpp-decrypt.

rules.name: Potential Execution of Sysinternals Tools
rules.description: Detects command lines that contain the 'accepteula' flag which could be a sign of execution of one of the Sysinternals tools

rules.name: Suspicious Process Start Locations
rules.description: Detects suspicious process run from unusual locations

rules.name: Suspicious Obfuscated PowerShell Code
rules.description: Detects suspicious UTF16 and base64 encoded and often obfuscated PowerShell code often used in command lines

rules.name: Data Copied To Clipboard Via Clip.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of clip.exe in order to copy data to the clipboard. Adversaries may collect data stored in the clipboard from users copying information within or between applications.

rules.name: Suspicious IIS URL GlobalRules Rewrite Via AppCmd
rules.description: Detects usage of "appcmd" to create new global URL rewrite rules. This behaviour has been observed being used by threat actors to add new rules so they can access their webshells.

rules.name: MMC Spawning Windows Shell
rules.description: Detects a Windows command line executable started from MMC

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSOHTMED.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "MSOHTMED" to download arbitrary files

rules.name: Compressed File Creation Via Tar.EXE
rules.description:
Detects execution of "tar.exe" in order to create a compressed file.
Adversaries may abuse various utilities to compress or encrypt data before exfiltration.

rules.name: DNS Exfiltration and Tunneling Tools Execution
rules.description: Well-known DNS Exfiltration tools execution

rules.name: Conhost.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
rules.description: detects the usage of path traversal in conhost.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

rules.name: Potential Ransomware or Unauthorized MBR Tampering Via Bcdedit.EXE
rules.description: Detects potential malicious and unauthorized usage of bcdedit.exe

rules.name: HackTool - Mimikatz Execution
rules.description: Detection well-known mimikatz command line arguments

rules.name: Launch-VsDevShell.PS1 Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of the 'Launch-VsDevShell.ps1' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.

rules.name: Potential Remote Desktop Tunneling
rules.description: Detects potential use of an SSH utility to establish RDP over a reverse SSH Tunnel. This can be used by attackers to enable routing of network packets that would otherwise not reach their intended destination.

rules.name: Uncommon One Time Only Scheduled Task At 00:00
rules.description: Detects scheduled task creation events that include suspicious actions, and is run once at 00:00

rules.name: Schtasks Creation Or Modification With SYSTEM Privileges
rules.description: Detects the creation or update of a scheduled task to run with "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" privileges

rules.name: Suspicious Driver Install by pnputil.exe
rules.description: Detects when a possible suspicious driver is being installed via pnputil.exe lolbin

rules.name: REGISTER_APP.VBS Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script 'REGISTER_APP.VBS' to register a VSS/VDS Provider as a COM+ application.

rules.name: Ie4uinit Lolbin Use From Invalid Path
rules.description: Detect use of ie4uinit.exe to execute commands from a specially prepared ie4uinit.inf file from a directory other than the usual directories

rules.name: AddinUtil.EXE Execution From Uncommon Directory
rules.description: Detects execution of the Add-In deployment cache updating utility (AddInutil.exe) from a non-standard directory.

rules.name: Potential Reconnaissance For Cached Credentials Via Cmdkey.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of cmdkey to look for cached credentials on the system

rules.name: HackTool - Dumpert Process Dumper Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Dumpert process dumper, which dumps the lsass.exe process memory

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using IDiagnostic Profile
rules.description: Detects the "IDiagnosticProfileUAC" UAC bypass technique

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Downgrade Attack
rules.description: Detects PowerShell downgrade attack by comparing the host versions with the actually used engine version 2.0

rules.name: File Download via CertOC.EXE
rules.description: Detects when a user downloads a file by using CertOC.exe

rules.name: Netsh Allow Group Policy on Microsoft Defender Firewall
rules.description: Adversaries may modify system firewalls in order to bypass controls limiting network usage

rules.name: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets
rules.description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via CommandLine

rules.name: Potential Defense Evasion Via Rename Of Highly Relevant Binaries
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed binary often used by attackers or malware leveraging new Sysmon OriginalFileName datapoint.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - Simple Help Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Potential Tampering With RDP Related Registry Keys Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "reg.exe" for enabling/disabling the RDP service on the host by tampering with the 'CurrentControlSet\Control\Terminal Server' values

rules.name: Scheduled Task Executing Encoded Payload from Registry
rules.description: Detects the creation of a schtask that potentially executes a base64 encoded payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.

rules.name: Service Security Descriptor Tampering Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detection of sc.exe utility adding a new service with special permission which hides that service.

rules.name: Detect Virtualbox Driver Installation OR Starting Of VMs
rules.description: Adversaries can carry out malicious operations using a virtual instance to avoid detection. This rule is built to detect the registration of the Virtualbox driver or start of a Virtualbox VM.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Command Targeting Teams Sensitive Files
rules.description:
Detects a commandline containing references to the Microsoft Teams database or cookies files from a process other than Teams.
The database might contain authentication tokens and other sensitive information about the logged in accounts.

rules.name: Process Memory Dump Via Comsvcs.DLL
rules.description: Detects a process memory dump via "comsvcs.dll" using rundll32, covering multiple different techniques (ordinal, minidump function, etc.)

rules.name: HackTool - Htran/NATBypass Execution
rules.description: Detects executable names or flags used by Htran or Htran-like tools (e.g. NATBypass)

rules.name: HackTool - UACMe Akagi Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of UACMe, a tool used for UAC bypasses, via default PE metadata

rules.name: Firewall Rule Deleted Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects the removal of a port or application rule in the Windows Firewall configuration using netsh

rules.name: PowerShell SAM Copy
rules.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell scripts accessing SAM hives

rules.name: Bad Opsec Defaults Sacrificial Processes With Improper Arguments
rules.description:
Detects attackers using tooling with bad opsec defaults.
E.g. spawning a sacrificial process to inject a capability into the process without taking into account how the process is normally run.
One trivial example of this is using rundll32.exe without arguments as a sacrificial process (default in CS, now highlighted by c2lint), running WerFault without arguments (Kraken - credit am0nsec), and other examples.

rules.name: Suspicious NTLM Authentication on the Printer Spooler Service
rules.description: Detects a privilege elevation attempt by coercing NTLM authentication on the Printer Spooler service

rules.name: Suspicious RunAs-Like Flag Combination
rules.description: Detects suspicious command line flags that let the user set a target user and command as e.g. seen in PsExec-like tools

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser
rules.description:
Detects manual execution of the "Microsoft Compatibility Appraiser" task via schtasks.
In order to trigger persistence stored in the "\AppCompatFlags\TelemetryController" registry key.

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Defender Registry Key Tampering Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of "reg.exe" to tamper with different Windows Defender registry keys in order to disable some important features related to protection and detection

rules.name: Always Install Elevated MSI Spawned Cmd And Powershell
rules.description: Detects Windows Installer service (msiexec.exe) spawning "cmd" or "powershell"

rules.name: File Explorer Folder Opened Using Explorer Folder Shortcut Via Shell
rules.description: Detects the initial execution of "cmd.exe" which spawns "explorer.exe" with the appropriate command line arguments for opening the "My Computer" folder.

rules.name: Suspicious Process Execution From Fake Recycle.Bin Folder
rules.description: Detects process execution from a fake recycle bin folder, often used to avoid security solution.

rules.name: RunDLL32 Spawning Explorer
rules.description: Detects RunDLL32.exe spawning explorer.exe as child, which is very uncommon, often observes Gamarue spawning the explorer.exe process in an unusual way

rules.name: Writing Of Malicious Files To The Fonts Folder
rules.description: Monitors for the hiding possible malicious files in the C:\Windows\Fonts\ location. This folder doesn't require admin privillege to be written and executed from.

rules.name: Process Access via TrolleyExpress Exclusion
rules.description: Detects a possible process memory dump that uses the white-listed Citrix TrolleyExpress.exe filename as a way to dump the lsass process memory

rules.name: Suspicious Mstsc.EXE Execution With Local RDP File
rules.description: Detects potential RDP connection via Mstsc using a local ".rdp" file located in suspicious locations.

rules.name: Use of Remote.exe
rules.description: Remote.exe is part of WinDbg in the Windows SDK and can be used for AWL bypass and running remote files.

rules.name: PsExec Service Execution
rules.description: Detects launch of the PSEXESVC service, which means that this system was the target of a psexec remote execution

rules.name: New Network Trace Capture Started Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of netsh with the "trace" flag in order to start a network capture

rules.name: Suspicious Reg Add Open Command
rules.description: Threat actors performed dumping of SAM, SECURITY and SYSTEM registry hives using DelegateExecute key

rules.name: PsExec/PAExec Escalation to LOCAL SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects suspicious commandline flags used by PsExec and PAExec to escalate a command line to LOCAL_SYSTEM rights

rules.name: Net WebClient Casing Anomalies
rules.description: Detects PowerShell command line contents that include a suspicious abnormal casing in the Net.Webclient (e.g. nEt.WEbCliEnT) string as used in obfuscation techniques

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Command Line Obfuscation
rules.description: Detects the PowerShell command lines with special characters

rules.name: Uncommon Userinit Child Process
rules.description: Detects uncommon "userinit.exe" child processes, which could be a sign of uncommon shells or login scripts used for persistence.

rules.name: Security Privileges Enumeration Via Whoami.EXE
rules.description: Detects a whoami.exe executed with the /priv command line flag instructing the tool to show all current user privileges. This is often used after a privilege escalation attempt.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious CMD Shell Output Redirect
rules.description:
Detects inline Windows shell commands redirecting output via the ">" symbol to a suspicious location.
This technique is sometimes used by malicious actors in order to redirect the output of reconnaissance commands such as "hostname" and "dir" to files for future exfiltration.

rules.name: Sysinternals PsSuspend Execution
rules.description: Detects usage of Sysinternals PsSuspend which can be abused to suspend critical processes

rules.name: Hardware Model Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of WMIC with the "csproduct" which is used to obtain information such as hardware models and vendor information

rules.name: Potential Fake Instance Of Hxtsr.EXE Executed
rules.description:
HxTsr.exe is a Microsoft compressed executable file called Microsoft Outlook Communications.
HxTsr.exe is part of Outlook apps, because it resides in a hidden "WindowsApps" subfolder of "C:\Program Files".
Any instances of hxtsr.exe not in this folder may be malware camouflaging itself as HxTsr.exe

rules.name: Fsutil Suspicious Invocation
rules.description:
Detects suspicious parameters of fsutil (deleting USN journal, configuring it with small size, etc).
Might be used by ransomwares during the attack (seen by NotPetya and others).

rules.name: Active Directory Structure Export Via Ldifde.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "ldifde.exe" in order to export organizational Active Directory structure.

rules.name: PUA - Adidnsdump Execution
rules.description:
This tool enables enumeration and exporting of all DNS records in the zone for recon purposes of internal networks Python 3 and python.exe must be installed,
Usee to Query/modify DNS records for Active Directory integrated DNS via LDAP

rules.name: Suspicious Process Created Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects WMIC executing "process call create" with suspicious calls to processes such as "rundll32", "regsrv32", etc.

rules.name: Renamed PAExec Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of renamed version of PAExec. Often used by attackers

rules.name: Winrar Compressing Dump Files
rules.description: Detects execution of WinRAR in order to compress a file with a ".dmp"/".dump" extension, which could be a step in a process of dump file exfiltration.

rules.name: Potential Windows Defender AV Bypass Via Dump64.EXE Rename
rules.description:
Detects when a user is potentially trying to bypass the Windows Defender AV by renaming a tool to dump64.exe and placing it in the Visual Studio folder.
Currently the rule is covering only usage of procdump but other utilities can be added in order to increase coverage.

rules.name: PUA - NimScan Execution
rules.description:
Detects usage of NimScan, a portscanner utility.
In early 2025, adversaries were observed using this utility to scan for open ports on remote hosts in a compromised environment.
This rule identifies the execution of NimScan based on the process image name and specific hash values associated with different versions of the tool.

rules.name: Windows Credential Manager Access via VaultCmd
rules.description: List credentials currently stored in Windows Credential Manager via the native Windows utility vaultcmd.exe

rules.name: Ruby Inline Command Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of ruby using the "-e" flag. This is could be used as a way to launch a reverse shell or execute live ruby code.

rules.name: Add SafeBoot Keys Via Reg Utility
rules.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "add" or "copy" flags on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to allow the ransomware to work in safe mode as some security products do not

rules.name: LOL-Binary Copied From System Directory
rules.description: Detects a suspicious copy operation that tries to copy a known LOLBIN from system (System32, SysWOW64, WinSxS) directories to another on disk in order to bypass detections based on locations.

rules.name: UAC Bypass WSReset
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass via WSReset usable by default sysmon-config

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32.EXE Execution of UDL File
rules.description:
Detects the execution of rundll32.exe with the oledb32.dll library to open a UDL file.
Threat actors can abuse this technique as a phishing vector to capture authentication credentials or other sensitive data.

rules.name: Suspicious Network Command
