rules.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

rules.name: Potential Signing Bypass Via Windows Developer Features
rules.description: Detects when a user enable developer features such as "Developer Mode" or "Application Sideloading". Which allows the user to install untrusted packages.

rules.name: System Network Connections Discovery Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of network connections to or from the compromised system they are currently accessing or from remote systems by querying for information over the network.

rules.name: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
rules.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

rules.name: Suspicious SYSVOL Domain Group Policy Access
rules.description: Detects Access to Domain Group Policies stored in SYSVOL

rules.name: New DNS ServerLevelPluginDll Installed Via Dnscmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects the installation of a DNS plugin DLL via ServerLevelPluginDll parameter in registry, which can be used to execute code in context of the DNS server (restart required)

rules.name: Sysmon Configuration Update
rules.description: Detects updates to Sysmon's configuration. Attackers might update or replace the Sysmon configuration with a bare bone one to avoid monitoring without shutting down the service completely

rules.name: Suspicious Kernel Dump Using Dtrace
rules.description: Detects suspicious way to dump the kernel on Windows systems using dtrace.exe, which is available on Windows systems since Windows 10 19H1

rules.name: SQLite Chromium Profile Data DB Access
rules.description: Detect usage of the "sqlite" binary to query databases in Chromium-based browsers for potential data stealing.

rules.name: HackTool - WinPwn Execution
rules.description: Detects commandline keywords indicative of potential usge of the tool WinPwn. A tool for Windows and Active Directory reconnaissance and exploitation.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

rules.name: File Download From Browser Process Via Inline URL
rules.description: Detects execution of a browser process with a URL argument pointing to a file with a potentially interesting extension. This can be abused to download arbitrary files or to hide from the user for example by launching the browser in a minimized state.

rules.name: Potential ShellDispatch.DLL Functionality Abuse
rules.description: Detects potential "ShellDispatch.dll" functionality abuse to execute arbitrary binaries via "ShellExecute"

rules.name: Execute Pcwrun.EXE To Leverage Follina
rules.description: Detects indirect command execution via Program Compatibility Assistant "pcwrun.exe" leveraging the follina (CVE-2022-30190) vulnerability

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Usage Of Qemu
rules.description:
Detects potentially suspicious execution of the Qemu utility in a Windows environment.
Threat actors have leveraged this utility and this technique for achieving network access as reported by Kaspersky.

rules.name: Suspicious Persistence Via VMwareToolBoxCmd.EXE VM State Change Script
rules.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script that's located in a potentially suspicious location to run for a specific VM state

rules.name: Stop Windows Service Via Sc.EXE
rules.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "sc.exe" utility

rules.name: PowerShell Base64 Encoded IEX Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects usage of a base64 encoded "IEX" cmdlet in a process command line

rules.name: HackTool - KrbRelay Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of KrbRelay, a Kerberos relaying tool

rules.name: Suspicious Control Panel DLL Load
rules.description: Detects suspicious Rundll32 execution from control.exe as used by Equation Group and Exploit Kits

rules.name: XBAP Execution From Uncommon Locations Via PresentationHost.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of ".xbap" (Browser Applications) files via PresentationHost.EXE from an uncommon location. These files can be abused to run malicious ".xbap" files any bypass AWL

rules.name: PUA - NPS Tunneling Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of NPS, a port forwarding and intranet penetration proxy server

rules.name: Application Terminated Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects calls to the "terminate" function via wmic in order to kill an application

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - UltraViewer Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Compress Data and Lock With Password for Exfiltration With 7-ZIP
rules.description: An adversary may compress or encrypt data that is collected prior to exfiltration using 3rd party utilities

rules.name: HackTool - DInjector PowerShell Cradle Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of the Dinject PowerShell cradle based on the specific flags

rules.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Activity Invoking Sys File
rules.description: Detects suspicious process related to rundll32 based on command line that includes a *.sys file as seen being used by UNC2452

rules.name: Execute Code with Pester.bat as Parent
rules.description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Piped Password Via CLI
rules.description: Detects piping the password to an anydesk instance via CMD and the '--set-password' flag.

rules.name: Dropping Of Password Filter DLL
rules.description: Detects dropping of dll files in system32 that may be used to retrieve user credentials from LSASS

rules.name: PUA - Crassus Execution
rules.description: Detects Crassus, a Windows privilege escalation discovery tool, based on PE metadata characteristics.

rules.name: Rundll32 UNC Path Execution
rules.description: Detects rundll32 execution where the DLL is located on a remote location (share)

rules.name: Modify Group Policy Settings
rules.description: Detect malicious GPO modifications can be used to implement many other malicious behaviors.

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of "ConfigSecurityPolicy.EXE", a binary part of Windows Defender used to manage settings in Windows Defender.
Users can configure different pilot collections for each of the co-management workloads.
It can be abused by attackers in order to upload or download files.

rules.name: Copy .DMP/.DUMP Files From Remote Share Via Cmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of the copy builtin cmd command to copy files with the ".dmp"/".dump" extension from a remote share

rules.name: HackTool - Bloodhound/Sharphound Execution
rules.description: Detects command line parameters used by Bloodhound and Sharphound hack tools

rules.name: Scheduled Task Executing Payload from Registry
rules.description: Detects the creation of a schtasks that potentially executes a payload stored in the Windows Registry using PowerShell.

rules.name: Potential Persistence Via VMwareToolBoxCmd.EXE VM State Change Script
rules.description: Detects execution of the "VMwareToolBoxCmd.exe" with the "script" and "set" flag to setup a specific script to run for a specific VM state

rules.name: PowerShell Web Download
rules.description: Detects suspicious ways to download files or content using PowerShell

rules.name: Network Reconnaissance Activity
rules.description: Detects a set of suspicious network related commands often used in recon stages

rules.name: Outlook EnableUnsafeClientMailRules Setting Enabled
rules.description: Detects an attacker trying to enable the outlook security setting "EnableUnsafeClientMailRules" which allows outlook to run applications or execute macros

rules.name: Renamed Gpg.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "gpg.exe". Often used by ransomware and loaders to decrypt/encrypt data.

rules.name: Suspicious MsiExec Embedding Parent
rules.description: Adversaries may abuse msiexec.exe to proxy the execution of malicious payloads

rules.name: HackTool - SharpView Execution
rules.description: Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems

rules.name: Potential Privilege Escalation Using Symlink Between Osk and Cmd
rules.description: Detects the creation of a symbolic link between "cmd.exe" and the accessibility on-screen keyboard binary (osk.exe) using "mklink". This technique provides an elevated command prompt to the user from the login screen without the need to log in.

rules.name: DLL Execution via Rasautou.exe
rules.description: Detects using Rasautou.exe for loading arbitrary .DLL specified in -d option and executes the export specified in -p.

rules.name: HackTool - SharpDPAPI Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of the SharpDPAPI tool based on CommandLine flags and PE metadata.
SharpDPAPI is a C# port of some DPAPI functionality from the Mimikatz project.

rules.name: Process Execution From A Potentially Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects a potentially suspicious execution from an uncommon folder.

rules.name: Suspicious Process Patterns NTDS.DIT Exfil
rules.description: Detects suspicious process patterns used in NTDS.DIT exfiltration

rules.name: AspNetCompiler Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of "aspnet_compiler.exe" which can be abused to compile and execute C# code.

rules.name: PUA - Netcat Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of Netcat. Adversaries may use a non-application layer protocol for communication between host and C2 server or among infected hosts within a network

rules.name: Renamed CreateDump Utility Execution
rules.description: Detects uses of a renamed legitimate createdump.exe LOLOBIN utility to dump process memory

rules.name: Arbitrary MSI Download Via Devinit.EXE
rules.description: Detects a certain command line flag combination used by "devinit.exe", which can be abused as a LOLBIN to download arbitrary MSI packages on a Windows system

rules.name: Renamed ZOHO Dctask64 Execution
rules.description:
Detects a renamed "dctask64.exe" execution, a signed binary by ZOHO Corporation part of ManageEngine Endpoint Central.
This binary can be abused for DLL injection, arbitrary command and process execution.

rules.name: Python Function Execution Security Warning Disabled In Excel
rules.description:
Detects changes to the registry value "PythonFunctionWarnings" that would prevent any warnings or alerts from showing when Python functions are about to be executed.
Threat actors could run malicious code through the new Microsoft Excel feature that allows Python to run within the spreadsheet.

rules.name: Suspicious Service Binary Directory
rules.description: Detects a service binary running in a suspicious directory

rules.name: Security Service Disabled Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" to disable security services such as Windows Defender.

rules.name: Rar Usage with Password and Compression Level
rules.description: Detects the use of rar.exe, on the command line, to create an archive with password protection or with a specific compression level. This is pretty indicative of malicious actions.

rules.name: Suspicious Processes Spawned by WinRM
rules.description: Detects suspicious processes including shells spawnd from WinRM host process

rules.name: Non-privileged Usage of Reg or Powershell
rules.description: Search for usage of reg or Powershell by non-privileged users to modify service configuration in registry

rules.name: Suspicious MSHTA Child Process
rules.description: Detects a suspicious process spawning from an "mshta.exe" process, which could be indicative of a malicious HTA script execution

rules.name: Potential Privilege Escalation To LOCAL SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects unknown program using commandline flags usually used by tools such as PsExec and PAExec to start programs with SYSTEM Privileges

rules.name: Potential DLL Injection Via AccCheckConsole
rules.description:
Detects the execution "AccCheckConsole" a command-line tool for verifying the accessibility implementation of an application's UI.
One of the tests that this checker can run are called "verification routine", which tests for things like Consistency, Navigation, etc.
The tool allows a user to provide a DLL that can contain a custom "verification routine". An attacker can build such DLLs and pass it via the CLI, which would then be loaded in the context of the "AccCheckConsole" utility.

rules.name: Suspicious Regsvr32 Execution From Remote Share
rules.description: Detects REGSVR32.exe to execute DLL hosted on remote shares

rules.name: Regsvr32 DLL Execution With Uncommon Extension
rules.description: Detects a "regsvr32" execution where the DLL doesn't contain a common file extension.

rules.name: Mavinject Inject DLL Into Running Process
rules.description: Detects process injection using the signed Windows tool "Mavinject" via the "INJECTRUNNING" flag

rules.name: File Download Via InstallUtil.EXE
rules.description: Detects use of .NET InstallUtil.exe in order to download arbitrary files. The files will be written to "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE\"

rules.name: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

rules.name: PUA - WebBrowserPassView Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of WebBrowserPassView.exe. A password recovery tool that reveals the passwords stored by the following Web browsers, Internet Explorer (Version 4.0 - 11.0), Mozilla Firefox (All Versions), Google Chrome, Safari, and Opera

rules.name: Copying Sensitive Files with Credential Data
rules.description: Files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) copying

rules.name: Delete All Scheduled Tasks
rules.description: Detects the usage of schtasks with the delete flag and the asterisk symbol to delete all tasks from the schedule of the local computer, including tasks scheduled by other users.

rules.name: Uncommon Child Processes Of SndVol.exe
rules.description: Detects potentially uncommon child processes of SndVol.exe (the Windows volume mixer)

rules.name: HackTool - SharpUp PrivEsc Tool Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of SharpUp, a tool for local privilege escalation

rules.name: MSHTA Suspicious Execution 01
rules.description: Detection for mshta.exe suspicious execution patterns sometimes involving file polyglotism

rules.name: HackTool - SharpEvtMute Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of SharpEvtHook, a tool that tampers with the Windows event logs

rules.name: Potential Recon Activity Using DriverQuery.EXE
rules.description: Detect usage of the "driverquery" utility to perform reconnaissance on installed drivers

rules.name: Lolbin Runexehelper Use As Proxy
rules.description: Detect usage of the "runexehelper.exe" binary as a proxy to launch other programs

rules.name: Monitoring For Persistence Via BITS
rules.description:
BITS will allow you to schedule a command to execute after a successful download to notify you that the job is finished.
When the job runs on the system the command specified in the BITS job will be executed.
This can be abused by actors to create a backdoor within the system and for persistence.
It will be chained in a BITS job to schedule the download of malware/additional binaries and execute the program after being downloaded.

rules.name: Suspicious XOR Encoded PowerShell Command
rules.description: Detects presence of a potentially xor encoded powershell command

rules.name: Suspicious FromBase64String Usage On Gzip Archive - Process Creation
rules.description: Detects attempts of decoding a base64 Gzip archive via PowerShell. This technique is often used as a method to load malicious content into memory afterward.

rules.name: PUA - PingCastle Execution From Potentially Suspicious Parent
rules.description: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level via a script located in a potentially suspicious or uncommon location.

rules.name: System File Execution Location Anomaly
rules.description: Detects the execution of a Windows system binary that is usually located in the system folder from an uncommon location.

rules.name: Suspicious Diantz Download and Compress Into a CAB File
rules.description: Download and compress a remote file and store it in a cab file on local machine.

rules.name: Renamed PsExec Service Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious launch of a renamed version of the PSEXESVC service with, which is not often used by legitimate administrators

rules.name: Arbitrary Binary Execution Using GUP Utility
rules.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater (gup) to launch other commands or executables

rules.name: Potential SysInternals ProcDump Evasion
rules.description: Detects uses of the SysInternals ProcDump utility in which ProcDump or its output get renamed, or a dump file is moved or copied to a different name

rules.name: Tap Installer Execution
rules.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunneling techniques

rules.name: Sticky Key Like Backdoor Execution
rules.description: Detects the usage and installation of a backdoor that uses an option to register a malicious debugger for built-in tools that are accessible in the login screen

rules.name: Run PowerShell Script from ADS
rules.description: Detects PowerShell script execution from Alternate Data Stream (ADS)

rules.name: Suspicious Recursive Takeown
rules.description: Adversaries can interact with the DACLs using built-in Windows commands takeown which can grant adversaries higher permissions on specific files and folders

rules.name: SyncAppvPublishingServer VBS Execute Arbitrary PowerShell Code
rules.description: Executes arbitrary PowerShell code using SyncAppvPublishingServer.vbs

rules.name: Suspicious Splwow64 Without Params
rules.description: Detects suspicious Splwow64.exe process without any command line parameters

rules.name: Forfiles.EXE Child Process Masquerading
rules.description: Detects the execution of "forfiles" from a non-default location, in order to potentially spawn a custom "cmd.exe" from the current working directory.

rules.name: File Recovery From Backup Via Wbadmin.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the recovery of files from backups via "wbadmin.exe".
Attackers can restore sensitive files such as NTDS.DIT or Registry Hives from backups in order to potentially extract credentials.

rules.name: Renamed Whoami Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of whoami that has been renamed to a different name to avoid detection

rules.name: Tor Client/Browser Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Tor or Tor-Browser to connect to onion routing networks

rules.name: Renamed AutoHotkey.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of a renamed autohotkey.exe binary based on PE metadata fields

rules.name: Binary Proxy Execution Via Dotnet-Trace.EXE
rules.description: Detects commandline arguments for executing a child process via dotnet-trace.exe

rules.name: Suspicious Invoke-WebRequest Execution With DirectIP
rules.description: Detects calls to PowerShell with Invoke-WebRequest cmdlet using direct IP access

rules.name: Firewall Disabled via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects netsh commands that turns off the Windows firewall

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using Windows Media Player - Process
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using Windows Media Player osksupport.dll (UACMe 32)

rules.name: Sysmon Driver Unloaded Via Fltmc.EXE
rules.description: Detects possible Sysmon filter driver unloaded via fltmc.exe

rules.name: DirLister Execution
rules.description: Detect the usage of "DirLister.exe" a utility for quickly listing folder or drive contents. It was seen used by BlackCat ransomware to create a list of accessible directories and files.

rules.name: Suspicious Windows Update Agent Empty Cmdline
rules.description: Detects suspicious Windows Update Agent activity in which a wuauclt.exe process command line doesn't contain any command line flags

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Registry File Imported Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the import of '.reg' files from suspicious paths using the 'reg.exe' utility

rules.name: Arbitrary DLL or Csproj Code Execution Via Dotnet.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of arbitrary DLLs or unsigned code via a ".csproj" files via Dotnet.EXE.

rules.name: Renamed SysInternals DebugView Execution
rules.description: Detects suspicious renamed SysInternals DebugView execution

rules.name: New ActiveScriptEventConsumer Created Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects WMIC executions in which an event consumer gets created. This could be used to establish persistence

rules.name: Windows Processes Suspicious Parent Directory
rules.description: Detect suspicious parent processes of well-known Windows processes

rules.name: Suspicious MSDT Parent Process
rules.description: Detects msdt.exe executed by a suspicious parent as seen in CVE-2022-30190 / Follina exploitation

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - LogMeIn Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Suspicious Microsoft OneNote Child Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of the Microsoft OneNote application. This may indicate an attempt to execute malicious embedded objects from a .one file.

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via MSEDGE_PROXY.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "msedge_proxy.exe" to download arbitrary files

rules.name: Suspicious SysAidServer Child
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of SysAidServer (as seen in MERCURY threat actor intrusions)

rules.name: Cscript/Wscript Potentially Suspicious Child Process
rules.description:
Detects potentially suspicious child processes of Wscript/Cscript. These include processes such as rundll32 with uncommon exports or PowerShell spawning rundll32 or regsvr32.
Malware such as Pikabot and Qakbot were seen using similar techniques as well as many others.

rules.name: Potential Commandline Obfuscation Using Escape Characters
rules.description: Detects potential commandline obfuscation using known escape characters

rules.name: File Download And Execution Via IEExec.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of the IEExec utility to download and execute files

rules.name: PUA - PingCastle Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of PingCastle, a tool designed to quickly assess the Active Directory security level.

rules.name: Use Icacls to Hide File to Everyone
rules.description: Detect use of icacls to deny access for everyone in Users folder sometimes used to hide malicious files

rules.name: HackTool - Hashcat Password Cracker Execution
rules.description: Execute Hashcat.exe with provided SAM file from registry of Windows and Password list to crack against

rules.name: HackTool - Jlaive In-Memory Assembly Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of Jlaive to execute assemblies in a copied PowerShell

rules.name: Suspicious WMIC Execution Via Office Process
rules.description: Office application called wmic to proxye execution through a LOLBIN process. This is often used to break suspicious parent-child chain (Office app spawns LOLBin).

rules.name: Microsoft IIS Service Account Password Dumped
rules.description: Detects the Internet Information Services (IIS) command-line tool, AppCmd, being used to list passwords

rules.name: Fsutil Behavior Set SymlinkEvaluation
rules.description:
A symbolic link is a type of file that contains a reference to another file.
This is probably done to make sure that the ransomware is able to follow shortcuts on the machine in order to find the original file to encrypt

rules.name: WMIC Remote Command Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of WMIC to query information on a remote system

rules.name: Invocation of Active Directory Diagnostic Tool (ntdsutil.exe)
rules.description: Detects execution of ntdsutil.exe, which can be used for various attacks against the NTDS database (NTDS.DIT)

rules.name: UAC Bypass Using DismHost
rules.description: Detects the pattern of UAC Bypass using DismHost DLL hijacking (UACMe 63)

rules.name: Proxy Execution Via Wuauclt.EXE
rules.description: Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) for proxy execution.

rules.name: Renamed NetSupport RAT Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "client32.exe" (NetSupport RAT) via Imphash, Product and OriginalFileName strings

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Appvlp.EXE
rules.description:
Detects uncommon child processes of Appvlp.EXE
Appvlp or the Application Virtualization Utility is included with Microsoft Office. Attackers are able to abuse "AppVLP" to execute shell commands.
Normally, this binary is used for Application Virtualization, but it can also be abused to circumvent the ASR file path rule folder
or to mark a file as a system file.

rules.name: New Port Forwarding Rule Added Via Netsh.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of netsh commands that configure a new port forwarding (PortProxy) rule

rules.name: Files Added To An Archive Using Rar.EXE
rules.description: Detects usage of "rar" to add files to an archive for potential compression. An adversary may compress data (e.g. sensitive documents) that is collected prior to exfiltration in order to make it portable and minimize the amount of data sent over the network.

rules.name: PUA - RunXCmd Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of the RunXCmd tool to execute commands with System or TrustedInstaller accounts

rules.name: HackTool - Certipy Execution
rules.description: Detects Certipy execution, a tool for Active Directory Certificate Services enumeration and abuse based on PE metadata characteristics and common command line arguments.

rules.name: Obfuscated IP Download Activity
rules.description: Detects use of an encoded/obfuscated version of an IP address (hex, octal...) in an URL combined with a download command

rules.name: Suspicious VBoxDrvInst.exe Parameters
rules.description:
Detect VBoxDrvInst.exe run with parameters allowing processing INF file.
This allows to create values in the registry and install drivers.
For example one could use this technique to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious GoogleUpdate Child Process
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes of "GoogleUpdate.exe"

rules.name: Python Spawning Pretty TTY on Windows
rules.description: Detects python spawning a pretty tty

rules.name: HackTool - Sliver C2 Implant Activity Pattern
rules.description: Detects process activity patterns as seen being used by Sliver C2 framework implants

rules.name: Suspicious Provlaunch.EXE Child Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.

rules.name: HackTool - Stracciatella Execution
rules.description: Detects Stracciatella which executes a Powershell runspace from within C# (aka SharpPick technique) with AMSI, ETW and Script Block Logging disabled based on PE metadata characteristics.

rules.name: UAC Bypass Tools Using ComputerDefaults
rules.description: Detects tools such as UACMe used to bypass UAC with computerdefaults.exe (UACMe 59)

rules.name: Add New Download Source To Winget
rules.description: Detects usage of winget to add new additional download sources

rules.name: Potential Mftrace.EXE Abuse
rules.description: Detects child processes of the "Trace log generation tool for Media Foundation Tools" (Mftrace.exe) which can abused to execute arbitrary binaries.

rules.name: Suspicious Child Process Of Wermgr.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious Windows Error Reporting manager (wermgr.exe) child process

rules.name: DumpMinitool Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of "DumpMinitool.exe" a tool that allows the dump of process memory via the use of the "MiniDumpWriteDump"

rules.name: Use of VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe
rules.description: VisualUiaVerifyNative.exe is a Windows SDK that can be used for AWL bypass and is listed in Microsoft's recommended block rules.

rules.name: Potential DLL Sideloading Via DeviceEnroller.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the use of the PhoneDeepLink parameter to potentially sideload a DLL file that does not exist. This non-existent DLL file is named "ShellChromeAPI.dll".
Adversaries can drop their own renamed DLL and execute it via DeviceEnroller.exe using this parameter

rules.name: LSA PPL Protection Disabled Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "reg.exe" utility to disable PPL protection on the LSA process

rules.name: Potential Manage-bde.wsf Abuse To Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of the "manage-bde.wsf" script as a LOLBIN to proxy execution

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Defaultpack.EXE
rules.description: Detects uncommon child processes of "DefaultPack.EXE" binary as a proxy to launch other programs

rules.name: Potential DLL Injection Or Execution Using Tracker.exe
rules.description: Detects potential DLL injection and execution using "Tracker.exe"

rules.name: Shadow Copies Creation Using Operating Systems Utilities
rules.description: Shadow Copies creation using operating systems utilities, possible credential access

rules.name: PUA - Process Hacker Execution
rules.description:
Detects the execution of Process Hacker based on binary metadata information (Image, Hash, Imphash, etc).
Process Hacker is a tool to view and manipulate processes, kernel options and other low level options.
Threat actors abused older vulnerable versions to manipulate system processes.

rules.name: Interesting Service Enumeration Via Sc.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the enumeration and query of interesting and in some cases sensitive services on the system via "sc.exe".
Attackers often try to enumerate the services currently running on a system in order to find different attack vectors.

rules.name: Suspicious Usage Of ShellExec_RunDLL
rules.description: Detects suspicious usage of the ShellExec_RunDLL function to launch other commands as seen in the the raspberry-robin attack

rules.name: Suspicious Vsls-Agent Command With AgentExtensionPath Load
rules.description: Detects Microsoft Visual Studio vsls-agent.exe lolbin execution with a suspicious library load using the --agentExtensionPath parameter

rules.name: HackTool - HandleKatz LSASS Dumper Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of HandleKatz, a tool that demonstrates the usage of cloned handles to Lsass in order to create an obfuscated memory dump of the same

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Wget.EXE
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses using Wget.exe

rules.name: Suspicious Msbuild Execution By Uncommon Parent Process
rules.description: Detects suspicious execution of 'Msbuild.exe' by a uncommon parent process

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious EventLog Recon Activity Using Log Query Utilities
rules.description:
Detects execution of different log query utilities and commands to search and dump the content of specific event logs or look for specific event IDs.
This technique is used by threat actors in order to extract sensitive information from events logs such as usernames, IP addresses, hostnames, etc.

rules.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Setupapi.dll Activity
rules.description: setupapi.dll library provide InstallHinfSection function for processing INF files. INF file may contain instructions allowing to create values in the registry, modify files and install drivers. This technique could be used to obtain persistence via modifying one of Run or RunOnce registry keys, run process or use other DLLs chain calls (see references) InstallHinfSection function in setupapi.dll calls runonce.exe executable regardless of actual content of INF file.

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Rundll32 Activity
rules.description: Detects suspicious execution of rundll32, with specific calls to some DLLs with known LOLBIN functionalities

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Potential Suspicious Remote Command Execution
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child processes launched via the ScreenConnect client service.

rules.name: Nltest.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects nltest commands that can be used for information discovery

rules.name: Chromium Browser Headless Execution To Mockbin Like Site
rules.description: Detects the execution of a Chromium based browser process with the "headless" flag and a URL pointing to the mockbin.org service (which can be used to exfiltrate data).

rules.name: Insensitive Subfolder Search Via Findstr.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of findstr with the "s" and "i" flags for a "subfolder" and "insensitive" search respectively. Attackers sometimes leverage this built-in utility to search the system for interesting files or filter through results of commands.

rules.name: Use of W32tm as Timer
rules.description: When configured with suitable command line arguments, w32tm can act as a delay mechanism

rules.name: Potential Process Injection Via Msra.EXE
rules.description: Detects potential process injection via Microsoft Remote Asssistance (Msra.exe) by looking at suspicious child processes spawned from the aforementioned process. It has been a target used by many threat actors and used for discovery and persistence tactics

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Obfuscation Via Reversed Commands
rules.description: Detects the presence of reversed PowerShell commands in the CommandLine. This is often used as a method of obfuscation by attackers

rules.name: Rundll32 Registered COM Objects
rules.description: load malicious registered COM objects

rules.name: Bypass UAC via Fodhelper.exe
rules.description: Identifies use of Fodhelper.exe to bypass User Account Control. Adversaries use this technique to execute privileged processes.

rules.name: Use of Pcalua For Execution
rules.description: Detects execition of commands and binaries from the context of The program compatibility assistant (Pcalua.exe). This can be used as a LOLBIN in order to bypass application whitelisting.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - GoToAssist Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Explorer NOUACCHECK Flag
rules.description: Detects suspicious starts of explorer.exe that use the /NOUACCHECK flag that allows to run all sub processes of that newly started explorer.exe without any UAC checks

rules.name: Potential LSASS Process Dump Via Procdump
rules.description:
Detects suspicious uses of the SysInternals Procdump utility by using a special command line parameter in combination with the lsass.exe process.
This way we are also able to catch cases in which the attacker has renamed the procdump executable.

rules.name: Powershell Base64 Encoded MpPreference Cmdlet
rules.description: Detects base64 encoded "MpPreference" PowerShell cmdlet code that tries to modifies or tamper with Windows Defender AV

rules.name: New Process Created Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects new process creation using WMIC via the "process call create" flag

rules.name: Node Process Executions
rules.description: Detects the execution of other scripts using the Node executable packaged with Adobe Creative Cloud

rules.name: Use of Scriptrunner.exe
rules.description: The "ScriptRunner.exe" binary can be abused to proxy execution through it and bypass possible whitelisting

rules.name: Operator Bloopers Cobalt Strike Modules
rules.description: Detects Cobalt Strike module/commands accidentally entered in CMD shell

rules.name: New Service Creation Using PowerShell
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new service using powershell.

rules.name: Run PowerShell Script from Redirected Input Stream
rules.description: Detects PowerShell script execution via input stream redirect

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Execution
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Pubprn.vbs Proxy Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of the 'Pubprn.vbs' Microsoft signed script to execute commands.

rules.name: Abused Debug Privilege by Arbitrary Parent Processes
rules.description: Detection of unusual child processes by different system processes

rules.name: Scheduled Task Creation Via Schtasks.EXE
rules.description: Detects the creation of scheduled tasks by user accounts via the "schtasks" utility.

rules.name: Potential Unquoted Service Path Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects known WMI recon method to look for unquoted service paths using wmic. Often used by pentester and attacker enumeration scripts

rules.name: Dism Remove Online Package
rules.description: Deployment Image Servicing and Management tool. DISM is used to enumerate, install, uninstall, configure, and update features and packages in Windows images

rules.name: Webshell Detection With Command Line Keywords
rules.description: Detects certain command line parameters often used during reconnaissance activity via web shells

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From IP Via Wget.EXE - Paths
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious file downloads directly from IP addresses and stored in suspicious locations using Wget.exe

rules.name: HackTool - SecurityXploded Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of SecurityXploded Tools

rules.name: Uncommon Child Process Of Setres.EXE
rules.description:
Detects uncommon child process of Setres.EXE.
Setres.EXE is a Windows server only process and tool that can be used to set the screen resolution.
It can potentially be abused in order to launch any arbitrary file with a name containing the word "choice" from the current execution path.

rules.name: LSASS Dump Keyword In CommandLine
rules.description: Detects the presence of the keywords "lsass" and ".dmp" in the commandline, which could indicate a potential attempt to dump or create a dump of the lsass process.

rules.name: Potential Download/Upload Activity Using Type Command
rules.description: Detects usage of the "type" command to download/upload data from WebDAV server

rules.name: Raccine Uninstall
rules.description: Detects commands that indicate a Raccine removal from an end system. Raccine is a free ransomware protection tool.

rules.name: WMI Persistence - Script Event Consumer
rules.description: Detects WMI script event consumers

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Browser Launch From Document Reader Process
rules.description: Detects when a browser process or browser tab is launched from an application that handles document files such as Adobe, Microsoft Office, etc. And connects to a web application over http(s), this could indicate a possible phishing attempt.

rules.name: Port Forwarding Activity Via SSH.EXE
rules.description: Detects port forwarding activity via SSH.exe

rules.name: Write Protect For Storage Disabled
rules.description:
Detects applications trying to modify the registry in order to disable any write-protect property for storage devices.
This could be a precursor to a ransomware attack and has been an observed technique used by cypherpunk group.

rules.name: IIS Native-Code Module Command Line Installation
rules.description: Detects suspicious IIS native-code module installations via command line

rules.name: File Download Using ProtocolHandler.exe
rules.description: Detects usage of "ProtocolHandler" to download files. Downloaded files will be located in the cache folder (for example - %LOCALAPPDATA%\Microsoft\Windows\INetCache\IE)

rules.name: CMSTP UAC Bypass via COM Object Access
rules.description: Detects UAC Bypass Attempt Using Microsoft Connection Manager Profile Installer Autoelevate-capable COM Objects (e.g. UACMe ID of 41, 43, 58 or 65)

rules.name: Suspicious CustomShellHost Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of CustomShellHost binary where the child isn't located in 'C:\Windows\explorer.exe'

rules.name: Loaded Module Enumeration Via Tasklist.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the enumeration of a specific DLL or EXE being used by a binary via "tasklist.exe".
This is often used by attackers in order to find the specific process identifier (PID) that is using the DLL in question.
In order to dump the process memory or perform other nefarious actions.

rules.name: Suspicious ScreenSave Change by Reg.exe
rules.description:
Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by user inactivity.
Screensavers are programs that execute after a configurable time of user inactivity and consist of Portable Executable (PE) files with a .scr file extension

rules.name: SafeBoot Registry Key Deleted Via Reg.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of "reg.exe" commands with the "delete" flag on safe boot registry keys. Often used by attacker to prevent safeboot execution of security products

rules.name: WSL Child Process Anomaly
rules.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes spawning from a WSL process. This could indicate an attempt to evade parent/child relationship detections or persistence attempts via cron using WSL

rules.name: Potential AMSI Bypass Using NULL Bits
rules.description: Detects usage of special strings/null bits in order to potentially bypass AMSI functionalities

rules.name: PUA - AdvancedRun Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of AdvancedRun utility in the context of the TrustedInstaller, SYSTEM, Local Service or Network Service accounts

rules.name: UtilityFunctions.ps1 Proxy Dll
rules.description: Detects the use of a Microsoft signed script executing a managed DLL with PowerShell.

rules.name: Stop Windows Service Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects the stopping of a Windows service via the "net" utility.

rules.name: PUA - CleanWipe Execution
rules.description: Detects the use of CleanWipe a tool usually used to delete Symantec antivirus.

rules.name: COM Object Execution via Xwizard.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of Xwizard tool with the "RunWizard" flag and a GUID like argument.
This utility can be abused in order to run custom COM object created in the registry.

rules.name: Use of OpenConsole
rules.description: Detects usage of OpenConsole binary as a LOLBIN to launch other binaries to bypass application Whitelisting

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Event Viewer Child Process
rules.description: Detects uncommon or suspicious child processes of "eventvwr.exe" which might indicate a UAC bypass attempt

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Office Document Executed From Trusted Location
rules.description: Detects the execution of an Office application that points to a document that is located in a trusted location. Attackers often used this to avoid macro security and execute their malicious code.

rules.name: Suspicious Runscripthelper.exe
rules.description: Detects execution of powershell scripts via Runscripthelper.exe

rules.name: Winrar Execution in Non-Standard Folder
rules.description: Detects a suspicious winrar execution in a folder which is not the default installation folder

rules.name: HackTool - CrackMapExec Execution
rules.description: This rule detect common flag combinations used by CrackMapExec in order to detect its use even if the binary has been replaced.

rules.name: Windows Firewall Disabled via PowerShell
rules.description: Detects attempts to disable the Windows Firewall using PowerShell

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Windows App Activity
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious child process of applications launched from inside the WindowsApps directory. This could be a sign of a rogue ".appx" package installation/execution

rules.name: Renamed Microsoft Teams Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed Microsoft Teams binary.

rules.name: Read Contents From Stdin Via Cmd.EXE
rules.description: Detect the use of "<" to read and potentially execute a file via cmd.exe

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class
rules.description: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script

rules.name: Suspicious Eventlog Clearing or Configuration Change Activity
rules.description:
Detects the clearing or configuration tampering of EventLog using utilities such as "wevtutil", "powershell" and "wmic".
This technique were seen used by threat actors and ransomware strains in order to evade defenses.

rules.name: Renamed Msdt.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "Msdt.exe" binary

rules.name: Changing Existing Service ImagePath Value Via Reg.EXE
rules.description:
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for registry to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code at Service start.
Windows stores local service configuration information in the Registry under HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services

rules.name: Rundll32 InstallScreenSaver Execution
rules.description: An attacker may execute an application as a SCR File using rundll32.exe desk.cpl,InstallScreenSaver

rules.name: Process Proxy Execution Via Squirrel.EXE
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "Squirrel.exe" binary to execute arbitrary processes. This binary is part of multiple Electron based software installations (Slack, Teams, Discord, etc.)

rules.name: Potential Crypto Mining Activity
rules.description: Detects command line parameters or strings often used by crypto miners

rules.name: VeeamBackup Database Credentials Dump Via Sqlcmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects dump of credentials in VeeamBackup dbo

rules.name: Arbitrary File Download Via GfxDownloadWrapper.EXE
rules.description: Detects execution of GfxDownloadWrapper.exe with a URL as an argument to download file.

rules.name: Execution of Powershell Script in Public Folder
rules.description: This rule detects execution of PowerShell scripts located in the "C:\Users\Public" folder

rules.name: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder
rules.description: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder

rules.name: Suspicious Active Directory Database Snapshot Via ADExplorer
rules.description: Detects the execution of Sysinternals ADExplorer with the "-snapshot" flag in order to save a local copy of the active directory database to a suspicious directory.

rules.name: Potential Product Class Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall, antivirus and antispywware products.
Adversaries often enumerate security products installed on a system to identify security controls and potential ways to evade detection or disable protection mechanisms.
This information helps them plan their next attack steps and choose appropriate techniques to bypass security measures.

rules.name: Possible Privilege Escalation via Weak Service Permissions
rules.description: Detection of sc.exe utility spawning by user with Medium integrity level to change service ImagePath or FailureCommand

rules.name: UEFI Persistence Via Wpbbin - ProcessCreation
rules.description: Detects execution of the binary "wpbbin" which is used as part of the UEFI based persistence method described in the reference section

rules.name: Suspicious GrpConv Execution
rules.description: Detects the suspicious execution of a utility to convert Windows 3.x .grp files or for persistence purposes by malicious software or actors

rules.name: Private Keys Reconnaissance Via CommandLine Tools
rules.description: Adversaries may search for private key certificate files on compromised systems for insecurely stored credential

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - Team Viewer Session Started On Windows Host
rules.description:
Detects the command line executed when TeamViewer starts a session started by a remote host.
Once a connection has been started, an investigator can verify the connection details by viewing the "incoming_connections.txt" log file in the TeamViewer folder.

rules.name: Potential PowerShell Execution Via DLL
rules.description:
Detects potential PowerShell execution from a DLL instead of the usual PowerShell process as seen used in PowerShdll.
This detection assumes that PowerShell commands are passed via the CommandLine.

rules.name: Use Of The SFTP.EXE Binary As A LOLBIN
rules.description: Detects the usage of the "sftp.exe" binary as a LOLBIN by abusing the "-D" flag

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Execution Of PDQDeployRunner
rules.description: Detects suspicious execution of "PDQDeployRunner" which is part of the PDQDeploy service stack that is responsible for executing commands and packages on a remote machines

rules.name: Execute Code with Pester.bat
rules.description: Detects code execution via Pester.bat (Pester - Powershell Modulte for testing)

rules.name: Unsigned AppX Installation Attempt Using Add-AppxPackage
rules.description: Detects usage of the "Add-AppxPackage" or it's alias "Add-AppPackage" to install unsigned AppX packages

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell

rules.name: Execution via WorkFolders.exe
rules.description: Detects using WorkFolders.exe to execute an arbitrary control.exe

rules.name: Suspicious Rundll32 Execution With Image Extension
rules.description: Detects the execution of Rundll32.exe with DLL files masquerading as image files

rules.name: Permission Misconfiguration Reconnaissance Via Findstr.EXE
rules.description:
Detects usage of findstr with the "EVERYONE" or "BUILTIN" keywords.
This was seen being used in combination with "icacls" and other utilities to spot misconfigured files or folders permissions.

rules.name: PDQ Deploy Remote Adminstartion Tool Execution
rules.description: Detect use of PDQ Deploy remote admin tool

rules.name: Potential Process Execution Proxy Via CL_Invocation.ps1
rules.description: Detects calls to "SyncInvoke" that is part of the "CL_Invocation.ps1" script to proxy execution using "System.Diagnostics.Process"

rules.name: Suspicious Process By Web Server Process
rules.description: Detects potentially suspicious processes being spawned by a web server process which could be the result of a successfully placed web shell or exploitation

rules.name: Kernel Memory Dump Via LiveKD
rules.description: Detects execution of LiveKD with the "-m" flag to potentially dump the kernel memory

rules.name: PowerShell Get-Process LSASS
rules.description: Detects a "Get-Process" cmdlet and it's aliases on lsass process, which is in almost all cases a sign of malicious activity

rules.name: Enumeration for Credentials in Registry
rules.description:
Adversaries may search the Registry on compromised systems for insecurely stored credentials.
The Windows Registry stores configuration information that can be used by the system or other programs.
Adversaries may query the Registry looking for credentials and passwords that have been stored for use by other programs or services

rules.name: Suspicious Git Clone
rules.description: Detects execution of "git" in order to clone a remote repository that contain suspicious keywords which might be suspicious

rules.name: Execution of Suspicious File Type Extension
rules.description:
Detects whether the image specified in a process creation event doesn't refer to an ".exe" (or other known executable extension) file. This can be caused by process ghosting or other unorthodox methods to start a process.
This rule might require some initial baselining to align with some third party tooling in the user environment.

rules.name: Unusual Parent Process For Cmd.EXE
rules.description: Detects suspicious parent process for cmd.exe

rules.name: Powershell Defender Exclusion
rules.description: Detects requests to exclude files, folders or processes from Antivirus scanning using PowerShell cmdlets

rules.name: Renamed Vmnat.exe Execution
rules.description: Detects renamed vmnat.exe or portable version that can be used for DLL side-loading

rules.name: Gpresult Display Group Policy Information
rules.description: Detects cases in which a user uses the built-in Windows utility gpresult to display the Resultant Set of Policy (RSoP) information

rules.name: Suspicious GUP Usage
rules.description: Detects execution of the Notepad++ updater in a suspicious directory, which is often used in DLL side-loading attacks

rules.name: Potential UAC Bypass Via Sdclt.EXE
rules.description: A General detection for sdclt being spawned as an elevated process. This could be an indicator of sdclt being used for bypass UAC techniques.

rules.name: Suspicious Encoded And Obfuscated Reflection Assembly Load Function Call
rules.description: Detects suspicious base64 encoded and obfuscated "LOAD" keyword used in .NET "reflection.assembly"

rules.name: Potential Active Directory Enumeration Using AD Module - ProcCreation
rules.description: Detects usage of the "Import-Module" cmdlet to load the "Microsoft.ActiveDirectory.Management.dl" DLL. Which is often used by attackers to perform AD enumeration.

rules.name: Console CodePage Lookup Via CHCP
rules.description: Detects use of chcp to look up the system locale value as part of host discovery

rules.name: Change Default File Association Via Assoc
rules.description:
Detects file association changes using the builtin "assoc" command.
When a file is opened, the default program used to open the file (also called the file association or handler) is checked. File association selections are stored in the Windows Registry and can be edited by users, administrators, or programs that have Registry access or by administrators using the built-in assoc utility. Applications can modify the file association for a given file extension to call an arbitrary program when a file with the given extension is opened.

rules.name: Potential Provlaunch.EXE Binary Proxy Execution Abuse
rules.description: Detects child processes of "provlaunch.exe" which might indicate potential abuse to proxy execution.

rules.name: Execute Files with Msdeploy.exe
rules.description: Detects file execution using the msdeploy.exe lolbin

rules.name: Scripting/CommandLine Process Spawned Regsvr32
rules.description: Detects various command line and scripting engines/processes such as "PowerShell", "Wscript", "Cmd", etc. spawning a "regsvr32" instance.

rules.name: Renamed CURL.EXE Execution
rules.description: Detects the execution of a renamed "CURL.exe" binary based on the PE metadata fields

rules.name: Webshell Hacking Activity Patterns
rules.description: Detects certain parent child patterns found in cases in which a web shell is used to perform certain credential dumping or exfiltration activities on a compromised system

rules.name: Suspicious PowerShell Parameter Substring
rules.description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring

rules.name: File In Suspicious Location Encoded To Base64 Via Certutil.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of certutil with the "encode" flag to encode a file to base64 where the files are located in potentially suspicious locations

rules.name: Hiding User Account Via SpecialAccounts Registry Key - CommandLine
rules.description: Detects changes to the registry key "HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows NT\CurrentVersion\Winlogon\SpecialAccounts\Userlist" where the value is set to "0" in order to hide user account from being listed on the logon screen.

rules.name: New User Created Via Net.EXE With Never Expire Option
rules.description: Detects creation of local users via the net.exe command with the option "never expire"

rules.name: Dumping Process via Sqldumper.exe
rules.description: Detects process dump via legitimate sqldumper.exe binary

rules.name: Suspicious Process Parents
rules.description: Detects suspicious parent processes that should not have any children or should only have a single possible child program

rules.name: PsExec Service Child Process Execution as LOCAL SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)

rules.name: New Capture Session Launched Via DXCap.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of "DXCap.EXE" with the "-c" flag, which allows a user to launch any arbitrary binary or windows package through DXCap itself. This can be abused to potentially bypass application whitelisting.

rules.name: Recon Information for Export with Command Prompt
rules.description: Once established within a system or network, an adversary may use automated techniques for collecting internal data.

rules.name: HackTool - WinRM Access Via Evil-WinRM
rules.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a computer using the Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP). The adversary may then perform actions as the logged-on user.

rules.name: Use NTFS Short Name in Image
rules.description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid Image based detection

rules.name: Unmount Share Via Net.EXE
rules.description: Detects when when a mounted share is removed. Adversaries may remove share connections that are no longer useful in order to clean up traces of their operation

rules.name: File And SubFolder Enumeration Via Dir Command
rules.description: Detects usage of the "dir" command part of Widows CMD with the "/S" command line flag in order to enumerate files in a specified directory and all subdirectories.

rules.name: Potential Product Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
rules.description: Detects the execution of WMIC in order to get a list of firewall and antivirus products

rules.name: PUA - NirCmd Execution As LOCAL SYSTEM
rules.description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution as SYSTEM user

rules.name: PUA - Potential PE Metadata Tamper Using Rcedit
rules.description: Detects the use of rcedit to potentially alter executable PE metadata properties, which could conceal efforts to rename system utilities for defense evasion.

rules.name: Suspicious Use of PsLogList
rules.description: Detects usage of the PsLogList utility to dump event log in order to extract admin accounts and perform account discovery or delete events logs

rules.name: PUA - Rclone Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of RClone utility for exfiltration as used by various ransomwares strains like REvil, Conti, FiveHands, etc

rules.name: Potential Arbitrary DLL Load Using Winword
rules.description: Detects potential DLL sideloading using the Microsoft Office winword process via the '/l' flag.

rules.name: Vulnerable HackSys Extreme Vulnerable Driver Load
rules.description: Detects the load of HackSys Extreme Vulnerable Driver which is an intentionally vulnerable Windows driver developed for security enthusiasts to learn and polish their exploitation skills at Kernel level and often abused by threat actors

rules.name: Malicious Driver Load
rules.description: Detects loading of known malicious drivers via their hash.

rules.name: Vulnerable WinRing0 Driver Load
rules.description: Detects the load of a signed WinRing0 driver often used by threat actors, crypto miners (XMRIG) or malware for privilege escalation

rules.name: WinDivert Driver Load
rules.description: Detects the load of the Windiver driver, a powerful user-mode capture/sniffing/modification/blocking/re-injection package for Windows

rules.name: Vulnerable Driver Load By Name
rules.description: Detects the load of known vulnerable drivers via the file name of the drivers.

rules.name: Vulnerable Driver Load
rules.description: Detects loading of known vulnerable drivers via their hash.

rules.name: Malicious Driver Load By Name
rules.description: Detects loading of known malicious drivers via the file name of the drivers.

rules.name: Driver Load From A Temporary Directory
rules.description: Detects a driver load from a temporary directory

rules.name: PUA - Process Hacker Driver Load
rules.description: Detects driver load of the Process Hacker tool

rules.name: PUA - System Informer Driver Load
rules.description: Detects driver load of the System Informer tool

rules.name: Sysmon File Executable Creation Detected
rules.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileExecutableDetected" event, which triggers every time a PE that is monitored by the config is created.

rules.name: Sysmon Configuration Modification
rules.description: Detects when an attacker tries to hide from Sysmon by disabling or stopping it

rules.name: Sysmon Blocked Executable
rules.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileBlockExecutable" event, which indicates a violation of the configured block policy

rules.name: Sysmon Configuration Change
rules.description: Detects a Sysmon configuration change, which could be the result of a legitimate reconfiguration or someone trying manipulate the configuration

rules.name: Sysmon Blocked File Shredding
rules.description: Triggers on any Sysmon "FileBlockShredding" event, which indicates a violation of the configured shredding policy.

rules.name: Sysmon Configuration Error
rules.description: Detects when an adversary is trying to hide it's action from Sysmon logging based on error messages

rules.name: Mimikatz Use
rules.description: This method detects mimikatz keywords in different Eventlogs (some of them only appear in older Mimikatz version that are however still used by different threat groups)

rules.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Running
rules.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service running on an endpoint.

rules.name: Certificate Exported From Local Certificate Store
rules.description: Detects when an application exports a certificate (and potentially the private key as well) from the local Windows certificate store.

rules.name: File Was Not Allowed To Run
rules.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

rules.name: Windows Firewall Settings Have Been Changed
rules.description: Detects activity when the settings of the Windows firewall have been changed

rules.name: New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List Via WmiPrvSE.EXE
rules.description:
Detects the addition of a new "Allow" firewall rule by the WMI process (WmiPrvSE.EXE).
This can occur if an attacker leverages PowerShell cmdlets such as "New-NetFirewallRule", or directly uses WMI CIM classes such as "MSFT_NetFirewallRule".

rules.name: New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List For Potential Suspicious Application
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new rule to the Windows Firewall exception list for an application located in a potentially suspicious location.

rules.name: A Rule Has Been Deleted From The Windows Firewall Exception List
rules.description: Detects when a single rules or all of the rules have been deleted from the Windows Defender Firewall

rules.name: Uncommon New Firewall Rule Added In Windows Firewall Exception List
rules.description: Detects when a rule has been added to the Windows Firewall exception list

rules.name: Windows Defender Firewall Has Been Reset To Its Default Configuration
rules.description: Detects activity when Windows Defender Firewall has been reset to its default configuration

rules.name: The Windows Defender Firewall Service Failed To Load Group Policy
rules.description: Detects activity when The Windows Defender Firewall service failed to load Group Policy

rules.name: All Rules Have Been Deleted From The Windows Firewall Configuration
rules.description: Detects when a all the rules have been deleted from the Windows Defender Firewall configuration

rules.name: Scheduled Task Executed Uncommon LOLBIN
rules.description: Detects the execution of Scheduled Tasks where the program being run is located in a suspicious location or where it is an unusual program to be run from a Scheduled Task

rules.name: Scheduled Task Executed From A Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects the execution of Scheduled Tasks where the Program being run is located in a suspicious location or it's an unusale program to be run from a Scheduled Task

rules.name: Important Scheduled Task Deleted
rules.description: Detects when adversaries try to stop system services or processes by deleting their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

rules.name: Suspicious Digital Signature Of AppX Package
rules.description: Detects execution of AppX packages with known suspicious or malicious signature

rules.name: Certificate Private Key Acquired
rules.description: Detects when an application acquires a certificate private key

rules.name: Failed DNS Zone Transfer
rules.description: Detects when a DNS zone transfer failed.

rules.name: DNS Server Error Failed Loading the ServerLevelPluginDLL
rules.description: Detects a DNS server error in which a specified plugin DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

rules.name: Possible Shadow Credentials Added
rules.description: Detects possible addition of shadow credentials to an active directory object.

rules.name: New or Renamed User Account with '$' Character
rules.description: Detects the creation of a user with the "$" character. This can be used by attackers to hide a user or trick detection systems that lack the parsing mechanisms.

rules.name: User Added to Local Administrator Group
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new member to the local administrator group, which could be legitimate activity or a sign of privilege escalation activity

rules.name: Hidden Local User Creation
rules.description: Detects the creation of a local hidden user account which should not happen for event ID 4720.

rules.name: Service Registry Key Read Access Request
rules.description:
Detects "read access" requests on the services registry key.
Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the Registry entries used by services.
Adversaries may use flaws in the permissions for Registry keys related to services to redirect from the originally specified executable to one that they control, in order to launch their own code when a service starts.

rules.name: Active Directory Replication from Non Machine Account
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of Active Directory Replication Service (ADRS) from a non machine account to request credentials.

rules.name: Windows Defender Exclusion Registry Key - Write Access Requested
rules.description: Detects write access requests to the Windows Defender exclusions registry keys. This could be an indication of an attacker trying to request a handle or access the object to write new exclusions in order to bypass security.

rules.name: SysKey Registry Keys Access
rules.description: Detects handle requests and access operations to specific registry keys to calculate the SysKey

rules.name: Replay Attack Detected
rules.description: Detects possible Kerberos Replay Attack on the domain controllers when "KRB_AP_ERR_REPEAT" Kerberos response is sent to the client

rules.name: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - Security
rules.description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform

rules.name: Locked Workstation
rules.description: Detects locked workstation session events that occur automatically after a standard period of inactivity.

rules.name: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation - Security
rules.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation

rules.name: Metasploit SMB Authentication
rules.description: Alerts on Metasploit host's authentications on the domain.

rules.name: Remote Service Activity via SVCCTL Named Pipe
rules.description: Detects remote service activity via remote access to the svcctl named pipe

rules.name: Persistence and Execution at Scale via GPO Scheduled Task
rules.description: Detect lateral movement using GPO scheduled task, usually used to deploy ransomware at scale

rules.name: Suspicious Teams Application Related ObjectAcess Event
rules.description: Detects an access to authentication tokens and accounts of Microsoft Teams desktop application.

rules.name: Tap Driver Installation - Security
rules.description: Detects the installation of a well-known TAP driver service. This could be a sign of potential preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques.

rules.name: Unauthorized System Time Modification
rules.description: Detect scenarios where a potentially unauthorized application or user is modifying the system time.

rules.name: Windows Network Access Suspicious desktop.ini Action
rules.description: Detects unusual processes accessing desktop.ini remotely over network share, which can be leveraged to alter how Explorer displays a folder's content (i.e. renaming files) without changing them on disk.

rules.name: SMB Create Remote File Admin Share
rules.description: Look for non-system accounts SMB accessing a file with write (0x2) access mask via administrative share (i.e C$).

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

rules.name: Add or Remove Computer from DC
rules.description: Detects the creation or removal of a computer. Can be used to detect attacks such as DCShadow via the creation of a new SPN.

rules.name: T1047 Wmiprvse Wbemcomn DLL Hijack
rules.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `wbemcomn.dll` in the `C:\Windows\System32\wbem\` directory over the network for a WMI DLL Hijack scenario.

rules.name: WCE wceaux.dll Access
rules.description: Detects wceaux.dll access while WCE pass-the-hash remote command execution on source host

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts

rules.name: DPAPI Domain Backup Key Extraction
rules.description: Detects tools extracting LSA secret DPAPI domain backup key from Domain Controllers

rules.name: Register new Logon Process by Rubeus
rules.description: Detects potential use of Rubeus via registered new trusted logon process

rules.name: Azure AD Health Monitoring Agent Registry Keys Access
rules.description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key of Azure AD Health monitoring agent.
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object HKLM\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Microsoft Online\Reporting\MonitoringAgent.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - Security
rules.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the code block linked in the references

rules.name: AD Object WriteDAC Access
rules.description: Detects WRITE_DAC access to a domain object

rules.name: Denied Access To Remote Desktop
rules.description:
This event is generated when an authenticated user who is not allowed to log on remotely attempts to connect to this computer through Remote Desktop.
Often, this event can be generated by attackers when searching for available windows servers in the network.

rules.name: DCOM InternetExplorer.Application Iertutil DLL Hijack - Security
rules.description: Detects a threat actor creating a file named `iertutil.dll` in the `C:\Program Files\Internet Explorer\` directory over the network for a DCOM InternetExplorer DLL Hijack scenario.

rules.name: SCM Database Handle Failure
rules.description: Detects non-system users failing to get a handle of the SCM database.

rules.name: Windows Defender Exclusion List Modified
rules.description: Detects modifications to the Windows Defender exclusion registry key. This could indicate a potentially suspicious or even malicious activity by an attacker trying to add a new exclusion in order to bypass security.

rules.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Creation
rules.description: Detects suspicious scheduled task creation events. Based on attributes such as paths, commands line flags, etc.

rules.name: Password Dumper Activity on LSASS
rules.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask and object type SAM_DOMAIN

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious AccessMask Requested From LSASS
rules.description: Detects process handle on LSASS process with certain access mask

rules.name: Mimikatz DC Sync
rules.description: Detects Mimikatz DC sync security events

rules.name: Group Policy Abuse for Privilege Addition
rules.description: Detects the first occurrence of a modification to Group Policy Object Attributes to add privileges to user accounts or use them to add users as local admins.

rules.name: Metasploit Or Impacket Service Installation Via SMB PsExec
rules.description: Detects usage of Metasploit SMB PsExec (exploit/windows/smb/psexec) and Impacket psexec.py by triggering on specific service installation

rules.name: A New Trust Was Created To A Domain
rules.description: Addition of domains is seldom and should be verified for legitimacy.

rules.name: WMI Persistence - Security
rules.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.

rules.name: DCERPC SMB Spoolss Named Pipe
rules.description: Detects the use of the spoolss named pipe over SMB. This can be used to trigger the authentication via NTLM of any machine that has the spoolservice enabled.

rules.name: Win Susp Computer Name Containing Samtheadmin
rules.description: Detects suspicious computer name samtheadmin-{1..100}$ generated by hacktool

rules.name: Windows Event Auditing Disabled
rules.description:
Detects scenarios where system auditing (i.e.: Windows event log auditing) is disabled.
This may be used in a scenario where an entity would want to bypass local logging to evade detection when Windows event logging is enabled and reviewed.
Also, it is recommended to turn off "Local Group Policy Object Processing" via GPO, which will make sure that Active Directory GPOs take precedence over local/edited computer policies via something such as "gpedit.msc".
Please note, that disabling "Local Group Policy Object Processing" may cause an issue in scenarios of one off specific GPO modifications - however, it is recommended to perform these modifications in Active Directory anyways.

rules.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened (Email Attachment)
rules.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.

rules.name: Security Eventlog Cleared
rules.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

rules.name: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability with Risky EKU
rules.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject and risky EKU

rules.name: Potential Privileged System Service Operation - SeLoadDriverPrivilege
rules.description:
Detects the usage of the 'SeLoadDriverPrivilege' privilege. This privilege is required to load or unload a device driver.
With this privilege, the user can dynamically load and unload device drivers or other code in to kernel mode.
This user right does not apply to Plug and Play device drivers.
If you exclude privileged users/admins and processes, which are allowed to do so, you are maybe left with bad programs trying to load malicious kernel drivers.
This will detect Ghost-In-The-Logs (https://github.com/bats3c/Ghost-In-The-Logs) and the usage of Sysinternals and various other tools. So you have to work with a whitelist to find the bad stuff.

rules.name: Suspicious LDAP-Attributes Used
rules.description: Detects the usage of particular AttributeLDAPDisplayNames, which are known for data exchange via LDAP by the tool LDAPFragger and are additionally not commonly used in companies.

rules.name: Important Windows Event Auditing Disabled
rules.description: Detects scenarios where system auditing for important events such as "Process Creation" or "Logon" events is disabled.

rules.name: Processes Accessing the Microphone and Webcam
rules.description: Potential adversaries accessing the microphone and webcam in an endpoint.

rules.name: Protected Storage Service Access
rules.description: Detects access to a protected_storage service over the network. Potential abuse of DPAPI to extract domain backup keys from Domain Controllers
