rules.name: Failed Code Integrity Checks
rules.description: Detects code integrity failures such as missing page hashes or corrupted drivers due unauthorized modification. This could be a sign of tampered binaries.

rules.name: Password Policy Enumerated
rules.description: Detects when the password policy is enumerated.

rules.name: HybridConnectionManager Service Installation
rules.description: Rule to detect the Hybrid Connection Manager service installation.

rules.name: Remote PowerShell Sessions Network Connections (WinRM)
rules.description: Detects basic PowerShell Remoting (WinRM) by monitoring for network inbound connections to ports 5985 OR 5986

rules.name: Hacktool Ruler
rules.description: This events that are generated when using the hacktool Ruler by Sensepost

rules.name: Account Tampering - Suspicious Failed Logon Reasons
rules.description: This method uses uncommon error codes on failed logons to determine suspicious activity and tampering with accounts that have been disabled or somehow restricted.

rules.name: Possible PetitPotam Coerce Authentication Attempt
rules.description: Detect PetitPotam coerced authentication activity.

rules.name: Suspicious Windows ANONYMOUS LOGON Local Account Created
rules.description: Detects the creation of suspicious accounts similar to ANONYMOUS LOGON, such as using additional spaces. Created as an covering detection for exclusion of Logon Type 3 from ANONYMOUS LOGON accounts.

rules.name: ADCS Certificate Template Configuration Vulnerability
rules.description: Detects certificate creation with template allowing risk permission subject

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell

rules.name: Impacket PsExec Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of Impacket's psexec.py.

rules.name: Suspicious Remote Logon with Explicit Credentials
rules.description: Detects suspicious processes logging on with explicit credentials

rules.name: Remote Task Creation via ATSVC Named Pipe
rules.description: Detects remote task creation via at.exe or API interacting with ATSVC namedpipe

rules.name: ISO Image Mounted
rules.description: Detects the mount of an ISO image on an endpoint

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts

rules.name: Suspicious Kerberos RC4 Ticket Encryption
rules.description: Detects service ticket requests using RC4 encryption type

rules.name: Reconnaissance Activity
rules.description: Detects activity as "net user administrator /domain" and "net group domain admins /domain"

rules.name: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services - Security
rules.description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service

rules.name: Service Installed By Unusual Client - Security
rules.description: Detects a service installed by a client which has PID 0 or whose parent has PID 0

rules.name: First Time Seen Remote Named Pipe
rules.description: This detection excludes known namped pipes accessible remotely and notify on newly observed ones, may help to detect lateral movement and remote exec using named pipes

rules.name: ETW Logging Disabled In .NET Processes - Registry
rules.description: Potential adversaries stopping ETW providers recording loaded .NET assemblies.

rules.name: Suspicious PsExec Execution
rules.description: detects execution of psexec or paexec with renamed service name, this rule helps to filter out the noise if psexec is used for legit purposes or if attacker uses a different psexec client other than sysinternal one

rules.name: SAM Registry Hive Handle Request
rules.description: Detects handles requested to SAM registry hive

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER

rules.name: Powerview Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync AD Extend Right
rules.description: Backdooring domain object to grant the rights associated with DCSync to a regular user or machine account using Powerview\Add-DomainObjectAcl DCSync Extended Right cmdlet, will allow to re-obtain the pwd hashes of any user/computer

rules.name: Kerberoasting Activity - Initial Query
rules.description:
This rule will collect the data needed to start looking into possible kerberoasting activity.
Further analysis or computation within the query is needed focusing on requests from one specific host/IP towards multiple service names within a time period of 5 seconds.
You can then set a threshold for the number of requests and time between the requests to turn this into an alert.

rules.name: Local User Creation
rules.description: Detects local user creation on Windows servers, which shouldn't happen in an Active Directory environment. Apply this Sigma Use Case on your Windows server logs and not on your DC logs.

rules.name: Kerberos Manipulation
rules.description: Detects failed Kerberos TGT issue operation. This can be a sign of manipulations of TGT messages by an attacker.

rules.name: NetNTLM Downgrade Attack
rules.description: Detects NetNTLM downgrade attack

rules.name: External Disk Drive Or USB Storage Device Was Recognized By The System
rules.description: Detects external disk drives or plugged-in USB devices.

rules.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened (Suspicious Filenames)
rules.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives with suspicious file names. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.

rules.name: Startup/Logon Script Added to Group Policy Object
rules.description: Detects the modification of Group Policy Objects (GPO) to add a startup/logon script to users or computer objects.

rules.name: Addition of SID History to Active Directory Object
rules.description: An attacker can use the SID history attribute to gain additional privileges.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell

rules.name: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution - Security
rules.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events

rules.name: Password Protected ZIP File Opened
rules.description: Detects the extraction of password protected ZIP archives. See the filename variable for more details on which file has been opened.

rules.name: Active Directory User Backdoors
rules.description: Detects scenarios where one can control another users or computers account without having to use their credentials.

rules.name: User Logoff Event
rules.description: Detects a user log-off activity. Could be used for example to correlate information during forensic investigations

rules.name: Potential Secure Deletion with SDelete
rules.description: Detects files that have extensions commonly seen while SDelete is used to wipe files.

rules.name: VSSAudit Security Event Source Registration
rules.description: Detects the registration of the security event source VSSAudit. It would usually trigger when volume shadow copy operations happen.

rules.name: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
rules.description: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

rules.name: Weak Encryption Enabled and Kerberoast
rules.description: Detects scenario where weak encryption is enabled for a user profile which could be used for hash/password cracking.

rules.name: User Couldn't Call a Privileged Service 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess'
rules.description: The 'LsaRegisterLogonProcess' function verifies that the application making the function call is a logon process by checking that it has the SeTcbPrivilege privilege set. Possible Rubeus tries to get a handle to LSA.

rules.name: Azure AD Health Service Agents Registry Keys Access
rules.description:
This detection uses Windows security events to detect suspicious access attempts to the registry key values and sub-keys of Azure AD Health service agents (e.g AD FS).
Information from AD Health service agents can be used to potentially abuse some of the features provided by those services in the cloud (e.g. Federation).
This detection requires an access control entry (ACE) on the system access control list (SACL) of the following securable object: HKLM:\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\ADHealthAgent.
Make sure you set the SACL to propagate to its sub-keys.

rules.name: HackTool - NoFilter Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of NoFilter, a tool for abusing the Windows Filtering Platform for privilege escalation via hardcoded policy name indicators

rules.name: HackTool - EDRSilencer Execution - Filter Added
rules.description: Detects execution of EDRSilencer, a tool that abuses the Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) to block the outbound traffic of running EDR agents based on specific hardcoded filter names.

rules.name: Transferring Files with Credential Data via Network Shares
rules.description: Transferring files with well-known filenames (sensitive files with credential data) using network shares

rules.name: RDP over Reverse SSH Tunnel WFP
rules.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address

rules.name: Password Change on Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) Account
rules.description:
Detects potential attempts made to set the Directory Services Restore Mode administrator password.
The Directory Service Restore Mode (DSRM) account is a local administrator account on Domain Controllers.
Attackers may change the password in order to obtain persistence.

rules.name: SCM Database Privileged Operation
rules.description: Detects non-system users performing privileged operation os the SCM database

rules.name: Possible Impacket SecretDump Remote Activity
rules.description: Detect AD credential dumping using impacket secretdump HKTL

rules.name: LSASS Access From Non System Account
rules.description: Detects potential mimikatz-like tools accessing LSASS from non system account

rules.name: Device Installation Blocked
rules.description: Detects an installation of a device that is forbidden by the system policy

rules.name: Suspicious Access to Sensitive File Extensions
rules.description: Detects known sensitive file extensions accessed on a network share

rules.name: Enabled User Right in AD to Control User Objects
rules.description: Detects scenario where if a user is assigned the SeEnableDelegationPrivilege right in Active Directory it would allow control of other AD user objects.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts

rules.name: Possible DC Shadow Attack
rules.description: Detects DCShadow via create new SPN

rules.name: Uncommon Outbound Kerberos Connection - Security
rules.description: Detects uncommon outbound network activity via Kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

rules.name: PetitPotam Suspicious Kerberos TGT Request
rules.description:
Detect suspicious Kerberos TGT requests.
Once an attacer obtains a computer certificate by abusing Active Directory Certificate Services in combination with PetitPotam, the next step would be to leverage the certificate for malicious purposes.
One way of doing this is to request a Kerberos Ticket Granting Ticket using a tool like Rubeus.
This request will generate a 4768 event with some unusual fields depending on the environment.
This analytic will require tuning, we recommend filtering Account_Name to the Domain Controller computer accounts.

rules.name: Access To ADMIN$ Network Share
rules.description: Detects access to ADMIN$ network share

rules.name: Windows Pcap Drivers
rules.description: Detects Windows Pcap driver installation based on a list of associated .sys files.

rules.name: DPAPI Domain Master Key Backup Attempt
rules.description: Detects anyone attempting a backup for the DPAPI Master Key. This events gets generated at the source and not the Domain Controller.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER

rules.name: Suspicious Scheduled Task Update
rules.description: Detects update to a scheduled task event that contain suspicious keywords.

rules.name: Important Scheduled Task Deleted/Disabled
rules.description: Detects when adversaries stop services or processes by deleting or disabling their respective scheduled tasks in order to conduct data destructive activities

rules.name: Potential AD User Enumeration From Non-Machine Account
rules.description: Detects read access to a domain user from a non-machine account

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - Security
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts

rules.name: CobaltStrike Service Installations - Security
rules.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement

rules.name: Sysmon Channel Reference Deletion
rules.description: Potential threat actor tampering with Sysmon manifest and eventually disabling it

rules.name: Potential Privilege Escalation via Local Kerberos Relay over LDAP
rules.description:
Detects a suspicious local successful logon event where the Logon Package is Kerberos, the remote address is set to localhost, and the target user SID is the built-in local Administrator account.
This may indicate an attempt to leverage a Kerberos relay attack variant that can be used to elevate privilege locally from a domain joined limited user to local System privileges.

rules.name: DiagTrackEoP Default Login Username
rules.description: Detects the default "UserName" used by the DiagTrackEoP POC

rules.name: RDP Login from Localhost
rules.description: RDP login with localhost source address may be a tunnelled login

rules.name: A Security-Enabled Global Group Was Deleted
rules.description: Detects activity when a security-enabled global group is deleted

rules.name: External Remote SMB Logon from Public IP
rules.description: Detects successful logon from public IP address via SMB. This can indicate a publicly-exposed SMB port.

rules.name: RottenPotato Like Attack Pattern
rules.description: Detects logon events that have characteristics of events generated during an attack with RottenPotato and the like

rules.name: Outgoing Logon with New Credentials
rules.description: Detects logon events that specify new credentials

rules.name: Scanner PoC for CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE Vuln
rules.description: Detects the use of a scanner by zerosum0x0 that discovers targets vulnerable to  CVE-2019-0708 RDP RCE aka BlueKeep

rules.name: External Remote RDP Logon from Public IP
rules.description: Detects successful logon from public IP address via RDP. This can indicate a publicly-exposed RDP port.

rules.name: Failed Logon From Public IP
rules.description: Detects a failed logon attempt from a public IP. A login from a public IP can indicate a misconfigured firewall or network boundary.

rules.name: Successful Account Login Via WMI
rules.description: Detects successful logon attempts performed with WMI

rules.name: Pass the Hash Activity 2
rules.description: Detects the attack technique pass the hash which is used to move laterally inside the network

rules.name: A Member Was Removed From a Security-Enabled Global Group
rules.description: Detects activity when a member is removed from a security-enabled global group

rules.name: Potential Access Token Abuse
rules.description: Detects potential token impersonation and theft. Example, when using "DuplicateToken(Ex)" and "ImpersonateLoggedOnUser" with the "LOGON32_LOGON_NEW_CREDENTIALS flag".

rules.name: A Member Was Added to a Security-Enabled Global Group
rules.description: Detects activity when a member is added to a security-enabled global group

rules.name: Successful Overpass the Hash Attempt
rules.description: Detects successful logon with logon type 9 (NewCredentials) which matches the Overpass the Hash behavior of e.g Mimikatz's sekurlsa::pth module.

rules.name: Admin User Remote Logon
rules.description: Detect remote login by Administrator user (depending on internal pattern).

rules.name: Windows Filtering Platform Blocked Connection From EDR Agent Binary
rules.description:
Detects a Windows Filtering Platform (WFP) blocked connection event involving common Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents.
Adversaries may use WFP filters to prevent Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) agents from reporting security events.

rules.name: WMI Persistence
rules.description: Detects suspicious WMI event filter and command line event consumer based on WMI and Security Logs.

rules.name: BITS Transfer Job Downloading File Potential Suspicious Extension
rules.description: Detects new BITS transfer job saving local files with potential suspicious extensions

rules.name: BITS Transfer Job Download To Potential Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects new BITS transfer job where the LocalName/Saved file is stored in a potentially suspicious location

rules.name: BITS Transfer Job Download From Direct IP
rules.description: Detects a BITS transfer job downloading file(s) from a direct IP address.

rules.name: New BITS Job Created Via Bitsadmin
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new bits job by Bitsadmin

rules.name: New BITS Job Created Via PowerShell
rules.description: Detects the creation of a new bits job by PowerShell

rules.name: BITS Transfer Job With Uncommon Or Suspicious Remote TLD
rules.description: Detects a suspicious download using the BITS client from a FQDN that is unusual. Adversaries may abuse BITS jobs to persistently execute or clean up after malicious payloads.

rules.name: BITS Transfer Job Download From File Sharing Domains
rules.description: Detects BITS transfer job downloading files from a file sharing domain.

rules.name: New Module Module Added To IIS Server
rules.description: Detects the addition of a new module to an IIS server.

rules.name: Previously Installed IIS Module Was Removed
rules.description: Detects the removal of a previously installed IIS module.

rules.name: HTTP Logging Disabled On IIS Server
rules.description: Detects changes to of the IIS server configuration in order to disable HTTP logging for successful requests.

rules.name: ETW Logging/Processing Option Disabled On IIS Server
rules.description: Detects changes to of the IIS server configuration in order to disable/remove the ETW logging/processing option.

rules.name: NTLM Logon
rules.description: Detects logons using NTLM, which could be caused by a legacy source or attackers

rules.name: Potential Remote Desktop Connection to Non-Domain Host
rules.description: Detects logons using NTLM to hosts that are potentially not part of the domain.

rules.name: NTLM Brute Force
rules.description: Detects common NTLM brute force device names

rules.name: Potential Active Directory Reconnaissance/Enumeration Via LDAP
rules.description: Detects potential Active Directory enumeration via LDAP

rules.name: OpenSSH Server Listening On Socket
rules.description: Detects scenarios where an attacker enables the OpenSSH server and server starts to listening on SSH socket.

rules.name: Microsoft Defender Blocked from Loading Unsigned DLL
rules.description: Detects Code Integrity (CI) engine blocking Microsoft Defender's processes (MpCmdRun and NisSrv) from loading unsigned DLLs which may be an attempt to sideload arbitrary DLL

rules.name: Unsigned Binary Loaded From Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects Code Integrity (CI) engine blocking processes from loading unsigned DLLs residing in suspicious locations

rules.name: Suspicious Application Installed
rules.description: Detects suspicious application installed by looking at the added shortcut to the app resolver cache

rules.name: Ngrok Usage with Remote Desktop Service
rules.description: Detects cases in which ngrok, a reverse proxy tool, forwards events to the local RDP port, which could be a sign of malicious behaviour

rules.name: Sysinternals Tools AppX Versions Execution
rules.description: Detects execution of Sysinternals tools via an AppX package. Attackers could install the Sysinternals Suite to get access to tools such as psexec and procdump to avoid detection based on System paths

rules.name: Potential RDP Exploit CVE-2019-0708
rules.description: Detect suspicious error on protocol RDP, potential CVE-2019-0708

rules.name: Potential CVE-2021-42287 Exploitation Attempt
rules.description:
The attacker creates a computer object using those permissions with a password known to her.
After that she clears the attribute ServicePrincipalName on the computer object.
Because she created the object (CREATOR OWNER), she gets granted additional permissions and can do many changes to the object.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use MSHTA - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use MSHTA in Scripts

rules.name: Windows Defender Threat Detection Service Disabled
rules.description: Detects when the "Windows Defender Threat Protection" service is disabled.

rules.name: Anydesk Remote Access Software Service Installation
rules.description: Detects the installation of the anydesk software service. Which could be an indication of anydesk abuse if you the software isn't already used.

rules.name: Uncommon Service Installation Image Path
rules.description: Detects uncommon service installation commands by looking at suspicious or uncommon image path values containing references to encoded powershell commands, temporary paths, etc.

rules.name: CobaltStrike Service Installations - System
rules.description: Detects known malicious service installs that appear in cases in which a Cobalt Strike beacon elevates privileges or lateral movement

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation RUNDLL LAUNCHER - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via RUNDLL LAUNCHER

rules.name: Remote Utilities Host Service Install
rules.description: Detects Remote Utilities Host service installation on the target system.

rules.name: RemCom Service Installation
rules.description: Detects RemCom service installation and execution events

rules.name: Service Installation in Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects service installation in suspicious folder appdata

rules.name: Mesh Agent Service Installation
rules.description: Detects a Mesh Agent service installation. Mesh Agent is used to remotely manage computers

rules.name: PsExec Service Installation
rules.description: Detects PsExec service installation and execution events

rules.name: Sliver C2 Default Service Installation
rules.description: Detects known malicious service installation that appear in cases in which a Sliver implants execute the PsExec commands

rules.name: Suspicious Service Installation Script
rules.description: Detects suspicious service installation scripts

rules.name: ProcessHacker Privilege Elevation
rules.description: Detects a ProcessHacker tool that elevated privileges to a very high level

rules.name: RTCore Suspicious Service Installation
rules.description: Detects the installation of RTCore service. Which could be an indication of Micro-Star MSI Afterburner vulnerable driver abuse

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation COMPRESS OBFUSCATION - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via COMPRESS OBFUSCATION

rules.name: Meterpreter or Cobalt Strike Getsystem Service Installation - System
rules.description: Detects the use of getsystem Meterpreter/Cobalt Strike command by detecting a specific service installation

rules.name: Important Windows Service Terminated With Error
rules.description: Detects important or interesting Windows services that got terminated for whatever reason

rules.name: PowerShell Scripts Installed as Services
rules.description: Detects powershell script installed as a Service

rules.name: Credential Dumping Tools Service Execution - System
rules.description: Detects well-known credential dumping tools execution via service execution events

rules.name: Service Installation with Suspicious Folder Pattern
rules.description: Detects service installation with suspicious folder patterns

rules.name: Suspicious Service Installation
rules.description: Detects suspicious service installation commands

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation CLIP+ Launcher - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Clip.exe to execute PowerShell

rules.name: HackTool Service Registration or Execution
rules.description: Detects installation or execution of services

rules.name: New PDQDeploy Service - Server Side
rules.description:
Detects a PDQDeploy service installation which indicates that PDQDeploy was installed on the machines.
PDQDeploy can be abused by attackers to remotely install packages or execute commands on target machines

rules.name: PAExec Service Installation
rules.description: Detects PAExec service installation

rules.name: Moriya Rootkit - System
rules.description: Detects the use of Moriya rootkit as described in the securelist's Operation TunnelSnake report

rules.name: Tap Driver Installation
rules.description: Well-known TAP software installation. Possible preparation for data exfiltration using tunnelling techniques

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR++ LAUNCHER OBFUSCATION - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via VAR++ LAUNCHER

rules.name: Service Installed By Unusual Client - System
rules.description: Detects a service installed by a client which has PID 0 or whose parent has PID 0

rules.name: New PDQDeploy Service - Client Side
rules.description:
Detects PDQDeploy service installation on the target system.
When a package is deployed via PDQDeploy it installs a remote service on the target machine with the name "PDQDeployRunner-X" where "X" is an integer starting from 1

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Stdin - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via Stdin in Scripts

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation STDIN+ Launcher - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of stdin to execute PowerShell

rules.name: KrbRelayUp Service Installation
rules.description: Detects service creation from KrbRelayUp tool used for privilege escalation in Windows domain environments where LDAP signing is not enforced (the default settings)

rules.name: smbexec.py Service Installation
rules.description: Detects the use of smbexec.py tool by detecting a specific service installation

rules.name: Important Windows Service Terminated Unexpectedly
rules.description: Detects important or interesting Windows services that got terminated unexpectedly.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Obfuscated IEX Invocation - System
rules.description: Detects all variations of obfuscated powershell IEX invocation code generated by Invoke-Obfuscation framework from the code block linked in the references

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Clip - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Clip.exe in Scripts

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation VAR+ Launcher - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated use of Environment Variables to execute PowerShell

rules.name: TacticalRMM Service Installation
rules.description: Detects a TacticalRMM service installation. Tactical RMM is a remote monitoring & management tool.

rules.name: Invoke-Obfuscation Via Use Rundll32 - System
rules.description: Detects Obfuscated Powershell via use Rundll32 in Scripts

rules.name: NetSupport Manager Service Install
rules.description: Detects NetSupport Manager service installation on the target system.

rules.name: Windows Service Terminated With Error
rules.description: Detects Windows services that got terminated for whatever reason

rules.name: Remote Access Tool Services Have Been Installed - System
rules.description: Detects service installation of different remote access tools software. These software are often abused by threat actors to perform

rules.name: CSExec Service Installation
rules.description: Detects CSExec service installation and execution events

rules.name: Suspicious Usage of CVE_2021_34484 or CVE 2022_21919
rules.description: During exploitation of this vulnerability, two logs (Provider_Name:Microsoft-Windows-User Profiles Service) with EventID 1511 and 1515 (maybe lot of false positives with this event) are created. Moreover, it appears the directory \Users\TEMP is created may be created during the exploitation. Viewed on 2008 Server

rules.name: Windows Update Error
rules.description: Detects Windows update errors including installation failures and connection issues. Defenders should observe this in case critical update KBs aren't installed.

rules.name: Important Windows Eventlog Cleared
rules.description: Detects the clearing of one of the Windows Core Eventlogs. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

rules.name: Eventlog Cleared
rules.description: One of the Windows Eventlogs has been cleared. e.g. caused by "wevtutil cl" command execution

rules.name: Volume Shadow Copy Mount
rules.description: Detects volume shadow copy mount via Windows event log

rules.name: Zerologon Exploitation Using Well-known Tools
rules.description: This rule is designed to detect attempts to exploit Zerologon (CVE-2020-1472) vulnerability using mimikatz zerologon module or other exploits from machine with "kali" hostname.

rules.name: Vulnerable Netlogon Secure Channel Connection Allowed
rules.description: Detects that a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection was allowed, which could be an indicator of CVE-2020-1472.

rules.name: No Suitable Encryption Key Found For Generating Kerberos Ticket
rules.description:
Detects errors when a target server doesn't have suitable keys for generating kerberos tickets.
This issue can occur for example when a service uses a user account or a computer account that is configured for only DES encryption on a computer that is running Windows 7 which has DES encryption for Kerberos authentication disabled.

rules.name: KDC RC4-HMAC Downgrade CVE-2022-37966
rules.description: Detects the exploitation of a security bypass and elevation of privilege vulnerability with Authentication Negotiation by using weak RC4-HMAC negotiation

rules.name: Certificate Use With No Strong Mapping
rules.description:
Detects a user certificate that was valid but could not be mapped to a user in a strong way (such as via explicit mapping, key trust mapping, or a SID)
This could be a sign of exploitation of the elevation of privilege vulnerabilities (CVE-2022-34691, CVE-2022-26931, CVE-2022-26923) that can occur when the KDC allows certificate spoofing by not requiring a strong mapping.
Events where the AccountName and CN of the Subject do not match, or where the CN ends in a dollar sign indicating a machine, may indicate certificate spoofing.

rules.name: Local Privilege Escalation Indicator TabTip
rules.description: Detects the invocation of TabTip via CLSID as seen when JuicyPotatoNG is used on a system in brute force mode

rules.name: Active Directory Certificate Services Denied Certificate Enrollment Request
rules.description:
Detects denied requests by Active Directory Certificate Services.
Example of these requests denial include issues with permissions on the certificate template or invalid signatures.

rules.name: Critical Hive In Suspicious Location Access Bits Cleared
rules.description:
Detects events from the Kernel-General ETW indicating that the access bits of a hive with a system like hive name located in the temp directory have been reset.
This occurs when an application tries to access a hive and the hive has not be recognized since the last 7 days (by default).
Registry hive dumping utilities such as QuarksPwDump were seen emitting this behavior.

rules.name: NTLMv1 Logon Between Client and Server
rules.description: Detects the reporting of NTLMv1 being used between a client and server. NTLMv1 is insecure as the underlying encryption algorithms can be brute-forced by modern hardware.

rules.name: DHCP Server Error Failed Loading the CallOut DLL
rules.description: This rule detects a DHCP server error in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) could not be loaded

rules.name: DHCP Server Loaded the CallOut DLL
rules.description: This rule detects a DHCP server in which a specified Callout DLL (in registry) was loaded

rules.name: NTFS Vulnerability Exploitation
rules.description: This the exploitation of a NTFS vulnerability as reported without many details via Twitter

rules.name: Sysmon Application Crashed
rules.description: Detects application popup reporting a failure of the Sysmon service

rules.name: Certificate Request Export to Exchange Webserver
rules.description: Detects a write of an Exchange CSR to an untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell

rules.name: MSExchange Transport Agent Installation - Builtin
rules.description: Detects the Installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

rules.name: Exchange Set OabVirtualDirectory ExternalUrl Property
rules.description: Rule to detect an adversary setting OabVirtualDirectory External URL property to a script in Exchange Management log

rules.name: Failed MSExchange Transport Agent Installation
rules.description: Detects a failed installation of a Exchange Transport Agent

rules.name: Remove Exported Mailbox from Exchange Webserver
rules.description: Detects removal of an exported Exchange mailbox which could be to cover tracks from ProxyShell exploit

rules.name: ProxyLogon MSExchange OabVirtualDirectory
rules.description: Detects specific patterns found after a successful ProxyLogon exploitation in relation to a Commandlet invocation of Set-OabVirtualDirectory

rules.name: Mailbox Export to Exchange Webserver
rules.description: Detects a successful export of an Exchange mailbox to untypical directory or with aspx name suffix which can be used to place a webshell or the needed role assignment for it

rules.name: Suspicious Rejected SMB Guest Logon From IP
rules.description: Detect Attempt PrintNightmare (CVE-2021-1675) Remote code execution in Windows Spooler Service

rules.name: Windows Defender Exploit Guard Tamper
rules.description: Detects when someone is adding or removing applications or folders from exploit guard "ProtectedFolders" or "AllowedApplications"

rules.name: Win Defender Restored Quarantine File
rules.description: Detects the restoration of files from the defender quarantine

rules.name: PSExec and WMI Process Creations Block
rules.description: Detects blocking of process creations originating from PSExec and WMI commands

rules.name: Microsoft Defender Tamper Protection Trigger
rules.description: Detects blocked attempts to change any of Defender's settings such as "Real Time Monitoring" and "Behavior Monitoring"

rules.name: Windows Defender Grace Period Expired
rules.description: Detects the expiration of the grace period of Windows Defender. This means protection against viruses, spyware, and other potentially unwanted software is disabled.

rules.name: Windows Defender Threat Detected
rules.description: Detects actions taken by Windows Defender malware detection engines

rules.name: Windows Defender AMSI Trigger Detected
rules.description: Detects triggering of AMSI by Windows Defender.

rules.name: Windows Defender Real-time Protection Disabled
rules.description: Detects disabling of Windows Defender Real-time Protection. As this event doesn't contain a lot of information on who initiated this action you might want to reduce it to a "medium" level if this occurs too many times in your environment

rules.name: LSASS Access Detected via Attack Surface Reduction
rules.description: Detects Access to LSASS Process

rules.name: Windows Defender Real-Time Protection Failure/Restart
rules.description: Detects issues with Windows Defender Real-Time Protection features

rules.name: Windows Defender Malware Detection History Deletion
rules.description: Windows Defender logs when the history of detected infections is deleted.

rules.name: Windows Defender Submit Sample Feature Disabled
rules.description: Detects disabling of the "Automatic Sample Submission" feature of Windows Defender.

rules.name: Windows Defender Configuration Changes
rules.description: Detects suspicious changes to the Windows Defender configuration

rules.name: Windows Defender Virus Scanning Feature Disabled
rules.description: Detects disabling of the Windows Defender virus scanning feature

rules.name: Windows Defender Exclusions Added
rules.description: Detects the Setting of Windows Defender Exclusions

rules.name: Windows Defender Malware And PUA Scanning Disabled
rules.description: Detects disabling of the Windows Defender feature of scanning for malware and other potentially unwanted software

rules.name: Query Tor Onion Address - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects DNS resolution of an .onion address related to Tor routing networks

rules.name: DNS Query To Put.io - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to "Put.io" sharing website.

rules.name: DNS Query for Anonfiles.com Domain - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for anonfiles.com, which is an anonymous file upload platform often used for malicious purposes

rules.name: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

rules.name: DNS Query To Ufile.io - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects DNS queries to "ufile.io", which was seen abused by malware and threat actors as a method for data exfiltration

rules.name: DNS Query To MEGA Hosting Website - DNS Client
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to MEGA sharing website

rules.name: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash
rules.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine

rules.name: Potential Credential Dumping Via WER - Application
rules.description: Detects Windows error reporting event where the process that crashed is lsass. This could be the cause of an intentional crash by techniques such as Lsass-Shtinkering to dump credential

rules.name: Audit CVE Event
rules.description:
Detects events generated by user-mode applications when they call the CveEventWrite API when a known vulnerability is trying to be exploited.
MS started using this log in Jan. 2020 with CVE-2020-0601 (a Windows CryptoAPI vulnerability.
Unfortunately, that is about the only instance of CVEs being written to this log.

rules.name: Relevant Anti-Virus Signature Keywords In Application Log
rules.description: Detects potentially highly relevant antivirus events in the application log based on known virus signature names and malware keywords.

rules.name: Restricted Software Access By SRP
rules.description: Detects restricted access to applications by the Software Restriction Policies (SRP) policy

rules.name: Atera Agent Installation
rules.description: Detects successful installation of Atera Remote Monitoring & Management (RMM) agent as recently found to be used by Conti operators

rules.name: Application Uninstalled
rules.description: An application has been removed. Check if it is critical.

rules.name: MSI Installation From Suspicious Locations
rules.description: Detects MSI package installation from suspicious locations

rules.name: MSI Installation From Web
rules.description: Detects installation of a remote msi file from web.

rules.name: MSSQL XPCmdshell Option Change
rules.description: Detects when the MSSQL "xp_cmdshell" stored procedure setting is changed.

rules.name: MSSQL Disable Audit Settings
rules.description: Detects when an attacker calls the "ALTER SERVER AUDIT" or "DROP SERVER AUDIT" transaction in order to delete or disable audit logs on the server

rules.name: MSSQL Add Account To Sysadmin Role
rules.description: Detects when an attacker tries to backdoor the MSSQL server by adding a backdoor account to the sysadmin fixed server role

rules.name: MSSQL Server Failed Logon
rules.description: Detects failed logon attempts from clients to MSSQL server.

rules.name: MSSQL Server Failed Logon From External Network
rules.description: Detects failed logon attempts from clients with external network IP to an MSSQL server. This can be a sign of a bruteforce attack.

rules.name: MSSQL SPProcoption Set
rules.description: Detects when the a stored procedure is set or cleared for automatic execution in MSSQL. A stored procedure that is set to automatic execution runs every time an instance of SQL Server is started

rules.name: MSSQL XPCmdshell Suspicious Execution
rules.description: Detects when the MSSQL "xp_cmdshell" stored procedure is used to execute commands

rules.name: Dump Ntds.dit To Suspicious Location
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of ntdsutil to dump ntds.dit database to a suspicious location

rules.name: Ntdsutil Abuse
rules.description: Detects potential abuse of ntdsutil to dump ntds.dit database

rules.name: Backup Catalog Deleted
rules.description: Detects backup catalog deletions

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect Command Execution
rules.description: Detects command execution via ScreenConnect RMM

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - ScreenConnect File Transfer
rules.description: Detects file being transferred via ScreenConnect RMM

rules.name: Microsoft Malware Protection Engine Crash - WER
rules.description: This rule detects a suspicious crash of the Microsoft Malware Protection Engine

rules.name: USB Device Plugged
rules.description: Detects plugged/unplugged USB devices

rules.name: Deployment AppX Package Was Blocked By AppLocker
rules.description: Detects an appx package deployment that was blocked by AppLocker policy

rules.name: Suspicious AppX Package Locations
rules.description: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in suspicious locations

rules.name: Deployment Of The AppX Package Was Blocked By The Policy
rules.description: Detects an appx package deployment that was blocked by the local computer policy

rules.name: Suspicious Remote AppX Package Locations
rules.description: Detects an appx package added to the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which was downloaded from a suspicious domain.

rules.name: Uncommon AppX Package Locations
rules.description: Detects an appx package added the pipeline of the "to be processed" packages which is located in uncommon locations

rules.name: Potential Malicious AppX Package Installation Attempts
rules.description: Detects potential installation or installation attempts of known malicious appx packages

rules.name: Suspicious AppX Package Installation Attempt
rules.description: Detects an appx package installation with the error code "0x80073cff" which indicates that the package didn't meet the signing requirements and could be suspicious

rules.name: Standard User In High Privileged Group
rules.description: Detect standard users login that are part of high privileged groups such as the Administrator group

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Driver Load With Revoked Certificate
rules.description: Detects blocked load attempts of revoked drivers

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Disallowed File For Protected Processes Has Been Blocked
rules.description: Detects block events for files that are disallowed by code integrity for protected processes

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Image Load With Revoked Certificate
rules.description: Detects blocked image load events with revoked certificates by code integrity.

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Unmet Signing Level Requirements By File Under Validation
rules.description:
Detects attempted file load events that did not meet the signing level requirements. It often means the file's signature is revoked or a signature with the Lifetime Signing EKU has expired.
This event is best correlated with EID 3089 to determine the error of the validation.

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Unsigned Image Loaded
rules.description: Detects loaded unsigned image on the system

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Revoked Image Loaded
rules.description: Detects image load events with revoked certificates by code integrity.

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Revoked Kernel Driver Loaded
rules.description: Detects the load of a revoked kernel driver

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Unmet WHQL Requirements For Loaded Kernel Module
rules.description: Detects loaded kernel modules that did not meet the WHQL signing requirements.

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Unsigned Kernel Module Loaded
rules.description: Detects the presence of a loaded unsigned kernel module on the system.

rules.name: CodeIntegrity - Blocked Image/Driver Load For Policy Violation
rules.description: Detects blocked load events that did not meet the authenticode signing level requirements or violated the code integrity policy.

rules.name: Loading Diagcab Package From Remote Path
rules.description: Detects loading of diagcab packages from a remote path, as seen in DogWalk vulnerability

rules.name: DNS Query To Visual Studio Code Tunnels Domain
rules.description: Detects DNS query requests to Visual Studio Code tunnel domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: TeamViewer Domain Query By Non-TeamViewer Application
rules.description: Detects DNS queries to a TeamViewer domain only resolved by a TeamViewer client by an image that isn't named TeamViewer (sometimes used by threat actors for obfuscation)

rules.name: DNS Query To AzureWebsites.NET By Non-Browser Process
rules.description: Detects a DNS query by a non browser process on the system to "azurewebsites.net". The latter was often used by threat actors as a malware hosting and exfiltration site.

rules.name: DNS Query Request To OneLaunch Update Service
rules.description:
Detects DNS query requests to "update.onelaunch.com". This domain is associated with the OneLaunch adware application.
When the OneLaunch application is installed it will attempt to get updates from this domain.

rules.name: DNS Query To Devtunnels Domain
rules.description: Detects DNS query requests to Devtunnels domains. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: Cloudflared Tunnels Related DNS Requests
rules.description:
Detects DNS requests to Cloudflared tunnels domains.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: DNS HybridConnectionManager Service Bus
rules.description: Detects Azure Hybrid Connection Manager services querying the Azure service bus service

rules.name: DNS Query Request By Regsvr32.EXE
rules.description: Detects DNS queries initiated by "Regsvr32.exe"

rules.name: DNS Query Request By QuickAssist.EXE
rules.description: Detects DNS queries initiated by "QuickAssist.exe" to Microsoft Quick Assist primary endpoint that is used to establish a session.

rules.name: DNS Server Discovery Via LDAP Query
rules.description: Detects DNS server discovery via LDAP query requests from uncommon applications

rules.name: DNS Query for Anonfiles.com Domain - Sysmon
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for "anonfiles.com", which is an anonymous file upload platform often used for malicious purposes

rules.name: DNS Query To Ufile.io
rules.description: Detects DNS queries to "ufile.io", which was seen abused by malware and threat actors as a method for data exfiltration

rules.name: Suspicious DNS Query for IP Lookup Service APIs
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for IP lookup services such as "api.ipify.org" originating from a non browser process.

rules.name: DNS Query Tor .Onion Address - Sysmon
rules.description: Detects DNS queries to an ".onion" address related to Tor routing networks

rules.name: AppX Package Installation Attempts Via AppInstaller.EXE
rules.description: Detects DNS queries made by "AppInstaller.EXE". The AppInstaller is the default handler for the "ms-appinstaller" URI. It attempts to load/install a package from the referenced URL

rules.name: DNS Query To MEGA Hosting Website
rules.description: Detects DNS queries for subdomains related to MEGA sharing website

rules.name: DNS Query To Remote Access Software Domain From Non-Browser App
rules.description:
An adversary may use legitimate desktop support and remote access software, such as Team Viewer, Go2Assist, LogMein, AmmyyAdmin, etc, to establish an interactive command and control channel to target systems within networks.
These services are commonly used as legitimate technical support software, and may be allowed by application control within a target environment.
Remote access tools like VNC, Ammyy, and Teamviewer are used frequently when compared with other legitimate software commonly used by adversaries. (Citation: Symantec Living off the Land)

rules.name: Suspicious Cobalt Strike DNS Beaconing - Sysmon
rules.description: Detects a program that invoked suspicious DNS queries known from Cobalt Strike beacons

rules.name: New Connection Initiated To Potential Dead Drop Resolver Domain
rules.description:
Detects an executable, which is not an internet browser or known application, initiating network connections to legit popular websites, which were seen to be used as dead drop resolvers in previous attacks.
In this context attackers leverage known websites such as "facebook", "youtube", etc. In order to pass through undetected.

rules.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Cmstp.EXE
rules.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by Cmstp.EXE
Its uncommon for "cmstp.exe" to initiate an outbound network connection. Investigate the source of such requests to determine if they are malicious.

rules.name: Uncommon Connection to Active Directory Web Services
rules.description: Detects uncommon network connections to the Active Directory Web Services (ADWS) from processes not typically associated with ADWS management.

rules.name: Uncommon Network Connection Initiated By Certutil.EXE
rules.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by the certutil.exe utility.
Attackers can abuse the utility in order to download malware or additional payloads.

rules.name: Suspicious Wordpad Outbound Connections
rules.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by "wordpad.exe" over uncommon destination ports.
This might indicate potential process injection activity from a beacon or similar mechanisms.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated By AddinUtil.EXE
rules.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by the Add-In deployment cache updating utility "AddInutil.exe".
This could indicate a potential command and control communication as this tool doesn't usually initiate network activity.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To AzureWebsites.NET By Non-Browser Process
rules.description: Detects an initiated network connection by a non browser process on the system to "azurewebsites.net". The latter was often used by threat actors as a malware hosting and exfiltration site.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To Mega.nz
rules.description:
Detects a network connection initiated by a binary to "api.mega.co.nz".
Attackers were seen abusing file sharing websites similar to "mega.nz" in order to upload/download additional payloads.

rules.name: Outbound RDP Connections Over Non-Standard Tools
rules.description:
Detects Non-Standard tools initiating a connection over port 3389 indicating possible lateral movement.
An initial baseline is required before using this utility to exclude third party RDP tooling that you might use.

rules.name: Uncommon Outbound Kerberos Connection
rules.description: Detects uncommon outbound network activity via Kerberos default port indicating possible lateral movement or first stage PrivEsc via delegation.

rules.name: Communication To Ngrok Tunneling Service Initiated
rules.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "ngrok" tunneling domains.
Attackers were seen using this "ngrok" in order to store their second stage payloads and malware.
While communication with such domains can be legitimate, often times is a sign of either data exfiltration by malicious actors or additional download.

rules.name: Local Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
rules.description: Detects a script interpreter (Wscript/Cscript) initiating a local network connection to download or execute a script hosted on a shared folder.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To Cloudflared Tunnels Domains
rules.description:
Detects network connections to Cloudflared tunnels domains initiated by a process on the system.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: RDP to HTTP or HTTPS Target Ports
rules.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating to target systems on TCP port 80 or 443

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Malware Callback Communication
rules.description: Detects programs that connect to known malware callback ports based on statistical analysis from two different sandbox system databases

rules.name: Suspicious Network Connection Binary No CommandLine
rules.description: Detects suspicious network connections made by a well-known Windows binary run with no command line parameters

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated By Eqnedt32.EXE
rules.description: Detects network connections from the Equation Editor process "eqnedt32.exe".

rules.name: RegAsm.EXE Initiating Network Connection To Public IP
rules.description: Detects "RegAsm.exe" initiating a network connection to public IP adresses

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Wuauclt Network Connection
rules.description:
Detects the use of the Windows Update Client binary (wuauclt.exe) to proxy execute code and making network connections.
One could easily make the DLL spawn a new process and inject to it to proxy the network connection and bypass this rule.

rules.name: Python Initiated Connection
rules.description: Detects a Python process initiating a network connection. While this often relates to package installation, it can also indicate a potential malicious script communicating with a C&C server.

rules.name: Office Application Initiated Network Connection Over Uncommon Ports
rules.description: Detects an office suit application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) communicating to target systems over uncommon ports.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated From Process Located In Potentially Suspicious Or Uncommon Location
rules.description: Detects a network connection initiated by programs or processes running from suspicious or uncommon files system locations.

rules.name: Suspicious Network Connection to IP Lookup Service APIs
rules.description: Detects external IP address lookups by non-browser processes via services such as "api.ipify.org". This could be indicative of potential post compromise internet test activity.

rules.name: Suspicious Non-Browser Network Communication With Google API
rules.description: Detects a non-browser process interacting with the Google API which could indicate the use of a covert C2 such as Google Sheet C2 (GC2-sheet)

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated By IMEWDBLD.EXE
rules.description: Detects a network connection initiated by IMEWDBLD.EXE. This might indicate potential abuse of the utility as a LOLBIN in order to download arbitrary files or additional payloads.

rules.name: Potential Remote PowerShell Session Initiated
rules.description:
Detects a process that initiated a network connection over ports 5985 or 5986 from a non-network service account.
This could potentially indicates a remote PowerShell connection.

rules.name: Suspicious Outbound SMTP Connections
rules.description:
Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an un-encrypted network protocol other than that of the existing command and control channel.
The data may also be sent to an alternate network location from the main command and control server.

rules.name: Communication To Uncommon Destination Ports
rules.description: Detects programs that connect to uncommon destination ports

rules.name: Outbound Network Connection To Public IP Via Winlogon
rules.description: Detects a "winlogon.exe" process that initiate network communications with public IP addresses

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated Via Notepad.EXE
rules.description:
Detects a network connection that is initiated by the "notepad.exe" process.
This might be a sign of process injection from a beacon process or something similar.
Notepad rarely initiates a network communication except when printing documents for example.

rules.name: Suspicious Non-Browser Network Communication With Telegram API
rules.description: Detects an a non-browser process interacting with the Telegram API which could indicate use of a covert C2

rules.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Microsoft Dialer
rules.description:
Detects outbound network connection initiated by Microsoft Dialer.
The Microsoft Dialer, also known as Phone Dialer, is a built-in utility application included in various versions of the Microsoft Windows operating system. Its primary function is to provide users with a graphical interface for managing phone calls via a modem or a phone line connected to the computer.
This is an outdated process in the current conext of it's usage and is a common target for info stealers for process injection, and is used to make C2 connections, common example is "Rhadamanthys"

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious Network Connection To Notion API
rules.description: Detects a non-browser process communicating with the Notion API. This could indicate potential use of a covert C2 channel such as "OffensiveNotion C2"

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To BTunnels Domains
rules.description:
Detects network connections to BTunnels domains initiated by a process on the system.
Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: Microsoft Sync Center Suspicious Network Connections
rules.description: Detects suspicious connections from Microsoft Sync Center to non-private IPs.

rules.name: Rundll32 Internet Connection
rules.description: Detects a rundll32 that communicates with public IP addresses

rules.name: Outbound Network Connection Initiated By Script Interpreter
rules.description: Detects a script interpreter wscript/cscript opening a network connection to a non-local network. Adversaries may use script to download malicious payloads.

rules.name: Network Communication With Crypto Mining Pool
rules.description: Detects initiated network connections to crypto mining pools

rules.name: Suspicious Dropbox API Usage
rules.description: Detects an executable that isn't dropbox but communicates with the Dropbox API

rules.name: Process Initiated Network  Connection To Ngrok Domain
rules.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "ngrok" domains.
Attackers were seen using this "ngrok" in order to store their second stage payloads and malware.
While communication with such domains can be legitimate, often times is a sign of either data exfiltration by malicious actors or additional download.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated By Regsvr32.EXE
rules.description: Detects a network connection initiated by "Regsvr32.exe"

rules.name: Network Communication Initiated To File Sharing Domains From Process Located In Suspicious Folder
rules.description: Detects executables located in potentially suspicious directories initiating network connections towards file sharing domains.

rules.name: Remote Access Tool - AnyDesk Incoming Connection
rules.description: Detects incoming connections to AnyDesk. This could indicate a potential remote attacker trying to connect to a listening instance of AnyDesk and use it as potential command and control channel.

rules.name: Network Communication Initiated To Portmap.IO Domain
rules.description: Detects an executable accessing the portmap.io domain, which could be a sign of forbidden C2 traffic or data exfiltration by malicious actors

rules.name: RDP Over Reverse SSH Tunnel
rules.description: Detects svchost hosting RDP termsvcs communicating with the loopback address and on TCP port 3389

rules.name: Office Application Initiated Network Connection To Non-Local IP
rules.description:
Detects an office application (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)  that initiate a network connection to a non-private IP addresses.
This rule aims to detect traffic similar to one seen exploited in CVE-2021-42292.
This rule will require an initial baseline and tuning that is specific to your organization.

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To DevTunnels Domain
rules.description: Detects network connections to Devtunnels domains initiated by a process on a system. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: Silenttrinity Stager Msbuild Activity
rules.description: Detects a possible remote connections to Silenttrinity c2

rules.name: Network Connection Initiated To Visual Studio Code Tunnels Domain
rules.description: Detects network connections to Visual Studio Code tunnel domains initiated by a process on a system. Attackers can abuse that feature to establish a reverse shell or persistence on a machine.

rules.name: Communication To LocaltoNet Tunneling Service Initiated
rules.description:
Detects an executable initiating a network connection to "LocaltoNet" tunneling sub-domains.
LocaltoNet is a reverse proxy that enables localhost services to be exposed to the Internet.
Attackers have been seen to use this service for command-and-control activities to bypass MFA and perimeter controls.

rules.name: Unusual File Download from Direct IP Address
rules.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from URLs with IP

rules.name: Potentially Suspicious File Download From ZIP TLD
rules.description: Detects the download of a file with a potentially suspicious extension from a .zip top level domain.

rules.name: Creation Of a Suspicious ADS File Outside a Browser Download
rules.description: Detects the creation of a suspicious ADS (Alternate Data Stream) file by software other than browsers

rules.name: Unusual File Download From File Sharing Websites - File Stream
rules.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from a well-known file and paste sharing domain

rules.name: Hidden Executable In NTFS Alternate Data Stream
rules.description: Detects the creation of an ADS (Alternate Data Stream) that contains an executable by looking at a non-empty Imphash

rules.name: Potential Suspicious Winget Package Installation
rules.description: Detects potential suspicious winget package installation from a suspicious source.

rules.name: Exports Registry Key To an Alternate Data Stream
rules.description: Exports the target Registry key and hides it in the specified alternate data stream.

rules.name: Suspicious File Download From File Sharing Websites -  File Stream
rules.description: Detects the download of suspicious file type from a well-known file and paste sharing domain

rules.name: HackTool Named File Stream Created
rules.description: Detects the creation of a named file stream with the imphash of a well-known hack tool
